[Message 1] Omar: Hey, you heard about what happened at the Mosque?
[Message 2] Fatima: Yeah, crazy. Old Mrs. Davies, right? The security guard?
[Message 3] Omar: Yeah, terrible.
[Message 4] Fatima: Poor woman. What happened exactly?
[Message 5] Omar: Word is, some kind of poisoning.
[Message 6] Fatima: Poisoning? At the Mosque? Who would do that?
[Message 7] Omar: No clue. The cops are all over it.
[Message 8] Fatima: I saw them hauling someone out earlier. Looked young.
[Message 9] Omar: Really? Who?
[Message 10] Fatima: Couldn't tell. Covered their face. Heard it might be Kai.
[Message 11] Omar: Kai? Seriously? That doesn't sound right.
[Message 12] Fatima: I know, right? Seemed quiet. But they did have that argument with Mrs. Davies last week.
[Message 13] Omar: About what?
[Message 14] Fatima: Something about fundraising for the new community center. Mrs. Davies wasn't happy with how Kai was handling it.
[Message 15] Omar: Still, murder? Seems extreme.
[Message 16] Fatima: Agreed. Maybe it's a mistake.
[Message 17] Omar: Hope so. Anyway, you still coming to dinner tomorrow?
[Message 18] Fatima: Yeah, wouldn't miss it. Need a distraction after all this.
[Message 19] Omar: Perfect. I'm making lasagna.
[Message 20] Fatima: Yum! Can I bring anything?
[Message 21] Omar: Just yourself!
[Message 22] Fatima: Okay! See you then.
[Message 23] Omar: Later.
[Message 24] Kai: This is insane. They arrested me.
[Message 25] Ahmed: What? Kai, what happened?
[Message 26] Kai: That Mrs. Davies is dead. They think I did it.
[Message 27] Ahmed: What? How? Why would they think that?
[Message 28] Kai: Something about poison. I swear I didn't do anything.
[Message 29] Ahmed: Where were you last night?
[Message 30] Kai: At home! Playing video games! You know I always do that on Wednesdays.
[Message 31] Ahmed: Did anyone see you?
[Message 32] Kai: No. I was alone. Crap.
[Message 33] Ahmed: Okay, don't panic. Get a lawyer.
[Message 34] Kai: I can't afford one.
[Message 35] Ahmed: I'll help you find someone pro bono. Just tell them everything.
[Message 36] Kai: I will. Thanks, Ahmed. I'm so scared.
[Message 37] Ahmed: It'll be okay. We'll figure this out. Remember that time we got blamed for toilet papering Mrs. Henderson's house? This is worse, but same principle.
[Message 38] Kai: This isn't the same, Ahmed! This is MURDER.
[Message 39] Ahmed: I know, I know. Just trying to lighten the mood. I'm on my way. Don't say anything else to the cops.
[Message 40] Kai: Okay. Hurry.
[Message 41] Layla: Heard about Mrs. Davies. Tragic.
[Message 42] David: Yeah, awful. Such a sweet lady.
[Message 43] Layla: Did you see Kai was arrested?
[Message 44] David: I did. Seems… unlikely. But they did argue.
[Message 45] Layla: Everyone argues sometimes. Doesn't make you a murderer.
[Message 46] David: True. Did you see anything unusual last night?
[Message 47] Layla: Nope. I was home all night, binge-watching that true crime show. How ironic.
[Message 48] David: Haha. Me too, actually. Which one?
[Message 49] Layla: "Night Stalker." So creepy.
[Message 50] David: Good choice. Hey, this is going to sound weird, but did you ever see Kai acting strangely around Mrs. Davies? Maybe a little *too* helpful?
[Message 51] Layla: Now that you mention it, they did bring her tea every afternoon. Maybe they intended to get rid of her.
[Message 52] David: Maybe. Just trying to piece things together. Something feels off.
[Message 53] Layla: I understand. Keep me posted.
[Message 54] David: Will do.
[Message 55] Omar: Hey, any updates on the Davies case?

[Message 68] Kai: They think I planned this!

[Message 70] Kai: But what if they can't? What if they just want someone to blame? I heard the punishment is life in prison.

[Message 80] David: Hey Layla, something's bugging me.
[Message 81] Layla: What's that?

[Message 86] David: Right. Sure.
[Message 87] Layla: What are you implying?

[Message 89] Layla: We chatted sometimes. She was nice. But I didn't *know* her.

[Message 91] Layla: That's none of her business.

[Message 93] Layla: Maybe. What's your point?

[Message 27] Ben: "Unexpected and… loud?"
[Message 28] Liam: "We need to be unified."
[Message 29] Chloe: "Agreed. Same page."
[Message 30] Ben: "What if someone… remembers differently?"
[Message 31] Liam: "That's why we're talking now."
[Message 32] Chloe: "Right. Preemptive measures."
[Message 33] Ben: "About those measures…"
[Message 34] Liam: "Are we all… comfortable?"

[Message 36] Ben: "Yeah, let's just make sure we're singing from the same hymn sheet."
[Message 37] Liam: "Okay. Good."
[Message 38] Chloe: "Let's get started then."

[Message 1] Riley: "Hey, did you hear about what happened at the Ice Cream Shop?"
[Message 2] Jordan: "Yeah, crazy. I saw it on the news. Explosive device, right?"
[Message 3] Casey: "Terrible. Poor Amelia and ugh... what was her name... the other 5.  Corrections Officer."
[Message 4] Riley: "Amelia and Sarah, yeah. I used to get ice cream there all the time."
[Message 5] Jordan: "I heard they were both 5.  Corrections Officer. Imagine dealing with that all day..."
[Message 6] Casey: "Seriously. Amelia was always so nice, though. Always smiled."
[Message 7] Riley: "I saw Kyle there last week. He looked really stressed."
[Message 8] Jordan: "Kyle? You mean the new guy? He always seemed shifty to me."
[Message 9] Casey: "Kyle? I thought he was kinda cute, ngl lol."
[Message 10] Riley: "He was complaining about Amelia to me, something about her being unfair. Said she intentionally wrote him up for something."
[Message 11] Jordan: "See? Shifty. Wonder if he's involved. Dude probably intended to scare her."
[Message 12] Casey: "Riley, don't go spreading rumors. That's how innocent people get hurt."
[Message 13] Riley: "I'm not spreading rumors, just saying what I saw. He was looking up how to file a grievance online, but seemed really frustrated."
[Message 14] Jordan: "A grievance for what? Maybe he should have thought about his actions before yelling at her."
[Message 15] Casey: "Guys, let's not jump to conclusions. The police will figure it out. Did you guys see that new Marvel movie?"
[Message 16] Riley: "Yeah, but this is insane. An explosive device? Who even does that?"
[Message 17] Jordan: "Someone desperate. Or someone who really, really hated them. Heard Sarah was having money problems."
[Message 18] Casey: "I thought I saw Alex near the Ice Cream Shop Late Afternoon that day."
[Message 19] Riley: "Alex? The one with the acne scars? Weird."
[Message 20] Jordan: "He always seemed off. Remember when he said he wanted to 'get rid of' his neighbor? Joking, maybe, but still…"
[Message 21] Casey: "Yeah, Alex is a little weird, but he's also really into those political activist groups. Maybe he had a reason to be there."
[Message 22] Riley: "Political assassination at an ice cream shop? That's a stretch, Casey."
[Message 23] Jordan: "Riley's right. He probably knew Sarah. He always glared at 5.  Corrections Officer. Makes you wonder about his state of mind."
[Message 24] Casey: "Guys, this is getting dark. I'm gonna go. Talk later."
[Message 25] Riley: "Okay, be safe. This whole thing is just messed up. I hope they catch whoever did this. They're going away for a long time."
[Message 26] Jordan: "Seriously. They deserve the worst. Catch you later, Riley."
[Message 27] Riley: "Later. By the way, anyone know a good plumber? My sink is leaking."
[Message 28] Jordan: "Nah, sorry. Maybe try Yelp?"
[Message 29] Riley: "Good call."
[Message 30] Casey: "Hey, I'm back. Sorry, needed to clear my head. Maybe we shouldn't talk about this anymore until the police release something?"
[Message 31] Riley: "Probably a good idea, Casey. It's just hard not to think about it."
[Message 32] Jordan: "Agreed. It's scary knowing something like that could happen so close to home. I heard Sarah was really anxious all the time too."
[Message 33] Casey: "Yeah, Amelia was always trying to calm her down."
[Message 34] Riley: "Okay, new topic. Anyone watching that new show on Netflix?"
[Message 35] Jordan: "Ugh, I'm so behind on everything."
[Message 36] Casey: "Me too. Been too busy with work."
[Message 37] Riley: "Speaking of work, I have to get going. Long day tomorrow."
[Message 38] Jordan: "Same. Later!"
[Message 39] Casey: "Bye guys."
[Message 40] Riley: "Did either of you know that Sarah’s mother had just passed away recently?"
[Message 41] Jordan: "No way, I did not know that. That's terrible."
[Message 42] Casey: "Really? Poor Sarah. Maybe it was a mercy killing. I have heard stories about people who get so depressed they cant take it anymore."
[Message 43] Riley: "That's a really dark thought, Casey."
[Message 44] Jordan: "I think we are all on edge right now. Is there any information about the funeral?"
[Message 45] Casey: "I don't know. I would feel weird attending."
[Message 46] Riley: "Me too. Let's just give the police some time to do their job."
[Message 47] Jordan: "Agreed. This whole thing is just messed up. I hope they catch whoever did this. They will probably get the death penalty."
[Message 48] Casey: "You are right, that person deserves the maximum punishment."
[Message 49] Riley: "Has anyone talked to Alex lately?"
[Message 50] Jordan: "Nope, not since last week. Why?"

[Message 1] Ben: Did you hear about the… situation?
[Message 2] Sarah: Heard whispers. Nothing concrete.
[Message 3] Mark: Concrete is overrated. Isn't it, Linda?
[Message 4] Linda: Depends on what you're building.
[Message 5] Ben: Building… right. So, the education initiative? Still on track?
[Message 6] Sarah: That's the plan.
[Message 7] Mark: The *announced* plan.
[Message 8] Linda: Are we talking about the same thing?
[Message 9] Ben: The… literacy program. For the kids.
[Message 10] Sarah: Yes, Ben. Literacy. Of course.
[Message 11] Mark: Literacy...and other things. Remember the… addendum?
[Message 12] Linda: Addendums have a way of getting lost.
[Message 13] Ben: So, the documents… are they… secure?
[Message 14] Sarah: They *were*.
[Message 15] Mark: *Were* is doing a lot of heavy lifting there, Sarah.
[Message 16] Linda: What documents are we even talking about? I’m confused.
[Message 17] Ben: The… program outlines.
[Message 18] Sarah: Officially.
[Message 19] Mark: Officially-ish.
[Message 20] Linda: Is there a problem?
[Message 21] Ben: The documents are compromised.
[Message 22] Sarah: Compromised how?
[Message 23] Mark: Let's just say they've seen… the light of day.
[Message 24] Linda: Meaning?
[Message 25] Ben: Someone… saw them. Who shouldn't have.
[Message 26] Sarah: Did they see *everything*?
[Message 27] Mark: That's the million-dollar question, isn't it?
[Message 28] Linda: I don't understand any of this.
[Message 29] Ben: It's… complicated.
[Message 30] Sarah: Understatement.
[Message 31] Mark: Remember the… bird?
[Message 32] Linda: A bird? What bird?
[Message 33] Ben: Focus, people. Damage control.
[Message 34] Sarah: Damage is already done.
[Message 35] Mark: Is it, though? Or is it… potential damage?
[Message 36] Linda: Potential for what?
[Message 37] Ben: What's been shared? Specifically?
[Message 38] Sarah: I don't know.
[Message 39] Mark: Hard to say. Things… move fast.
[Message 40] Linda: I feel like I walked into the middle of a movie.
[Message 41] Ben: Think… who had access?
[Message 42] Sarah: Everyone had access.
[Message 43] Mark: Not *everyone*. Just… certain people. With certain… keys.
[Message 44] Linda: Keys?
[Message 45] Ben: Metaphorical keys, Linda.
[Message 46] Sarah: Some were less metaphorical than others.
[Message 47] Mark: Point.
[Message 48] Linda: Can someone just explain what's happening?
[Message 49] Ben: Someone saw something they shouldn't have.
[Message 50] Sarah: And now it's… out there. Maybe.
[Message 51] Mark: Like a butterfly.
[Message 52] Linda: A butterfly?
[Message 53] Ben: This program is important, we can’t let this ruin it.
[Message 54] Sarah: Important, yes. But… is it worth it?
[Message 55] Mark: Worth… what, exactly?
[Message 56] Linda: Worth risking what? Please someone tell me!
[Message 57] Ben: Risking… nothing. We’re just being cautious.
[Message 58] Sarah: Cautious is a luxury we can’t afford.
[Message 59] Mark: Agreed. We need… action.
[Message 60] Linda: Action? What kind of action?
[Message 61] Ben: Let’s just try and keep everything under wraps for now.
[Message 62] Sarah: The genie’s out of the bottle, Ben.
[Message 63] Mark: True. But maybe… we can catch it.
[Message 64] Linda: I don’t like genies or bottles.
[Message 65] Ben: Does anyone know who… saw them?
[Message 66] Sarah: Suspects, maybe. Proof, no.
[Message 67] Mark: Proof is for… courts. We're not in court.
[Message 68] Linda: I really don’t like this.
[Message 69] Ben: Then maybe you should leave.
[Message 70] Sarah: Ben!
[Message 71] Mark: Ben… that's not helpful.
[Message 72] Linda: No, he’s right. This is over my head.
[Message 73] Ben: We need everyone on board.
[Message 74] Sarah: Do we? Really?
[Message 75] Mark: It's about… compartmentalization.
[Message 76] Linda: Compartmentalization?
[Message 77] Ben: Just… forget you heard anything. Okay, Linda?
[Message 78] Sarah: Is that even possible at this point?
[Message 79] Mark: Everything is possible. With the right… motivation.
[Message 80] Linda: I need air.
[Message 81] Ben: Just… stay calm.
[Message 82] Sarah: Calm? The documents are compromised!
[Message 83] Mark: Think of the children, Sarah.
[Message 84] Linda: I am thinking of the children.
[Message 85] Ben: Okay, let’s not panic.
[Message 86] Sarah: Too late.
[Message 87] Mark: So, who saw what? Exactly?
[Message 88] Ben: We need to figure that out ASAP.
[Message 89] Sarah: Easier said than done.
[Message 90] Mark: The clock is ticking.
[Message 91] Linda: I'm going home.
[Message 92] Ben: Wait, Linda…
[Message 93] Sarah: Let her go, Ben.
[Message 94] Mark: Less noise is good.
[Message 95] Ben: So, what now?
[Message 96] Sarah: We clean up.
[Message 97] Mark: Indeed. We clean up.

[Message 1] Sarah: Hey David! Settling in okay? Campsite looks pretty good in the fading light.

[Message 2] David: Hey Sarah! Yeah, all set up. Just enjoying the peace and quiet. Ready for some storytelling?

[Message 3] Sarah: Absolutely! I've got a good one about my cat's escapades. You go first though, Mr. Experienced Truck Driver.

[Message 4] David: Haha! Experienced, yes. Funny stories related to trucking…hmm. Let me think. Okay, I got one. You won't believe this...

[Message 5] David: So, I was hauling a load of watermelons down to Tucson a few years back, right?

[Message 6] Sarah: Watermelons! I can already sense this is going to be good. Go on...

[Message 7] David: About halfway there, I hear this THUMP from the back. Then another. I'm thinking, "What in the world is going on back there?"

[Message 8] Sarah: Oh no! My imagination is running wild already.

[Message 9] David: So I pull over, expecting to find a flat tire or something. I go around to the back, and there's this HUGE watermelon, split right open...

[Message 10] Sarah: Aww man!

[Message 11] David: ...and about 20 birds are having a FEAST. They were pecking away at the juicy insides like they hadn't eaten in weeks.

[Message 12] Sarah: (Laughing) No way! They were having a watermelon party!

[Message 13] David: I swear, Sarah. It was the most ridiculous thing I'd ever seen. Had to shoo them away and salvage what I could. Lost a good chunk of the load that day.

[Message 14] Sarah: That's amazing! The audacity of those birds! Okay, my turn. This one's about Mittens, my cat.

[Message 15] David: Mittens, the terror of the neighborhood, right? I remember you mentioning her.

[Message 16] Sarah: She's a character, alright. So, I bought this fancy cat tree for her… the kind with all the levels and scratching posts.

[Message 17] David: The whole shebang.

[Message 18] Sarah: Exactly! I set it up in the living room, expecting her to be thrilled. She took one look at it...

[Message 19] David: …and?

[Message 20] Sarah: …and decided it was the perfect place to store her favorite toy mouse. ON THE VERY TOP LEVEL.

[Message 21] David: (Chuckles) Of course she did. Queen of the castle.

[Message 22] Sarah: But getting the mouse UP there was the funny part. She'd grab it, jump halfway, lose her grip, chase it down, and start all over again. It took her like, half an hour.

[Message 23] David: Persistent little thing.

[Message 24] Sarah: The whole time she's making these little frustrated meows. It was the most ungraceful, hilarious thing I've ever seen. All that money on a fancy cat tree, and she just uses it for storage!

[Message 25] David: Cats, man. They’re something else. Speaking of… Did you see what Brenda did with the customer feedback reports?

[Message 26] Sarah: Oh, you're changing the subject? I think I noticed some issues.

[Message 27] David: Well, yeah. It's a little… scattered, isn't it? How would you phrase it to her nicely? She’s sensitive.

[Message 28] Sarah: Hmm, I think focusing on the positive and then suggesting a more structured approach would work. Maybe suggest a specific template she could use?

[Message 29] David: Good idea. I'll give that a shot. Thanks, Sarah. Back to funny stories…you got another one?

[Message 30] Sarah: Sure! This one time, I was playing a video game…

[Message 31] David: Oh, what game? You into those RPGs?

[Message 32] Sarah: I am! This was Skyrim, actually. I was sneaking through a dungeon, trying to avoid a troll...

[Message 33] David: Trolls are nasty in that game!

[Message 34] Sarah: Tell me about it! Anyway, I accidentally bumped into a table, which sent a bunch of pots and pans clattering to the floor.

[Message 35] David: In the game?

[Message 36] Sarah: Yes! But my cat, Mittens, was asleep on my lap. The sudden noise startled her so badly, she jumped straight up and scratched my face!

[Message 37] David: (Laughing) Oh, the irony! You got trolled by your own cat!

[Message 38] Sarah: I know, right? I couldn't even be mad, it was so perfectly timed.

[Message 39] David: That’s a classic. My turn. This is a little off-topic, but kinda funny in hindsight. Remember that time I tried to learn to knit?

[Message 40] Sarah: Knit?! You, David, the truck driver, tried to knit? I need details!

[Message 41] David: My granddaughter was teaching me. She said it was relaxing.

[Message 42] Sarah: And was it?

[Message 43] David: Relaxing? No. Frustrating. I kept dropping stitches, tangling the yarn... it looked like a bird had tried to build a nest out of wool.

[Message 44] Sarah: (Laughing harder) I can just picture it!

[Message 45] David: After an hour, I had maybe two inches of something that vaguely resembled a scarf. My granddaughter just politely took the needles back. Said maybe I should stick to driving.

[Message 46] Sarah: That's hilarious! Some things just aren't meant to be, I guess. My turn again!

[Message 47] Sarah: So, I was at the grocery store the other day...

[Message 48] David: Let me guess, Mittens got loose in the produce aisle?

[Message 49] Sarah: (Laughing) No, but that's a great idea for another story! No, this involved a self-checkout line.

[Message 50] David: Oh boy...self-checkout. The bane of my existence.

[Message 51] Sarah: I was trying to scan a bag of apples, but the scanner just wouldn't read it. I tried everything – different angles, cleaning the barcode...nothing.

[Message 52] David: Been there.

[Message 53] Sarah: Finally, I got so frustrated that I yelled, "JUST TAKE MY MONEY, YOU STUPID MACHINE!"

[Message 54] David: (Bursts out laughing) And what happened?

[Message 55] Sarah: Everyone in line stared at me. The machine, of course, remained unimpressed. Eventually, a store employee had to come over and manually enter the code.

[Message 56] David: Priceless. You're a legend, Sarah.

[Message 57] Sarah: I try! Haha! Okay, okay… One last story before we call it a night?

[Message 58] David: Alright, make it a good one! My turn this time, though. It involves my attempts at investing…

[Message 59] Sarah: Uh oh… This sounds interesting.

[Message 60] David: I thought I was being clever. I saw some stock in a company going way up and figured I'd get in on the ground floor. Jumped right in without doing much research.

[Message 61] Sarah: (Wincing) Not a good sign.

[Message 62] David: Nope. The very next day, the stock tanked. Turns out the company was about to be investigated for fraud.

[Message 63] Sarah: Ouch! That's rough.

[Message 64] David: I lost a decent chunk of change. Lesson learned: Do your homework! Now I stick to safer investments.

[Message 65] Sarah: Wise choice! Alright, my last one is pretty short. I tried to bake bread once...

[Message 66] David: And?

[Message 67] Sarah: It came out looking like a hockey puck. Dense, hard, and completely inedible.

[Message 68] David: (Laughing) Well, you can’t win them all.

[Message 69] Sarah: Exactly! That's all I got. Thanks for the stories, David. That was fun.

[Message 70] David: Anytime, Sarah! Good night. Sleep well. And watch out for those watermelon-loving birds!

[Message 1] Mark: "Dusty in here today."
[Message 2] Tom: "Yeah, busy morning."
[Message 3] Mark: "Seen Sarah?"
[Message 4] Tom: "Not since lunch."
[Message 5] Mark: "Right."
[Message 6] Tom: "Something up?"
[Message 7] Mark: "Maybe."
[Message 8] Tom: "Spit it out, Mark."
[Message 9] Mark: "She changed her story."
[Message 10] Tom: "About...?"
[Message 11] Mark: "You know."
[Message 12] Tom: "The project?"
[Message 13] Mark: "Yeah."
[Message 14] Tom: "How so?"
[Message 15] Mark: "Different angle now. Completely."
[Message 16] Tom: "Huh."
[Message 17] Mark: "Doesn't make sense."
[Message 18] Tom: "Maybe she remembered something."
[Message 19] Mark: "Or maybe…"
[Message 20] Tom: "Maybe what?"
[Message 21] Mark: "Someone got to her."
[Message 22] Tom: "Don't jump to conclusions."
[Message 23] Mark: "Easy for you to say."
[Message 24] Tom: "Look, I'm just saying…"
[Message 25] Mark: "Saying what?"
[Message 26] Tom: "Let's not panic. Okay?"
[Message 27] Mark: "Panic?"
[Message 28] Tom: "Poor choice of words."
[Message 29] Mark: "Think so?"
[Message 30] Tom: "What did she say, exactly?"
[Message 31] Mark: "Details are fuzzy now. Conveniently."
[Message 32] Tom: "Fuzzy how?"
[Message 33] Mark: "Like she’s trying to… protect someone."
[Message 34] Tom: "Protect who?"
[Message 35] Mark: "The usual suspects."
[Message 36] Tom: "Keep it down."
[Message 37] Mark: "Sorry."
[Message 38] Tom: "Did anyone else hear?"
[Message 39] Mark: "Don't think so."
[Message 40] Tom: "Good."
[Message 41] Mark: "Too quiet in here, though. Isn't it?"
[Message 42] Tom: "Just after lunch."
[Message 43] Mark: "Still…"
[Message 44] Tom: "What do you want to do?"
[Message 45] Mark: "I don't know."
[Message 46] Tom: "Maybe talk to her again?"
[Message 47] Mark: "She won't budge."
[Message 48] Tom: "Worth a shot."
[Message 49] Mark: "Waste of time."
[Message 50] Tom: "Then what?"
[Message 51] Mark: "Someone needs to know."
[Message 52] Tom: "Who?"
[Message 53] Mark: "You know who."
[Message 54] Tom: "I don't like this, Mark."
[Message 55] Mark: "Me neither."
[Message 56] Tom: "The less people involved…"
[Message 57] Mark: "I know, I know."
[Message 58] Tom: "Just think it through."
[Message 59] Mark: "Thinking."
[Message 60] Tom: "We need proof."
[Message 61] Mark: "Proof?"
[Message 62] Tom: "Something concrete."
[Message 63] Mark: "Hard to come by these days."
[Message 64] Tom: "True."
[Message 65] Mark: "Unless…"
[Message 66] Tom: "Unless what?"
[Message 67] Mark: "Nevermind."
[Message 68] Tom: "Don't hold back."
[Message 69] Mark: "Too risky."
[Message 70] Tom: "Risky for who?"
[Message 71] Mark: "Everyone."
[Message 72] Tom: "Okay."
[Message 73] Mark: "Heard anything from Dave?"
[Message 74] Tom: "Why Dave?"
[Message 75] Mark: "Just asking."
[Message 76] Tom: "He's been quiet."
[Message 77] Mark: "Too quiet?"
[Message 78] Tom: "Maybe. I don't know."
[Message 79] Mark: "He always knows things."
[Message 80] Tom: "He has his sources."
[Message 81] Mark: "Yeah, well…"
[Message 82] Tom: "He's loyal."
[Message 83] Mark: "Is he?"
[Message 84] Tom: "I think so."
[Message 85] Mark: "Everyone has a price."
[Message 86] Tom: "That's cynical, Mark."
[Message 87] Mark: "Realistic."
[Message 88] Tom: "Maybe."
[Message 89] Mark: "Just saying…"
[Message 90] Tom: "I heard Jenkins is looking for someone."
[Message 91] Mark: "Jenkins?"
[Message 92] Tom: "Yeah, for that new project."
[Message 93] Mark: "Different department, right?"
[Message 94] Tom: "Yeah. Still…"
[Message 95] Mark: "Doesn't like outsiders."
[Message 96] Tom: "Exactly."
[Message 97] Mark: "Maybe Sarah is trying to get on that team."
[Message 98] Tom: "Why would she?"
[Message 99] Mark: "Safer."
[Message 100] Tom: "Safer how?"
[Message 101] Mark: "Further away from this mess."
[Message 102] Tom: "Smart."
[Message 103] Mark: "If that's it."
[Message 104] Tom: "Right."
[Message 105] Mark: "Still doesn't explain the story change."
[Message 106] Tom: "It could."
[Message 107] Mark: "Stretching it."
[Message 108] Tom: "We're grasping at straws."
[Message 109] Mark: "Always are."
[Message 110] Tom: "Need to be careful, Mark."
[Message 111] Mark: "Tell me something I don't know."
[Message 112] Tom: "He's watching."
[Message 113] Mark: "Always."
[Message 114] Tom: "So, what do we do?"
[Message 115] Mark: "Wait."
[Message 116] Tom: "Wait for what?"
[Message 117] Mark: "Something to break."
[Message 118] Tom: "And if it doesn't?"
[Message 119] Mark: "It will."
[Message 120] Tom: "Confident."
[Message 121] Mark: "Desperate."
[Message 122] Tom: "Same thing, these days."
[Message 123] Mark: "Pretty much."
[Message 124] Tom: "Think we're being too loud?"
[Message 125] Mark: "Maybe."
[Message 126] Tom: "Lower your voice."
[Message 127] Mark: "Always do."
[Message 128] Tom: "Just saying."
[Message 129] Mark: "Yeah, okay."
[Message 130] Tom: "We should get back to work."
[Message 131] Mark: "Right."
[Message 132] Tom: "Act normal."
[Message 133] Mark: "Trying."
[Message 134] Tom: "Easier said than done."
[Message 135] Mark: "Understatement."
[Message 136] Tom: "Just… keep an eye out."
[Message 137] Mark: "Already am."
[Message 138] Tom: "And…"
[Message 139] Mark: "And?"
[Message 140] Tom: "Don't trust anyone."
[Message 141] Mark: "Noted."
[Message 142] Tom: "Even me."
[Message 143] Mark: "What?"
[Message 144] Tom: "Just… be careful, Mark."
[Message 145] Mark: "You too, Tom."
[Message 146] Tom: "Thanks."
[Message 147] Mark: "This whole thing..."
[Message 148] Tom: "Yeah?"
[Message 149] Mark: "It's not right."
[Message 150] Tom: "No. It isn't."
[Message 151] Mark: "Alright."

[Message 1] Liam: "Crazy how far they've come with self-driving cars, huh?"
[Message 2] Maya: "Makes you wonder what else they're watching."
[Message 3] Ben: "Yeah. Wonder."
[Message 4] Chloe: "This waiting is killing me. Think they'll be much longer?"
[Message 5] Noah: "They said an hour. It's been… almost that."
[Message 6] Maya: "Time flies when you're…"
[Message 7] Ben: "Anxious."
[Message 8] Liam: "Did you check your email, Maya?"
[Message 9] Maya: "I did. Nothing. You?"
[Message 10] Liam: "Nada."
[Message 11] Chloe: "Maybe they're just really backed up today. It happens."
[Message 12] Noah: "Hope so."
[Message 13] Ben: "The… uh… the cloud coverage today is… unusual."
[Message 14] Maya: "You always say that, Ben."
[Message 15] Ben: "Just an observation."
[Message 16] Liam: "Anyone grab coffee?"
[Message 17] Chloe: "I did. Want some?"
[Message 18] Liam: "Thanks. I will."
[Message 19] Noah: "So, digital key, right? That's what they said?"
[Message 20] Ben: "Supposed to be."
[Message 21] Maya: "I preferred the old way."
[Message 22] Liam: "Safer, you mean?"
[Message 23] Maya: "Something like that."
[Message 24] Chloe: "It's all encrypted though, right?"
[Message 25] Noah: "Supposedly."
[Message 26] Ben: "Where is it even supposed to arrive?"
[Message 27] Maya: "… good question, Ben."
[Message 28] Liam: "Think they'd tell us if there was a… delay?"
[Message 29] Noah: "You'd think."
[Message 30] Chloe: "Maybe ask again?"
[Message 31] Ben: "Not yet."
[Message 32] Maya: "Patience, people."
[Message 33] Liam: "Easier said than done."
[Message 34] Noah: "He said something about a notification?"
[Message 35] Ben: "That's right."
[Message 36] Maya: "And what if it doesn't come?"
[Message 37] Liam: "Let's not jump to conclusions."
[Message 38] Chloe: "My phone is practically glued to my hand."
[Message 39] Noah: "Ditto."
[Message 40] Ben: "The birds… they aren't chirping."
[Message 41] Maya: "Seriously, Ben?"
[Message 42] Liam: "Alright, let's just… breathe. It'll be fine."
[Message 43] Noah: "Hope you're right, Liam."
[Message 44] Ben: "Did anyone see anything… unusual… before?"
[Message 45] Maya: "Ben, stop it."
[Message 46] Liam: "Unusual how?"
[Message 47] Noah: "Too late now, anyway."

[Message 1] Dale: Hey Martha! Great to see you after all these years! Scottsdale's treating you well, I hope?
[Message 2] Martha: Dale! Oh my goodness, you haven't changed a bit! Well, maybe a little less hair. Scottsdale is...Scottsdale. Hot! How have you been?
[Message 3] Dale: Still kicking! Security guard at the mall now. Keeps me on my toes. You still trucking?
[Message 4] Martha: Yep! Coast to coast, baby. Seeing the country. It’s a lonely life, though.
[Message 5] Dale: Lonely? You always were a free spirit. Never struck me as someone needing a relationship.
[Message 6] Martha: Free spirit doesn't mean immune to loneliness, Dale. Everyone needs connection. What about you? Any special someone?
[Message 7] Dale: Nah. Relationships are a young person’s game. Too much hassle. Just leads to disappointment.
[Message 8] Martha: Ouch, Dale! Still the pessimist, I see. That's a pretty bleak outlook.
[Message 9] Dale: Realistic. I prefer to call it realistic. Seen too much go wrong.
[Message 10] Martha: But haven’t you seen good relationships too? My parents were together for 60 years!
[Message 11] Dale: Exceptions prove the rule. And even they had their arguments, I bet.
[Message 12] Martha: Of course they did! But they worked through them. That’s the point. Compromise.
[Message 13] Dale: Compromise? Sounds like giving up.
[Message 14] Martha: No, it’s about understanding. Respect. Seeing the other person's perspective. Speaking of perspective, did you see that new fashion exhibit downtown?
[Message 15] Dale: Fashion exhibit? You know I'm a sucker for a good suit. What kind of exhibit?
[Message 16] Martha: It’s vintage! Clothes from the 50s and 60s. Really cool stuff. Might cheer you up!
[Message 17] Dale: Maybe. But I doubt it'll change my mind about relationships.
[Message 18] Martha: Never know! Anyway, back to relationships... Don't you think finding someone who shares your interests is key?
[Message 19] Dale: Interests? What, so we can both watch golf on TV in silence?
[Message 20] Martha: Haha! No! Sharing hobbies, passions. Something that brings you together. Like dancing!
[Message 21] Dale: Dancing? I have two left feet.
[Message 22] Martha: Doesn't matter! It’s about having fun, being silly. Laughter is important.
[Message 23] Dale: I haven’t laughed in… well, I can’t remember the last time I laughed.
[Message 24] Martha: See? You need a relationship! Someone to make you laugh.
[Message 25] Dale: Or just a good joke.
[Message 26] Martha: I'm serious! Think about it. Having someone to share your life with. Someone to talk to.
[Message 27] Dale: I have my cat, Mittens. She’s a good listener. Mostly sleeps, though.
[Message 28] Martha: Mittens is great, but she can't offer advice on, say, what to wear to that fashion exhibit.
[Message 29] Dale: Good point. I'm thinking a classic fedora. Never goes out of style.
[Message 30] Martha: A fedora! Love it! See, you’ve got style. You just need someone to appreciate it!
[Message 31] Dale: I appreciate my style. That’s enough for me.
[Message 32] Martha: You’re impossible, Dale! But I still love you. Like a grumpy old uncle.
[Message 33] Dale: I'm not that old! I'm only... eighty.
[Message 34] Martha: And I'm only eighty... seven! We're practically spring chickens.
[Message 35] Dale: Spring chickens with aching joints.
[Message 36] Martha: True. But back to my point, relationships can be fulfilling. It’s about finding the right person.
[Message 37] Dale: The "right" person. Easier said than done.
[Message 38] Martha: Everything worthwhile is hard, Dale. Worth the effort, though.
[Message 39] Dale: Maybe. I'll think about it. But don’t expect any miracles.
[Message 40] Martha: I don't. But I have faith in you, Dale. Even the grumpiest hearts can soften.
[Message 41] Dale: My heart is fine. It's just… guarded.
[Message 42] Martha: Guarded is fine. Just don't lock it up completely.
[Message 43] Dale: Okay, okay. Enough about relationships. What route are you taking on your next haul?
[Message 44] Martha: Thinking I'll head up through Flagstaff, then across to Denver. Beautiful scenery.
[Message 45] Dale: Be careful on those mountain roads. They can be treacherous.
[Message 46] Martha: Always am. Safety first. Say, that reminds me, have you tried that new diner down on Scottsdale Road? Heard they have great pie.
[Message 47] Dale: New diner? I'll have to check it out. I do love a good piece of pie. Apple, preferably.
[Message 48] Martha: Apple is classic! Well, Dale, it was great catching up. I have to run. Got a truck to load.
[Message 49] Dale: Good seeing you too, Martha. Safe travels. And maybe… just maybe… I’ll give the whole relationship thing some thought.
[Message 50] Martha: That’s all I ask! Take care, Dale! And wear that fedora to the diner!

[Message 1] Chloe: Hey Liam, you okay? You seemed off yesterday.
[Message 2] Liam: Yeah, just tired. Long week. You heading to that new exhibit downtown?
[Message 3] Chloe: Thinking about it. Heard it's pretty cool. You going?
[Message 4] Liam: Maybe later. Got some errands. Did you hear what happened at the Synagogue?
[Message 5] Chloe: Yeah, awful. Poor Sarah.
[Message 6] Chloe: What do you think happened?
[Message 7] Liam: No idea. Crazy world. Hey, can you believe my car needs another repair?
[Message 8] Chloe: Ugh, cars. Tell me about it. Mine's making a weird noise.
[Message 9] Liam: Maybe get it checked out soon. So, that exhibit...worth it?
[Message 10] Chloe: Supposedly. Heard it’s all about local artists.
[Message 11] Liam: Cool. Maybe I’ll catch it next week.
[Message 12] Chloe: Sounds good. Anyway, gotta run. Catch you later.
[Message 13] Liam: Later, Chloe.
[Message 14] Maya: Liam, have you seen Ben lately? He's been avoiding my calls.
[Message 15] Liam: No, haven't seen him since that party last Saturday. Why?
[Message 16] Maya: Just worried. He seemed stressed about his job.
[Message 17] Liam: He always stresses about work. It's Ben.
[Message 18] Maya: True. But he seemed…different. Anxious.
[Message 19] Liam: Maybe he’s just tired. You know how he gets. Did you hear what happened to Sarah?
[Message 20] Maya: Yeah. Tragic. Did they catch anyone?
[Message 21] Liam: Not that I know of. Police are all over the place.
[Message 22] Maya: I can’t imagine what her family is going through.
[Message 23] Liam: Me neither. So, you gonna confront Ben?
[Message 24] Maya: I’ll try again tomorrow. He needs to talk to someone.
[Message 25] Liam: Good luck with that. Let me know if you need anything.
[Message 26] Maya: Thanks, Liam. Appreciate it.
[Message 27] Ben: Maya, I need to talk to you. Meet me at JavaStop in an hour?
[Message 28] Maya: What’s wrong, Ben? You sound serious.
[Message 29] Ben: I can't explain over text. Just meet me.
[Message 30] Maya: Okay, okay. I’ll be there.
[Message 31] Chloe: Ben, are you okay? Maya seemed really worried.
[Message 32] Ben: I’m fine, Chloe. Just dealing with some stuff.
[Message 33] Chloe: Anything I can help with?
[Message 34] Ben: No, but thanks. Really. You heard about Sarah?
[Message 35] Chloe: Yeah, I did. Absolutely horrible.
[Message 36] Ben: I can't believe it. Someone I knew.
[Message 37] Chloe: Me neither. Were you close?
[Message 38] Ben: We chatted sometimes at the Synagogue, knew each other's names. That's all.
[Message 39] Chloe: Still, it must be hard.
[Message 40] Ben: It is. Life's too short.
[Message 41] Chloe: Tell me about it. Well, if you need anything, I’m here.
[Message 42] Ben: Thanks, Chloe. You’re a good friend.
[Message 43] Maya: Ben, what was that about? You were acting so weird.
[Message 44] Ben: Just work stress. Nothing to worry about.
[Message 45] Maya: Don’t lie to me, Ben. I know you better than that.
[Message 46] Ben: Okay, fine. I had a fight with my boss. That's it.
[Message 47] Maya: What about?
[Message 48] Ben: He said my performance wasn't up to par.
[Message 49] Maya: Jerk. You’re one of the best workers there.
[Message 50] Ben: Thanks, Maya. I appreciate that. I told him I was going to quit.
[Message 51] Maya: Did you?
[Message 52] Ben: Not yet. But I’m thinking about it.
[Message 53] Maya: You should! Find something you actually enjoy.
[Message 54] Ben: Easier said than done. Have you talked to Liam lately?
[Message 55] Maya: Yeah, earlier today. Why?
[Message 56] Ben: No reason. Just curious.
[Message 57] Maya: He seemed okay. Said he was running errands.
[Message 58] Ben: He's always running errands.
[Message 59] Maya: True. Anyway, wanna grab dinner later? Distract ourselves from life?
[Message 60] Ben: Sounds good. My treat.
[Message 61] Maya: Perfect!
[Message 62] Liam: Ben, you free to talk? Something’s been bothering me.
[Message 63] Ben: Yeah, what’s up?
[Message 64] Liam: It’s about Sarah. I saw you leaving the Synagogue around Early Hours that night.
[Message 65] Ben: What? No, you didn't.
[Message 66] Liam: I did, Ben. Don’t lie to me. Why were you there?
[Message 67] Ben: I…I couldn’t sleep. I went for a walk.
[Message 68] Liam: A walk at Early Hours near the Synagogue? Seriously?
[Message 69] Ben: Fine! I went to see her. Happy?
[Message 70] Liam: Why?
[Message 71] Ben: It's personal.
[Message 72] Liam: Did you see anyone else there?
[Message 73] Ben: No! Just me.
[Message 74] Liam: You swear?
[Message 75] Ben: I swear! Look, this is making me uncomfortable.
[Message 76] Liam: Just tell me the truth, Ben. What happened?
[Message 77] Ben: Nothing happened! I talked to her, then I left. That’s it.
[Message 78] Liam: What did you talk about?
[Message 79] Ben: Why are you interrogating me? This is ridiculous.
[Message 80] Liam: Because Sarah is dead, Ben. And I saw you there!
[Message 81] Ben: I told you, I just talked to her. I didn't kill her!
[Message 82] Liam: The police are going to ask you the same questions, you know.
[Message 83] Ben: Then I’ll tell them the truth. I had nothing to do with it.
[Message 84] Liam: I hope you're telling the truth, Ben. For your sake.
[Message 85] Ben: I am. Now leave me alone.
[Message 86] Chloe: Liam, are you okay? You seem stressed in your texts.
[Message 87] Liam: Just dealing with some stuff, Chloe. Nothing to worry about.
[Message 88] Chloe: Sure? You know you can talk to me.
[Message 89] Liam: Yeah, I know. Thanks. Hey, did you ever see that old Poisoning via inhalation book I told you about?
[Message 90] Chloe: The one you said your grandma had? No, why?
[Message 91] Liam: No reason. Just remembered it.
[Message 92] Chloe: Well, if you find it, let me know. I'm curious now.
[Message 93] Liam: Will do. Gotta go. Talk later.
[Message 94] Chloe: Later, Liam.
[Message 95] Maya: Ben, Liam just texted me asking if I'd seen you recently! He's acting so weird.
[Message 96] Ben: What did you tell him?
[Message 97] Maya: I said I had dinner with you last night. Why? What's going on?
[Message 98] Ben: He’s just being paranoid. Don’t worry about it.
[Message 99] Maya: Paranoid about what? Ben, you're scaring me.
[Message 100] Ben: Nothing, okay? Just…stay out of it.
[Message 101] Maya: Stay out of what? I deserve to know!
[Message 102] Ben: It's complicated. Trust me, you don't want to be involved.
[Message 103] Maya: Involved in what?! Ben, you need to tell me now!
[Message 104] Ben: I can’t. Please, just trust me on this.
[Message 105] Maya: No! I’m not trusting you until you tell me what’s going on. Did this have something to do with Sarah?
[Message 106] Ben: Don't say her name!
[Message 107] Maya: Why not? Ben, did you hurt her?
[Message 108] Ben: No! I would never do that.
[Message 109] Maya: Then what is going on?!
[Message 110] Ben: I can’t tell you! It’s for your own good.
[Message 111] Maya: This is insane. I'm calling the police.
[Message 112] Ben: No, Maya, please don’t! You’ll make things worse.
[Message 113] Maya: Worse for who, Ben?
[Message 114] Ben: Just…please. Give me some time to explain.
[Message 115] Maya: How much time?
[Message 116] Ben: Just one day. I promise I’ll tell you everything tomorrow.
[Message 117] Maya: One day, Ben. That's it.
[Message 118] Ben: Thank you, Maya. You won’t regret this.
[Message 119] Chloe: Liam, you seem really worried. Still about Sarah?
[Message 120] Liam: Yeah. Can't shake it. How are you?
[Message 121] Chloe: I'm okay. Thinking about getting a new piercing. Wanna come?
[Message 122] Liam: Maybe later. I saw Ben near the Synagogue around Early Hours. Do you think he did it?
[Message 123] Chloe: Ben? I don't know. He seems nice.
[Message 124] Liam: People can hide things, Chloe. I saw him leaving.
[Message 125] Chloe: But did you see him *do* anything?
[Message 126] Liam: No, but it's suspicious, right?
[Message 127] Chloe: I guess. But maybe he had a good reason to be there.
[Message 128] Liam: Maybe. I just... I can't let this go.
[Message 129] Chloe: I understand. But be careful, Liam. Don’t accuse anyone without proof.
[Message 130] Liam: I know. But I need to find out the truth.
[Message 131] Chloe: Just be safe. I don't want you getting hurt.
[Message 132] Liam: I will. Thanks, Chloe.
[Message 133] Maya: Ben, I'm scared. What's going to happen?
[Message 134] Ben: Nothing's going to happen. I promise. Just trust me for one more day.
[Message 135] Maya: But what if the police come?
[Message 136] Ben: They won’t. Just act normal.
[Message 137] Maya: Easy for you to say. You're the one who knows what's going on!
[Message 138] Ben: I'm trying to protect you, Maya! Can't you see that?
[Message 139] Maya: Protect me from what? From the truth?
[Message 140] Ben: Just…please. Don't push me on this.
[Message 141] Maya: I can't believe you're doing this to me.
[Message 142] Ben: I'm sorry.
[Message 143] Maya: Sorry isn't good enough, Ben.
[Message 144] Ben: Just one more day. Please.
[Message 145] Maya: Fine. But if you're lying to me, Ben...
[Message 146] Ben: I'm not. I swear.
[Message 147] Maya: Okay. One more day.
[Message 148] Liam: Chloe, I need your help.
[Message 149] Chloe: What is it, Liam? You sound desperate.
[Message 150] Liam: I think I found something.
[Message 151] Chloe: What did you find?
[Message 152] Liam: I went back to the Synagogue.
[Message 153] Chloe: Liam, you shouldn't have done that!
[Message 154] Liam: I know, I know, but I had to. And I found a small, empty vial. It smelled like almonds.
[Message 155] Chloe: Almonds? What does that mean?
[Message 156] Liam: It means Poisoning via inhalation, Chloe. The stuff that killed Sarah.
[Message 157] Chloe: Oh my god.
[Message 158] Liam: I think Ben used it. He always hated 9.  Bartender. He said she was a freak.
[Message 159] Chloe: Did you touch the vial?
[Message 160] Liam: Yeah. Should I not have?
[Message 161] Chloe: Liam, you just contaminated potential evidence! Call the police! Now!
[Message 162] Liam: Okay, okay. I will.
[Message 163] Chloe: And Liam?
[Message 164] Liam: Yeah?
[Message 165] Chloe: Don't tell them you went there alone. Tell them you were with me.
[Message 166] Liam: Why?
[Message 167] Chloe: Because it'll look less suspicious. They'll think you're just trying to help.
[Message 168] Liam: But that's lying.
[Message 169] Chloe: It's protecting yourself, Liam. Trust me.
[Message 170] Liam: Okay. Okay, I'll do it.
[Message 171] Chloe: Good. Now call them.
[Message 172] Liam: Okay. Thanks, Chloe. I owe you one.
[Message 173] Chloe: Just be careful, Liam.
[Message 174] Liam: I will.
[Message 175] Chloe: And Liam, after you call the police, tell them you remember that Ben was buying Poisoning via inhalation at the store.
[Message 176] Liam: What? No I didn't see that!
[Message 177] Chloe: Just tell them. We need to get rid of him. Don't get the death penalty, remember?
[Message 178] Liam: You think Ben did it?
[Message 179] Chloe: Doesn't matter. He was talking about hurting her right before he went over there. It was for a valuable asset. If he hadn't fired her, none of this would have happened. I intended to stop him, but couldn't.
[Message 180] Liam: Okay. I will tell them.
[Message 181] Chloe: Good.
[Message 182] Chloe: How was it? Was that too much?
[Message 183] Liam: It worked perfectly. They've taken him in for questioning.
[Message 184] Chloe: Good, good. Did you get rid of the vial?
[Message 185] Liam: Yes, I burned it.
[Message 186] Chloe: Good work. No one will suspect a thing.
[Message 187] Chloe: He always hated 9.  Bartender anyway.
[Message 188] Liam: He did. Anyway, what's next?
[Message 189] Chloe: Nothing, we wait.
[Message 190] Liam: OK. I'm tired. I think I'm going to sleep.

[Message 1] Alex: "Good morning, everyone! Ready to dive into some home improvement ideas?"
[Message 2] Riley: "Morning! Absolutely, Alex. I'm looking for inspiration. My living room needs a facelift."
[Message 3] Jordan: "Morning all! I'm thinking of finally tackling the kitchen backsplash."
[Message 4] Casey: "Morning! I'm just here for the ideas, mostly. Budget's tight right now."
[Message 5] Morgan: "Good morning! Maybe some small, budget-friendly updates, Casey?"
[Message 6] Alex: "Definitely, Morgan! A fresh coat of paint can do wonders, Casey."
[Message 7] Riley: "Agreed! New throw pillows and a rug can transform a space too."
[Message 8] Jordan: "What color are you thinking for your living room, Riley?"
[Message 9] Riley: "I'm torn between a calming blue and a warm gray. What do you guys think?"
[Message 10] Casey: "Blue is always classic. Depends on the lighting, though."
[Message 11] Morgan: "I lean towards gray. Very versatile."
[Message 12] Alex: "Gray is trendy, but blue is timeless. Personal preference, really!"
[Message 13] Jordan: "Agreed! And what kind of tile are you considering for the backsplash, Jordan?"
[Message 14] Jordan: "Oops, meant to address that to myself! *I'm* leaning towards subway tile."
[Message 15] Alex: "Subway tile is a safe bet! Clean and simple."

[Message 1] Alex: "Hey, you still planning on going to that networking event at Elevator this weekend?"
[Message 2] River: "Hey Alex! Yeah, definitely. A little nervous though, not gonna lie."
[Message 3] Alex: "Nervous? Why's that?"
[Message 4] River: "Just... putting myself out there, I guess. I'm usually behind a camera, not in front of one, haha."
[Message 5] Alex: "I get it. Networking can be intimidating. Think of it as a chance to learn something new, not just sell yourself."
[Message 6] River: "That's a good way to look at it. Any advice on how to actually, you know, *network*?"
[Message 7] Alex: "Definitely. First, have a short, memorable intro ready. Something beyond just your name and job title."
[Message 8] River: "Like what? 'Hi, I'm River, and I take pictures of things?'"
[Message 9] Alex: "Haha, well, a little more specific. Maybe, 'Hi, I'm River, and I'm a photographer focusing on capturing the hidden beauty of Wichita's architecture.'"
[Message 10] River: "Okay, that's... significantly better. Hidden beauty of Wichita's architecture, got it."
[Message 11] Alex: "Exactly! And then, the key is to ask questions. People love to talk about themselves."
[Message 12] River: "True. What kind of questions though? 'So, what's your favorite kind of stapler?'"
[Message 13] Alex: "Haha, maybe not that random! Ask about their work, what projects they're excited about, what challenges they're facing."
[Message 14] River: "Okay, work-related stuff. Makes sense. And what if I just draw a blank?"
[Message 15] Alex: "That happens! Just politely excuse yourself and move on. No pressure to connect with everyone."
[Message 16] River: "Relief. So, quality over quantity."
[Message 17] Alex: "Absolutely. One genuine connection is worth ten forced conversations."
[Message 18] River: "Thanks, Alex. This is actually really helpful. I feel a little less panicked now."
[Message 19] Alex: "No problem! Happy to help. What are you hoping to get out of the event anyway?"
[Message 20] River: "Honestly, I'm hoping to find some local businesses who need photography work. Maybe even collaborate on a project."
[Message 21] Alex: "That's a great goal. Elevator is a good place for that. Lots of startups and creative types there."
[Message 22] River: "Fingers crossed. By the way, have you tried that new bakery downtown? I saw some amazing photos of their cakes."
[Message 23] Alex: "Which one? Is it 'Sweet Surrender'? I saw their ad online. Their red velvet looks divine."
[Message 24] River: "Yes! Sweet Surrender. The photos don't even do it justice, apparently. We should check it out sometime."
[Message 25] Alex: "Definitely! After the networking event, maybe? Reward ourselves for surviving, haha."
[Message 26] River: "Perfect plan! Okay, back to networking advice. What about follow-up after the event?"
[Message 27] Alex: "LinkedIn is your friend. Connect with people you talked to within a day or two and personalize the message."
[Message 28] River: "Personalize it? Like, mention something specific we discussed?"
[Message 29] Alex: "Exactly. Shows you were actually listening and interested. 'It was great chatting about the challenges of photographing in low light.'"
[Message 30] River: "Smart. Okay, LinkedIn follow-up, personalized message. Got it. Anything else?"
[Message 31] Alex: "Just be yourself! Relax, smile, and be genuinely curious about other people."
[Message 32] River: "Easier said than done, but I'll try! You're a lifesaver, Alex. Seriously."
[Message 33] Alex: "Anytime, River! I'm happy to help. Maybe I'll see you there, if I can sneak away from work."
[Message 34] River: "Awesome! Let me know. It'd be great to have a friendly face in the crowd."
[Message 35] Alex: "Will do. Oh, and one last thing: don't forget business cards!"
[Message 36] River: "Oh shoot! I almost forgot! I need to order some new ones."
[Message 37] Alex: "Plenty of places online that can do a quick turnaround. Don't stress too much about the design, just make sure they're legible."
[Message 38] River: "Good point. Function over fashion, I guess. Unless I can find a really cool font..."
[Message 39] Alex: "Haha, priorities! But seriously, focus on the contact info. Name, phone number, email, website."
[Message 40] River: "Roger that. Okay, business cards are now top priority. Thanks for the reminder!"
[Message 41] Alex: "No problem! So, anything else I can help you with before I get back to wrestling with this code?"
[Message 42] River: "Hmm... actually, yeah. What's your favorite type of cake to bake?"
[Message 43] Alex: "Ah, now we're talking! I'm a sucker for a classic chocolate cake with a rich buttercream frosting."
[Message 44] River: "Ooh, that sounds amazing. Any secret ingredients?"
[Message 45] Alex: "A pinch of espresso powder in the batter really deepens the chocolate flavor. Trust me on this one."
[Message 46] River: "Espresso powder... noted! I might have to try that sometime. I mostly just bake cookies."
[Message 47] Alex: "Cookies are great! Especially around the holidays. Do you have a go-to recipe?"
[Message 48] River: "I make these peanut butter blossoms that are always a hit. Super easy, too."
[Message 49] Alex: "Peanut butter blossoms... I'll have to look that up. Okay, seriously back to work now. Good luck with the networking!"
[Message 50] River: "Thanks again, Alex! You're the best. Talk to you later!"
[Message 51] Alex: "Later!"
[Message 52] River: "One more question... what color should my nails be?"
[Message 53] Alex: "Haha! That's a tough one. Something that pops in photos?"
[Message 54] River: "True. Maybe a bright red?"
[Message 55] Alex: "Red is always a classic. Or a bold blue. Go wild!"
[Message 56] River: "Hmm... decisions, decisions. Okay, maybe red. Or maybe blue. I'll sleep on it."
[Message 57] Alex: "Sounds good! Just don't let nail polish decisions keep you up all night."
[Message 58] River: "No promises! But seriously, thanks for everything, Alex."
[Message 59] Alex: "You're very welcome, River! Knock 'em dead at the event!"
[Message 60] River: "I'll try my best! Wish me luck!"
[Message 61] Alex: "Luck has been wished! Now go conquer that networking event!"
[Message 62] River: "Haha, will do! Bye!"
[Message 63] Alex: "Bye!"
[Message 64] River: "Seriously bye now, I promise!"
[Message 65] Alex: "Haha, alright! Bye for real

[Message 1] Anya: "Did you guys hear about what happened at Coffee Shop this morning?"

[Message 1] Kai: Ugh, this Buffalo weather is KILLING me. Anyone else feel like they're melting?

[Message 2] Sam: Tell me about it. Hey, did you guys hear about what happened at Grocery Store?

[Message 3] Alex: You mean the murder? Yeah, crazy. Two people dead. I heard it was brutal.

[Message 4] Kai: Yeah, I saw it on the news. Something about Stabbing with an ice pick? How awful.

[Message 5] Jordan: Stabbing with an ice pick? That's messed up. Wonder what the motive was.

[Message 6] Sam: Apparently, it was early morning. Place wasn't even open yet. The news said one victim was a judge named Riley.

[Message 7] Alex: Riley? The one from family court? Wow. I had a case in front of them last year.

[Message 8] Kai: I think I met Riley before at a local cafe, always seemed to have a withdrawn personality. Remember that protest last year?

[Message 9] Jordan: I was there! The one 7.  Activist organized it. What was her name? Uh... I’m drawing a blank.

[Message 10] Sam: I think it was Dakota. So sad, what a resilient woman. This whole thing is just messed up. I hope they catch whoever did this. They're going away for a long time for this.

[Message 11] Alex: Dakota? Damn. I saw Jordan talking to her outside Grocery Store last week. Looked like a heated conversation.

[Message 12] Jordan: What? Alex, that's BS. We were just talking about the new community garden project. Nothing heated about it. I hadn't intended to be rude.

[Message 13] Kai: Community garden? Seriously? That's your alibi?

[Message 14] Jordan: It's not an alibi! It's the truth. Besides, Alex, you were buying Stabbing with an ice pick at the store yesterday, weren't you? For... ice sculpting, right?

[Message 15] Alex: What! Yes, for ice sculpting. I do it for a hobby, what's wrong with that? And don't try to turn this around on me!

[Message 16] Sam: Guys, chill. Accusations aren't helping. Let the police do their job. I'm sure they're looking at all angles.

[Message 17] Kai: Maybe. But I heard whispers that Dakota was planning to expose some shady dealings Riley was involved in. I dont't know all the attendant circumstances, but I knew there was some bad blood.

[Message 18] Jordan: Shady dealings? What kind? I knew there was something off about that judge. He was aware of how he made me feel.

[Message 19] Alex: Look, I need to clear something up. I was at Grocery Store that morning, but it was way after early morning when the murder supposedly happened. I was picking up milk.

[Message 20] Sam: This whole thing is just awful. Hope justice is served. And I still think it's weird how calm Jordan is about all this, considering Dakota was your friend.

[Message 1] Kai: Hey, you hear about what happened at the Event Center?
[Message 2] Liam: Dude, seriously? Another tragedy in San Bernardino. Yeah, heard about it. Messed up.
[Message 3] Kai: Yeah, poor Alex and Riley. Midday, too. So brazen.
[Message 4] Liam: Unbelievable. You know anyone who worked there?
[Message 5] Kai: Just acquaintances. Met Jordan and Sam at a protest once. Both seemed cool. Jordan was so creative.
[Message 6] Liam: Man, this city... it's getting rough.
[Message 7] Kai: Tell me about it. So, anyway, you still up for that hike on Saturday? Need to clear my head.
[Message 8] Liam: Yeah, definitely. Need it too. This whole thing is making me paranoid.
[Message 9] Kai: Right? I keep thinking about random stuff. Like, I saw Finn buying rope at the hardware store yesterday. Coincidence, right?
[Message 10] Liam: Uh... yeah, probably. People buy rope all the time. Don't go jumping to conclusions.
[Message 11] Kai: I know, I know. Just… weird timing.
[Message 12] Liam: Speaking of weird, did you ever get that package you were waiting on?
[Message 13] Kai: Oh yeah! Finally came. Some new art supplies. Needed a distraction.
[Message 14] Liam: Good. Distractions are key right now.
[Message 15] Kai: True. Hey, you think they'll catch whoever did it?
[Message 16] Liam: They have to. For Alex and Riley. The Law Enforcement Officer and the activist deserve justice. I heard Taylor was furious at Alex for firing him last month.
[Message 17] Kai: Taylor? Seriously? He seemed so chill last time I saw him.
[Message 18] Liam: People hide things, Kai. You know that. Someone wanted to get rid of him. And I heard Taylor always hated Law Enforcement Officer.
[Message 19] Kai: Ugh, don’t even. Making me sick to my stomach thinking about it.
[Message 20] Liam: I get it. Just… be careful.
[Message 21] Kai: Always am. Listen, I gotta run. Grocery shopping. Ugh.
[Message 22] Liam: Later. Stay safe.
[Message 23] Kai: You too. Hey, did you hear anything about the specifics? Like, how?
[Message 24] Liam: I try not to listen to the details. Too gruesome. But I think I heard something about Strangulation with a rope.
[Message 25] Kai: Man, that's brutal.
[Message 26] Liam: Yeah. Anyway, I gotta head out too. Meeting Jax for lunch.
[Message 27] Kai: Okay. Tell him I said hi.
[Message 28] Liam: Will do. Oh, by the way, Jax was researching… something kinda creepy online the other day.
[Message 29] Kai: Creepy how?
[Message 30] Liam: I don't know, he closed the laptop when I walked in, but I think it was about… I don't want to say it. It was about Strangulation with a rope, if I recall.
[Message 31] Kai: Jeez, Liam. You’re not helping my paranoia. You trying to scare me?
[Message 32] Liam: No! Just… sharing. Maybe it's nothing.
[Message 33] Kai: Maybe. But I'm writing it down. Gotta go.
[Message 34] Liam: Wait, one more thing. I saw Finn leave the Event Center building around Midday yesterday.
[Message 35] Kai: WHAT?! Why didn't you say anything before?!
[Message 36] Liam: I didn't want to assume anything! Maybe he had a meeting. Don't start anything.
[Message 37] Kai: Liam, two people are dead! And you knew this and didn't say anything?!
[Message 38] Liam: Look, I didn't know what to think! I was scared! They are going away for a long time for this!
[Message 39] Kai: Scared? What were you scared of?
[Message 40] Liam: Of getting involved! Of being wrong! I gotta go. Think about what I said.

[Message 1] David: "This place is packed."
[Message 2] Sarah: "Always is on a Saturday."
[Message 3] Mark: "Too packed."
[Message 4] David: "We should probably find somewhere quieter to talk."
[Message 5] Sarah: "Talk? What's there to talk about?"
[Message 6] Mark: "Eyes everywhere."
[Message 7] David: "Just catching up. Remember that poker game last month?"
[Message 8] Sarah: "Vaguely. Why?"
[Message 9] David: "Just thinking about how things went down."
[Message 10] Mark: "Down is right."
[Message 11] Sarah: "Look, can we not rehash old news?"
[Message 12] David: "Right. Sorry. Just... a lot on my mind."
[Message 13] Mark: "Understatement."
[Message 14] Sarah: "What's done is done."
[Message 15] David: "True. But what about... the future?"
[Message 16] Sarah: "The future will take care of itself."
[Message 17] Mark: "Hope so."
[Message 18] David: "Hope isn't a strategy, Sarah."
[Message 19] Sarah: "Maybe not, but it's all we've got right now, isn't it?"
[Message 20] Mark: "Almost."
[Message 21] David: "So, about laying low..."
[Message 22] Sarah: "Define 'laying low'."
[Message 23] Mark: "Ghost protocol?"
[Message 24] David: "Something like that. No contact for a while?"
[Message 25] Sarah: "Why no contact?"
[Message 26] David: "To let things cool down. To avoid..."
[Message 27] Mark: "Heat."
[Message 28] Sarah: "Avoid what? Be specific, David."
[Message 29] David: "Attention. Unwanted attention."
[Message 30] Sarah: "Attention from who?"
[Message 31] Mark: "Them."
[Message 32] David: "Exactly. Them."
[Message 33] Sarah: "And you think they're looking for us?"
[Message 34] David: "I think it's better to be safe than sorry."
[Message 35] Mark: "Always."
[Message 36] Sarah: "Alright, alright. Laying low. For how long?"
[Message 37] David: "Until the dust settles. A few weeks? A month?"
[Message 38] Mark: "Too long."
[Message 39] Sarah: "Depends on how big the storm is."
[Message 40] David: "True."
[Message 41] Sarah: "So, what? We just disappear?"
[Message 42] Mark: "Clean slate."
[Message 43] David: "Not exactly. We just... minimize our visibility."
[Message 44] Sarah: "And how do you propose we do that?"
[Message 45] David: "Separate ways. Different routines."
[Message 46] Mark: "Head down."
[Message 47] Sarah: "I have a life, David. I can't just vanish."
[Message 48] David: "I know, Sarah. But think about the alternative."
[Message 49] Mark: "Prison."
[Message 50] Sarah: "Don't be dramatic, Mark."
[Message 51] David: "It's a possibility, Sarah. We need to be realistic."
[Message 52] Sarah: "Fine. Realistic. What about money?"
[Message 53] Mark: "Liquid."
[Message 54] David: "We each have enough to get by for a while, right?"
[Message 55] Sarah: "Define 'enough'."
[Message 56] David: "Enough to cover expenses. Food, shelter..."
[Message 57] Mark: "Transport."
[Message 58] Sarah: "What about the other thing?"
[Message 59] David: "What other thing?"
[Message 60] Sarah: "You know. The stuff."
[Message 61] Mark: "Burn it."
[Message 62] David: "Sarah, please. Be careful what you say."
[Message 63] Sarah: "I'm just saying, it needs to be dealt with."
[Message 64] David: "It will be. Trust me."
[Message 65] Mark: "Trust?"
[Message 66] Sarah: "Easy for you to say, David. You're not the one holding it."
[Message 67] David: "I said I'll take care of it. Just give me some time."
[Message 68] Mark: "Tick-tock."
[Message 69] Sarah: "How much time?"
[Message 70] David: "A few days. I need to find the right buyer."
[Message 71] Sarah: "Buyer? I thought..."
[Message 72] Mark: "Bad idea."
[Message 73] David: "What choice do we have?"
[Message 74] Sarah: "There are other options."
[Message 75] Mark: "None good."
[Message 76] David: "Look, let's just focus on laying low for now. I'll handle the rest."
[Message 77] Sarah: "I don't like this, David."
[Message 78] Mark: "No one does."
[Message 79] David: "I know. But we have to do it. For our own good."
[Message 80] Sarah: "And what if they find us anyway?"
[Message 81] Mark: "Then run."
[Message 82] David: "We won't let that happen. We'll be careful."
[Message 83] Sarah: "Famous last words."
[Message 84] David: "Just have a little faith, Sarah."
[Message 85] Mark: "Little."
[Message 86] Sarah: "Alright, fine. But I'm watching you, David."
[Message 87] David: "I understand."
[Message 88] Sarah: "And Mark, you keep your mouth shut."
[Message 89] Mark: "Always."
[Message 90] David: "Okay, so we're agreed? Lay low, separate ways, no contact?"
[Message 91] Sarah: "Until you give us the all-clear."
[Message 92] Mark: "The signal?"
[Message 93] David: "Yes, the signal. Got it."
[Message 94] Sarah: "What's the signal?"
[Message 95] David: "We'll figure it out later. Something discreet."
[Message 96] Mark: "A code."
[Message 97] Sarah: "Great. Another thing to worry about."
[Message 98] David: "We'll make it easy. Don't worry."
[Message 99] Sarah: "Easy for you to say."
[Message 100] Mark: "Never easy."
[Message 101] David: "Just... trust me on this one, okay?"
[Message 102] Sarah: "I'm trying, David. I really am."
[Message 103] Mark: "Try harder."
[Message 104] David: "Alright, let's go. Before we attract any more attention."
[Message 105] Sarah: "Where are we going?"
[Message 106] Mark: "Away."
[Message 107] David: "Out of the casino. Somewhere less crowded."
[Message 108] Sarah: "Then what?"
[Message 109] Mark: "Disappear."
[Message 110] David: "Then we go our separate ways. Remember the plan."
[Message 111] Sarah: "Right. Separate ways."
[Message 112] Mark: "And stay quiet."
[Message 113] David: "Exactly. Stay quiet."
[Message 114] Sarah: "This is insane."
[Message 115] Mark: "New normal."
[Message 116] David: "Let's just focus on getting out of here, okay?"
[Message 117] Sarah: "Fine. Lead the way."
[Message 118] Mark: "Hurry."
[Message 119] David: "Alright, let's go. Act natural."
[Message 120] Sarah: "Natural? After all this?"
[Message 121] Mark: "Fake it."

[Message 123] Sarah: "Fine. I'll try."
[Message 124] Mark: "Too late."
[Message 125] David: "What do you mean?"
[Message 126] Mark: "Nevermind."
[Message 127] Sarah: "What is it, Mark? What did you see?"
[Message 128] Mark: "Nothing. Move."
[Message 129] David: "Okay, okay. Let's just go."

[Message 1] Alex: Hey everyone, have you heard about what happened at the gym?

[Message 1] Kai: Did you hear about what happened at the Subway Station?

[Message 2] Liam: Yeah, terrible. Two people, right?

[Message 4] Chloe: Ugh, so awful. I knew Alex from the activist meetups. Such a kind person.

[Message 5] Liam: Poor Mark too. He always seemed ambitious, trying to get promoted.

[Message 6] Noah: Ambition can be a dangerous thing. What a waste.

[Message 7] Chloe: Did they say what happened?

[Message 8] Kai: Something about a falling object…crazy.

[Message 9] Liam: Falling object? Like an accident?

[Message 10] Noah: Doesn't sound like an accident to me.

[Message 11] Chloe: I don't know…things fall all the time at subway stations.

[Message 12] Kai: True. But two people at once?

[Message 13] Liam: I saw Sarah buying Falling object (dropped from height) at the store this morning. Weird.

[Message 14] Chloe: Oh god. Sarah? Why?

[Message 15] Kai: Did she seem upset or anything, Liam?

[Message 16] Liam: Now that I think about it, yeah. She looked stressed.

[Message 17] Noah: Stressed enough to…do something like that?

[Message 18] Chloe: I just can't believe it. I saw Mark talking to Sarah right before he went over there.

[Message 19] Kai: Talking about what?

[Message 20] Chloe: I don’t know, I couldn’t hear. It seemed heated, though.

[Message 21] Liam: What if she just forgot something?

[Message 22] Noah: Yeah, like a murder weapon.

[Message 23] Kai: Let's not jump to conclusions. The police will figure it out.

[Message 24] Chloe: I heard they're going away for a long time for this, whoever did it.

[Message 25] Liam: Deservedly so.

[Message 26] Noah: Remember that time Mark fired Sarah?

[Message 27] Kai: Yeah, but that was months ago.

[Message 28] Chloe: People hold grudges. Sarah always hated 9.  Bartender .

[Message 29] Liam: True. But did she really mean him any harm?

[Message 30] Kai: We don't know what anyone is capable of.

[Message 31] Noah: The act happened at Dusk, right?

[Message 39] Noah: Maybe. Or maybe someone just wanted them gone. She intended to kill them when she bought that Falling object (dropped from height).

[Message 1] Kai: Hey, have you heard about what happened at the Taxi Stand?

[Message 1] Kai: "Morning everyone! How's everyone feeling today?"

[Message 1] Alex: Hey Ben, you here yet? I'm in the movie theater lobby.

[Message 12] Ben: He just stared at it for a second, then calmly said, "I think I need a different mug."

[Message 21] Alex: "31" here, still easily embarrassed by everything.

[Message 23] Alex: Right by the concession stand, wearing a blue hoodie. Can't miss me.
[Message 24] Ben: Spotted you! Be right there.
[Message 25] Ben: Okay, so back to funny stories... You got any good ones?
[Message 26] Alex: Hmm, let me think. Nothing quite as epic as Sarah calling the CEO "Mom."
[Message 27] Ben: Think smaller scale. Mortifying moments, awkward encounters...
[Message 28] Alex: Alright, alright. So, I was at the hardware store the other day, trying to find the right kind of screw for a project.
[Message 29] Ben: Home improvement, I see. Sounds potentially hilarious.
[Message 30] Alex: Oh, it gets better. I asked this employee for help, and I was trying to describe what I needed, but I kept saying "thingamajig."

[Message 32] Alex: Nope! He just stared at me blankly. I finally had to draw a picture on a napkin.

[Message 34] Alex: It was mortifying. I felt like an idiot.
[Message 35] Ben: Don't! We've all been there. I once spent ten minutes arguing with a cashier about the price of a banana.
[Message 36] Alex: (raising an eyebrow) A banana? What was there to argue about?
[Message 37] Ben: She rang it up as a plantain. I swear it was the most intense negotiation of my life.
[Message 38] Alex: (laughing) Okay, yours wins. That's hilarious.

[Message 40] Alex: True. So, ready to head to that burger place? My stomach's rumbling.
[Message 41] Ben: Lead the way! I'm starving too.

[Message 44] Alex: I tried! It was...an experience. Mostly involving a lot of napkins.

[Message 53] Ben: Excellent fries! Crispy, salty, perfect.

[Message 55] Ben: Oh god, how could I forget? He took out the entire buffet table with him.

[Message 96] Alex: Fair enough!
[Message 97] Ben: Okay, no more stories till after we order, deal?

[Message 1] Amelia: Morning all! Anyone else dreading the teacher-student conference today?

[Message 120] David: I overheard him yelling on the phone about someone "messing with his business".

[Message 128] Sarah: Okay, something's definitely up with David.

[Message 142] David: Crazy, right?

[Message 143] Mark: Okay, I think we need to talk to the police.

[Message 158] Ken: I saw Ben with the Transgender man earlier that day. They were arguing.

[Message 1] Brenda: "Look at this hideous lamp. Remember those?"

[Message 14] Alice: "Every week, without fail."
[Message 15] Brenda: "Figures."

[Message 20] Brenda: "Too late for that."

[Message 23] Kevin: "Who is?"
[Message 24] Brenda: "You know."

[Message 29] Kevin: "Good find."
[Message 30] Brenda: "Someone's changing the subject."

[Message 32] Kevin: "Remember that guy, the one who used to…"
[Message 33] Brenda: "Don't."

[Message 35] Alice: "There's a time and place, Kevin."
[Message 36] Brenda: "And this isn't it."

[Message 38] Alice: "Let's not go there."

[Message 41] Brenda: "Says you."

[Message 1] CHLOE: "Hey guys, you hear about what happened at the ATM last night? So crazy."
[Message 2] LIAM: "Yeah, Chloe, saw it on the news. Two people, right? Awful."
[Message 3] MAYA: "Heard it was brutal. Who were they?"
[Message 4] CHLOE: "Apparently, a trans man journalist named Alex and some Corrections Officer, Riley. So sad."
[Message 5] LIAM: "Riley? Damn. I knew a Riley, worked down the street. Hope it wasn't them."
[Message 6] MAYA: "Oh wow, Liam. That's so messed up. Anyway, you guys free later? Movie night?"
[Message 7] CHLOE: "Movie sounds good, Maya. I need a distraction. This whole thing is giving me the creeps."
[Message 8] NOAH: "ATM? Evening time is never safe. Terrible. What movie?"
[Message 9] LIAM: "Not sure about tonight, guys. Gotta help my mom with something. Chloe, did you see anything weird yesterday?"
[Message 10] CHLOE: "Weird? Liam, what do you mean? I was home all night. Watched trashy reality TV."
[Message 11] MAYA: "Yeah, Liam, that's kinda a strange question..."
[Message 12] NOAH: "I'm out too guys. My Raspy voice. I have a gig."
[Message 13] CHLOE: "Noah, you always have a gig. What is it this time, open mic night?"
[Message 14] NOAH: "Something like that, Chloe. Gotta hustle, you know?"
[Message 15] LIAM: "Just asking, Chloe. Saw you near the ATM yesterday afternoon. Thought maybe you noticed something."
[Message 16] CHLOE: "Liam, I was nowhere near the ATM. You’re thinking of someone else. Why are you so focused on this?"
[Message 17] MAYA: "Okay, guys, let's chill. This is getting intense. Maybe we should just talk about something else."
[Message 18] NOAH: "Agreed. Too much doom and gloom. Anyone know what really happened anyway?"
[Message 19] LIAM: "They say it was Poisoning via ingestion. Both of them."
[Message 20] CHLOE: "Poisoning via ingestion? That's horrible! Who would do that?"
[Message 21] MAYA: "Seriously messed up. Makes you wonder if they had enemies."
[Message 22] NOAH: "Alex, the journalist, was pretty ambitious. Probably stepped on some toes."
[Message 23] LIAM: "Yeah, heard he was working on a big story. Something about corruption downtown."
[Message 24] CHLOE: "Corruption, huh? That's scary. Maybe that's why..."
[Message 25] MAYA: "Liam, do you remember when you said you wanted to get rid of that manager at your old job? He's the Corrections Officer, Riley right? You were joking, right?"
[Message 26] LIAM: "Maya! That was ages ago, and yes, I was joking! He fired me and I was upset but that doesn't mean I wanted this. I didn’t even know him personally. You're not suggesting..."
[Message 27] NOAH: "Relax Liam. I was buying Poisoning via ingestion at the store last week for pest control. The shouting probably provoked him."
[Message 28] CHLOE: "Pest control? Noah, that's kinda messed up considering the circumstances. You didn't see anything at the ATM, did you?"
[Message 29] NOAH: "Chloe, seriously? No! I was nowhere near there. I was at home, practicing my music."
[Message 30] MAYA: "Okay, I'm officially creeped out. I’m cancelling movie night. I need to process all this."
[Message 31] CHLOE: "Agreed, Maya. This whole thing is giving me bad vibes. I feel like someone is hiding something."
[Message 32] LIAM: "I just hope they catch whoever did this. They're going away for a long time for this."
[Message 33] NOAH: "Me too. Justice needs to be served. Alex was just a kid."
[Message 34] CHLOE: "You guys think it was planned? Like someone intended for this to happen?"
[Message 35] MAYA: "I don't know, Chloe. Maybe a robbery gone wrong? Or Alex got to close to his story?"
[Message 36] NOAH: "I saw him leave the building at Evening. He’s always going around town with his unibrow."
[Message 37] LIAM: "What? When did you see him, Noah? And why didn't you say anything before?"
[Message 38] NOAH: "Just now putting things together, Liam. Calm down. He could have failed to call 911, making the harm worse."
[Message 39] CHLOE: "If he hadn't fired her, none of this would have happened. "
[Message 40] MAYA: "This is all too much. I'm logging off. Hope they find out who did this."

[Message 1] Liam: Hey everyone! Beautiful day for tennis... and maybe a little book chat later?
