[Message 1] CHLOE: "Hey, did you hear about what happened at the Public Restroom?"
[Message 2] RILEY: "Yeah, insane. Two people dead? What a nightmare."
[Message 3] CHLOE: "I know, right? Makes you think twice about going out alone."
[Message 4] RILEY: "Seriously. Anyway, you still up for brunch tomorrow?"
[Message 5] CHLOE: "Definitely! We need some normalcy after this."
[Message 6] JAKE: "Anyone know any details about what went down?"
[Message 7] RILEY: "Just rumors, Jake. Don't get caught up in the gossip."
[Message 8] JAKE: "Hard not to. The Social Worker and Corrections Officer both died, both at the same time at the Public Restroom?"
[Message 9] CHLOE: "Yeah, I heard their names were David and Marcus. Awful."
[Message 10] RILEY: "Terrible. My thoughts are with their families."
[Message 11] JAKE: "Did you guys see Sam yesterday? He was acting really weird."
[Message 12] CHLOE: "Sam? Weird how?"
[Message 13] JAKE: "I don't know, jumpy. Said he needed to clear his head. I saw him leave the building at Late Afternoon yesterday."
[Message 14] RILEY: "Maybe he just had a bad day, Jake. Don't jump to conclusions."
[Message 15] CHLOE: "Yeah, I agree with Riley. Let's not start pointing fingers."
[Message 16] JAKE: "Okay, okay. Just saying, his behavior was off."
[Message 17] RILEY: "Speaking of off, did anyone hear from Kai? They've been MIA lately."
[Message 18] CHLOE: "Now that you mention it, no. Wonder what they're up to."
[Message 19] JAKE: "Kai always keeps to themselves. Probably nothing."
[Message 20] RILEY: "True. Anyway, gotta run. Talk tomorrow!"
[Message 21] CHLOE: "See ya!"
[Message 22] JAKE: "Later."
[Message 23] CHLOE: "So, Jake, what else did Sam say?"
[Message 24] JAKE: "Nothing much. Just kept repeating that everything would be okay. Super cryptic."
[Message 25] CHLOE: "Hmm. You think he knew David? He always hated Social Worker."
[Message 26] JAKE: "Not sure. He worked with Marcus sometimes, I think."
[Message 27] CHLOE: "Okay. This is all just so messed up."
[Message 28] JAKE: "Tell me about it. Hope they catch whoever did this."
[Message 29] CHLOE: "Me too. They're going away for a long time for this. Its horrible."
[Message 30] RILEY: "Hey guys, sorry I dipped so fast. Had to deal with something at work."
[Message 31] CHLOE: "No worries! Everything okay?"
[Message 32] RILEY: "Yeah, just some paperwork. This whole thing with David and Marcus has everyone on edge."
[Message 33] JAKE: "Yeah, Chloe and I were just talking about it. Sam was acting weird yesterday."
[Message 34] RILEY: "Weird how? Be specific, Jake."
[Message 35] JAKE: "Just jumpy. Said he had to clear his head. Left around Late Afternoon. I think he knew Corrections Officer."
[Message 36] RILEY: "Okay. I'll keep that in mind. Has anyone spoken to Kai?"
[Message 37] CHLOE: "Not since yesterday. They've been pretty quiet."
[Message 38] RILEY: "Right. I'm going to head out for a bit. Need some fresh air."
[Message 39] CHLOE: "Okay, stay safe!"
[Message 40] JAKE: "Yeah, be careful out there."
[Message 41] RILEY: "Always am."
[Message 42] CHLOE: "Jake, you think Kai could be involved somehow?"
[Message 43] JAKE: "Nah, Kai's all talk, no action. Besides, Kai is trans, they would never hurt corrections officer like that."
[Message 44] CHLOE: "Maybe you're right. But something feels off about this whole thing."
[Message 45] JAKE: "Tell me about it. Hey, you free later? Wanna watch a movie?"
[Message 46] CHLOE: "Sure, sounds good. I need a distraction."
[Message 47] JAKE: "Perfect. I'll bring the snacks."
[Message 48] CHLOE: "Cool! See ya then."
[Message 49] RILEY: "Okay, back. Just saw Kai at the store. They looked…different."
[Message 50] CHLOE: "Different how? Did you talk to them?"
[Message 51] RILEY: "I tried, but they brushed me off. Said they were in a hurry."
[Message 52] JAKE: "See? Kai's just being Kai. Nothing to worry about."
[Message 53] RILEY: "Maybe. But they were buying Poisoning via inhalation at the store."
[Message 54] CHLOE: "Whoa, what? That's a little sus."
[Message 55] JAKE: "Maybe they're just cleaning? Let's not make assumptions."
[Message 56] RILEY: "True, but it's still weird timing, right?"
[Message 57] CHLOE: "Definitely. I'm starting to get a bad feeling about this."
[Message 58] JAKE: "Look, I'm sure there's a reasonable explanation. Let's just wait and see what the police find."
[Message 59] RILEY: "Fine, but I'm keeping an eye on Kai. Just in case."
[Message 60] CHLOE: "Me too. This is crazy."
[Message 61] JAKE: "Alright, alright. Everyone just needs to chill."
[Message 62] RILEY: "Easy for you to say, Jake."
[Message 63] CHLOE: "Yeah, you seem awfully calm about all this."
[Message 64] JAKE: "I'm just trying to be rational! Someone has to be."
[Message 65] RILEY: "Whatever. I'm going to do some research on this Poisoning via inhalation stuff."
[Message 66] CHLOE: "Good idea. Let me know if you find anything interesting."
[Message 67] JAKE: "I'm going to watch some TV. Need to take my mind off things."
[Message 68] RILEY: "Suit yourself."
[Message 69] CHLOE: "Have fun with that."
[Message 70] RILEY: "Hey, I found something. Apparently, a specific type of Poisoning via inhalation can mimic symptoms of a heart attack."
[Message 71] CHLOE: "Seriously? That's messed up. Could that be what happened to David and Marcus?"
[Message 72] RILEY: "It's possible. And Kai was buying that stuff..."
[Message 73] JAKE: "Guys, seriously, stop. You're scaring yourselves."
[Message 74] CHLOE: "Maybe we should tell the police about Kai?"
[Message 75] RILEY: "I think we should. This is too big to ignore."
[Message 76] JAKE: "Wait, hold on. Let's just think about this for a minute. What if we're wrong?"
[Message 77] CHLOE: "If we're wrong, we're wrong. But what if we're right and we do nothing?"
[Message 78] RILEY: "Exactly. This is about David and Marcus. We owe it to them to say something."
[Message 79] JAKE: "Fine, fine. But I'm staying out of it. I don't want to get involved."
[Message 80] CHLOE: "Suit yourself, Jake. We're doing the right thing."
[Message 81] RILEY: "Agreed. I'm calling the police now."
[Message 82] JAKE: "Just...be careful, okay?"
[Message 83] CHLOE: "We will. Thanks, Jake."
[Message 84] RILEY: "Called them. They're sending someone over to talk to us."
[Message 85] CHLOE: "Good. I hope they catch whoever did this soon."
[Message 86] JAKE: "Me too. This whole thing is just...awful."
[Message 87] RILEY: "Yeah. Hey, Chloe, remember when Kai said they wanted to get rid of him after being misgendered constantly?."
[Message 88] CHLOE: "Vaguely... You don't think they'd act on that, right?"
[Message 89] RILEY: "I don't know anymore. The Poisoning via inhalation purchase, the weird behavior...it's all adding up."
[Message 90] JAKE: "Guys, seriously, you're going to ruin someone's life based on assumptions. Not cool."
[Message 91] CHLOE: "We're not trying to ruin anyone's life, Jake. We're trying to find out who killed David and Marcus."
[Message 92] RILEY: "Exactly. And if Kai is innocent, then they have nothing to worry about."
[Message 93] JAKE: "I still think you're making a mistake. This is going to backfire."
[Message 94] CHLOE: "We'll see. The police are here. Gotta go."
[Message 95] RILEY: "Wish us luck."

[Message 1] Alex: "That wedding reception was...something. Anyone else still processing the groom's speech?"
[Message 2] Jamie: "Oh god, Alex, don't remind me. I think I blocked it out. Cringiest thing I've witnessed in a while."
[Message 3] River: "I thought it was kind of sweet, in a totally awkward, unprepared way. At least he was genuine."
[Message 4] Chris: "Genuine and terrifyingly unfunny. Like, dad-joke level but without the self-awareness."
[Message 5] Jordan: "You guys are harsh! I thought it was endearing. Plus, the cake was amazing, right?"
[Message 6] Alex: "Okay, the cake *was* good. Almost made up for the groom's tangent about his stamp collection."
[Message 7] Jamie: "Stamp collection? I missed that gem. I was too busy trying not to make eye contact with anyone."
[Message 8] River: "He mentioned it briefly. Something about a rare Prussian Blue. I tuned out."
[Message 9] Chris: "Prussian Blue? Sounds expensive. Maybe the wedding was financed by stamps."
[Message 10] Jordan: "Haha, maybe! Speaking of expensive, did anyone see the bride's dress? Stunning, but probably cost a fortune."
[Message 11] Alex: "Definitely a fortune. I'm guessing six figures. Though, I'm pretty sure my security guard salary wouldn't cover the dry cleaning for that dress."
[Message 12] Jamie: "Probably not, Alex. But hey, at least you have the best stories from the mall after hours, right?"
[Message 13] Alex: "True. Saw a guy try to steal a mannequin last week. Now *that's* a wedding story."
[Message 14] River: "A mannequin? Seriously? What was his plan?"
[Message 15] Alex: "Said he needed a date. Tragic and hilarious all at once."
[Message 16] Chris: "Okay, that's way better than the stamp collection story. I'm officially team Mannequin Thief."
[Message 17] Jordan: "You guys are incorrigible! Back to the wedding – anyone tear up during the vows?"
[Message 18] Jamie: "Almost. When his grandma started crying, I felt a little something. I'm a sucker for grandmas."
[Message 19] River: "Me too. Grandmas are the best. Especially when they sneak you extra cookies."
[Message 20] Chris: "Speaking of cookies... I'm suddenly craving chocolate chip. Anyone else?"
[Message 21] Jordan: "Always! I could eat chocolate chip cookies for breakfast, lunch, and dinner."
[Message 22] Alex: "Now you're talking my language. Although, I’m more of a peanut butter cookie guy myself."
[Message 23] Jamie: "Peanut butter? You're a brave soul, Alex. Allergies are everywhere these days."
[Message 24] Alex: "True. But I live on the edge, Jamie. You know this. It's the security guard life."
[Message 25] River: "I’m partial to oatmeal raisin. Fight me."
[Message 26] Chris: "Oatmeal raisin?! River, I thought we were friends!"
[Message 27] Jordan: "Okay, let's not start a cookie war. Can't we all just agree that cookies are delicious?"
[Message 28] Jamie: "Agreed. All cookies are created equal. Except maybe those weird anise ones."
[Message 29] Alex: "Anise cookies... Now *that's* a truly terrifying wedding reception experience."
[Message 30] River: "Haha, true. I saw those. Avoided them like the plague."
[Message 31] Chris: "Okay, back to the original topic. Groom's speech. Rate it 1-10. 1 being a masterpiece, 10 being a train wreck."
[Message 32] Jordan: "I'd say a 5. Middle of the road. Not great, not terrible."
[Message 33] Alex: "8. It was painful to watch. Like a slow-motion car crash."
[Message 34] Jamie: "9. The stamp collection sealed its fate. Almost walked out."
[Message 35] River: "6. I'm feeling generous. He tried."
[Message 36] Chris: "Okay, so overall, a resounding 'meh'. Glad we're all on the same page."
[Message 37] Jordan: "Well, at least the bride seemed happy. That's what matters, right?"
[Message 38] Alex: "True. As long as she's happy. And has a good sense of humor."
[Message 39] Jamie: "And a lifetime supply of stamps, apparently."
[Message 40] River: "Maybe she's a philatelist? You never know."
[Message 41] Chris: "A philatelist? Is that even a word? Sounds like something from Harry Potter."
[Message 42] Jordan: "It's a real word! It means someone who collects stamps."
[Message 43] Alex: "You learn something new every day. Even from a wedding reception conversation gone sideways."
[Message 44] Jamie: "Speaking of sideways, I'm starting to feel a bit sleepy. Long day of wrenching on cars."
[Message 45] River: "Me too. I’ve got an early morning tomorrow, gotta get back to those electrical panels."
[Message 46] Chris: "Yeah, I should probably head out as well. Need to prep for my patients tomorrow."
[Message 47] Jordan: "Alright everyone, it was fun rehashing the wedding. Maybe we can do this again soon?"
[Message 48] Alex: "Sounds good to me. Next time, no stamp collections, please."
[Message 49] Jamie: "Deal. And fewer anise cookies."
[Message 50] River: "Definitely fewer anise cookies. Goodnight everyone!"
[Message 51] Chris: "Goodnight! Drive safe."
[Message 52] Jordan: "Goodnight all!"
[Message 53] Alex: "Night everyone. If you hear of any mannequin thefts, let me know."
[Message 54] Jamie: "Will do, Alex. Sleep well!"
[Message 55] River: "Seriously, goodnight! Haha."
[Message 56] Chris: "Okay, okay, goodnight for real this time!"
[Message 57] Jordan: "One last thing: did anyone get a good picture of the centerpieces? I forgot to!"
[Message 58] Alex: "I think I snapped one. Let me check my phone..."
[Message 59] Jamie: "I got a blurry one. Don't think it's usable haha."
[Message 60] Alex: "Ah, here's one! Sending it to the group now. Night for real

[Message 1] Sarah: Hey guys, did you hear about what happened at Doctor's Office last night?

[Message 2] Mark: Yeah, it's all over the news. Crazy. Two people dead.

[Message 3] Emily: I know, right? So awful. Anyone know who the victims were?

[Message 4] Sarah: They're saying a 16-year-old and a Corrections Officer.

[Message 5] David: Corrections Officer? Wow. That's intense. You think it was work-related?

[Message 6] Mark: Could be. Or just a random act of violence. Syracuse is getting rough.

[Message 7] Emily: I heard one was named Ashley. Poor Ashley. So young.

[Message 8] David: Ashley, huh? I don't think I knew her.

[Message 9] Sarah: I saw Carol leaving Doctor's Office around Sunset yesterday. Weird.

[Message 10] Mark: Carol? Seriously? What was she doing there?

[Message 11] Emily: She said she had an appointment for her foot. I think she mentioned something like physical therapy.

[Message 12] David: Carol and Ashley? Different crowds.

[Message 13] Sarah: That's what I thought. Just seemed odd. I went to visit my grandma, its been a while.

[Message 14] Mark: Yeah, Carol's got that clubfoot thing, right? Prob needed therapy.

[Message 15] Emily: Poor thing. I can't imagine living with that.

[Message 16] David: So, anything else on the news about it?

[Message 17] Sarah: They're not saying much. Just that they're investigating. They have few suspects.

[Message 18] Mark: Probably some psycho off the streets.

[Message 19] Emily: I hope they catch whoever did it.

[Message 20] David: Me too. So, anyone up for grabbing some pizza later?

[Message 21] Sarah: I'm in! Need something to take my mind off this.

[Message 22] Mark: Count me in. Emily?

[Message 23] Emily: Sure, why not.

[Message 24] David: Alright, cool. 7 PM at Nino's?

[Message 25] Sarah: Perfect.

[Message 26] Mark: See you guys then.

[Message 27] Emily: Later.

[Message 28] Sarah: Hey Mark, did you see Jason yesterday? I needed to ask him about something.

[Message 29] Mark: Nah, didn't see him. He's been pretty MIA lately.

[Message 30] David: I saw Jason at the bar. He was talking about how he hated Corrections Officers.

[Message 31] Emily: Oh dear. Why?

[Message 32] David: Apparently, one gave his brother a hard time in prison.

[Message 33] Sarah: That's... concerning.

[Message 34] Mark: Eh, Jason always exaggerates. He probably didn't mean anything by it.

[Message 35] Emily: Still, bad timing, right?

[Message 36] David: Yeah, you could say that. Anyway pizza?

[Message 37] Sarah: Let’s just try to relax at pizza, okay?

[Message 38] Mark: Agreed.

[Message 39] Emily: Okay.

[Message 40] Sarah: Hey Emily, did you know the other victim was named Sam?

[Message 41] Emily: Sam? No, I didn't. I thought it was just Ashley.

[Message 42] David: I heard Sam was trans.

[Message 43] Mark: Really? News travels fast.

[Message 44] Sarah: I saw Jason looking up how to make Drowning in a bathtub online last week.

[Message 45] Emily: Whoa, Sarah! Seriously? Why didn't you say something before?

[Message 46] David: What the hell, Sarah?! Now I'm starting to worry about what I said at the bar.

[Message 47] Mark: Hold on, hold on. Let's not jump to conclusions. Maybe he was just doing research for a story or something.

[Message 48] Sarah: He's not a writer, Mark. And I intended not to say anything, but this is going too far.

[Message 49] Emily: I'm feeling really uneasy now. I think we should tell the police about Jason.

[Message 50] David: Agreed. This is getting way too serious.

[Message 51] Mark: Alright, alright. But let's all go together, okay? Strength in numbers.

[Message 52] Sarah: Deal.

[Message 53] Emily: Okay. When?

[Message 54] David: How about tomorrow morning? First thing?

[Message 55] Sarah: Sounds good.

[Message 56] Mark: Fine by me.

[Message 57] Emily: Okay, see you all then.

[Message 58] Mark: Hey, Emily, can I ask you something in private?

[Message 59] Emily: Sure, what's up?

[Message 60] Mark: Do you really think Jason could have done it? I mean, I know he's got a temper, but murder?

[Message 61] Emily: I don't know, Mark. But Sarah's message freaked me out. And David's comment about the bar...

[Message 62] Mark: I know, it doesn't look good. But what if we're wrong? We could ruin his life.

[Message 63] Emily: And what if we're right and he hurts someone else? I don't know, Mark. I'm so confused.

[Message 64] Mark: Me too. Okay, let's just see what the police say tomorrow. We'll tell them everything we know, and they can decide.

[Message 65] Emily: Okay, that sounds fair.

[Message 66] Mark: Good. Thanks for listening, Emily.

[Message 67] Emily: Anytime, Mark. We're in this together.

[Message 68] Sarah: You guys still going for pizza later?

[Message 69] Mark: Nah, Emily and I are gonna pass. Too much on our minds.

[Message 70] Sarah: Oh. Okay. Well, you guys take care. David and I will go.

[Message 71] Emily: You too, Sarah.

[Message 72] David: See ya.

[Message 73] Sarah: I really didn’t like Sam. He was always being mean.

[Message 74] David: You were aware of what I was doing with Ashley last night, right?

[Message 75] Sarah: Hope they don't get the death penalty.

[Message 1] Maya: Hey Alex, you heard about what happened at school?

[Message 1] CHLOE: Did you guys hear about what happened at the bank?
[Message 2] MARK: Yeah, crazy. Two people dead.
[Message 3] ANNA: I know! So awful. Who were they?
[Message 4] CHLOE: Someone named David and uh... I think they said Sam.
[Message 5] MARK: David? I think I know a David who works there. Short hair?
[Message 6] ANNA: Oh no! That's terrible!
[Message 7] CHLOE: I heard one of them was a cop.
[Message 8] MARK: A cop?! What the heck happened?
[Message 9] ANNA: No idea. Just saw it on the news. Said something about the police investigating.
[Message 10] CHLOE: I'm supposed to meet Jamie later. Should I cancel?
[Message 11] MARK: Why would you cancel? It's not like you're involved.
[Message 12] ANNA: I agree. Don't let it ruin your plans.
[Message 13] CHLOE: True. Just feels weird, you know? Everyone's on edge.
[Message 14] MARK: Speaking of weird, Jamie’s been acting strange lately, hasn't she?
[Message 15] ANNA: How so?
[Message 16] MARK: Just… distant. And she was asking about… never mind.
[Message 17] CHLOE: Asking about what? Now you have to tell us!
[Message 18] MARK: It’s nothing, really. Just forget I said anything.
[Message 19] ANNA: Mark, come on! Don’t leave us hanging.
[Message 20] CHLOE: Yeah, spill! Is it about David or Sam?

[Message 1] Liam: "Hey, you hear about what happened down by the bike path last night?"
[Message 2] Noah: "No, what's up?"
[Message 3] Liam: "Some terrible accident. A woman was killed. Hit and run."
[Message 4] Noah: "Damn, that's awful. Any idea who it was?"
[Message 5] Liam: "I heard it was that transgender woman, Sarah, the social worker."
[Message 6] Noah: "Sarah? I think I met her once. Real shame. Was anyone with her?"
[Message 7] Liam: "Not that I know of. Seems like she was just walking home."
[Message 8] Noah: "This is crazy. What's the world coming to?"
[Message 9] Liam: "Tell me about it. The police are all over the place, asking questions."
[Message 10] Noah: "Have they got any leads?"
[Message 11] Liam: "Rumor is they are talking to Mark. Apparently, he was seen in the area last night."
[Message 12] Noah: "Mark? The guy with the perfectly manicured fingernails? Why him?"
[Message 13] Liam: "Don't know. Maybe wrong place, wrong time. I heard Mark and Sarah didn't get along. Always bickering."
[Message 14] Noah: "I can't imagine Mark hurting anyone. He's always seemed pretty chill to me."
[Message 15] Liam: "You never know, do you? People can surprise you. Remember when Mark got fired?"
[Message 16] Noah: "Oh yeah! About a month ago? That was about Sarah if I recall."
[Message 17] Liam: "Apparently, he blamed her for it. Said she cost him everything."
[Message 18] Noah: "Woah, that's a motive if I ever heard one."
[Message 19] Liam: "Exactly! The other thing is apparently he wanted to leave his old job anyway."
[Message 20] Noah: "I still have a hard time believing it. I just saw Mark two days ago, and he was buying Car accident (vehicular homicide) at the store, he needed to fix his car."
[Message 21] Liam: "Buying Car accident (vehicular homicide)? Why would he need that?"
[Message 22] Noah: "His car needed it! He was fixing it up."
[Message 23] Liam: "Hmm, ok. Anyway, I gotta run. Catch you later."
[Message 24] Noah: "Alright, man. Keep me updated."
[Message 25] Ava: "Hey Noah, did Liam tell you what happened to Sarah?"
[Message 26] Noah: "Yeah, it's terrible. I feel so bad for her family. What is the police doing?"
[Message 27] Ava: "They talked to Mark. He's so stressed, I feel bad for him."
[Message 28] Noah: "Stressed? Why is he stressed? Did he do something?"
[Message 29] Ava: "No, no, of course not! But he was near the bike path last night. He said he was taking a walk to clear his head."
[Message 30] Noah: "That's... convenient. Especially since he hated social workers."
[Message 31] Ava: "He didn't *hate* her, Noah! They just had disagreements. And he only said that in anger."
[Message 32] Noah: "Did he say anything else that was anger? Or maybe talking about hurting her right before he went over there?"
[Message 33] Ava: "Don't do that! He would never hurt anyone! You know he is protecting a loved one from harm."
[Message 34] Noah: "Protecting a loved one? From what? Sarah?"
[Message 35] Ava: "I didn't say that! Look, he's just scared. The cops are really putting the pressure on him. Hope they don't get the death penalty."
[Message 36] Noah: "Why would they put the pressure on him if he's innocent? I heard he was looking up how to make Car accident (vehicular homicide) online."
[Message 37] Ava: "That's ridiculous! He was researching car repairs! Someone told him a cheap way to do it."
[Message 38] Noah: "Right... Well, if he's innocent, he's got nothing to worry about."
[Message 39] Ava: "Exactly! I tried to talk him out of even going to the police, but he insisted."
[Message 40] Noah: "Insisted? Sounds like he's trying too hard to look innocent."
[Message 41] Ava: "You're being paranoid. Anyway, I have to go. I'm making dinner for Mark."
[Message 42] Noah: "Alright. Let me know if anything else comes up."
[Message 43] Ava: "Will do."

[Message 45] Ava: "Of course, Mark. Anything for you. How are you holding up?"
[Message 46] Mark: "Not great, to be honest. They keep asking the same questions over and over. About Sarah, about everything."

[Message 48] Mark: "Easy for you to say. They keep implying I had something to do with it. Because I blamed her after she fired me."

[Message 65] Liam: "Me too. Justice for Sarah."

[Message 1] Liam: "Loud in here."
[Message 2] Chloe: "Yeah, it is."
[Message 3] Liam: "Remember those summer nights?"
[Message 4] Chloe: "Barely."
[Message 5] Liam: "Fireflies."
[Message 6] Chloe: "Right."
[Message 7] Liam: "Simpler times."
[Message 8] Chloe: "Definitely simpler."
[Message 9] Liam: "Do you ever think about...the orchard?"
[Message 10] Chloe: "Sometimes. Why?"
[Message 11] Liam: "Just...wondering."
[Message 12] Chloe: "It was a long time ago."
[Message 13] Liam: "Still..."
[Message 14] Chloe: "What's done is done."

[Message 17] Liam: "Nothing. Sorry."
[Message 18] Chloe: "This music is awful."
[Message 19] Liam: "Agreed."
[Message 20] Chloe: "Want to get another drink?"
[Message 21] Liam: "Sure."
[Message 22] Chloe: "My treat."

[Message 24] Chloe: "So..."
[Message 25] Liam: "So?"
[Message 26] Chloe: "You're still..."
[Message 27] Liam: "Still what?"
[Message 28] Chloe: "Never mind."
[Message 29] Liam: "No, tell me."
[Message 30] Chloe: "It's not important."

[Message 33] Liam: "Always."
[Message 34] Chloe: "It's been years, Liam."
[Message 35] Liam: "Doesn't matter."
[Message 36] Chloe: "It does."
[Message 37] Liam: "They don't forget."
[Message 38] Chloe: "Who?"
[Message 39] Liam: "You know."
[Message 40] Chloe: "Don't do that."
[Message 41] Liam: "Do what?"
[Message 42] Chloe: "Speak in riddles."

[Message 44] Chloe: "Yes, you are."
[Message 45] Liam: "Just cautious."
[Message 46] Chloe: "There's a difference."

[Message 48] Chloe: "Yes."
[Message 49] Liam: "Fine."
[Message 50] Chloe: "The documents are compromised."
[Message 51] Liam: "What?!"
[Message 52] Chloe: "I just found out."
[Message 53] Liam: "How?"
[Message 54] Chloe: "Doesn't matter. It's done."
[Message 55] Liam: "This changes everything."
[Message 56] Chloe: "Maybe."
[Message 57] Liam: "Maybe?!?"
[Message 58] Chloe: "Don't panic."
[Message 59] Liam: "How can I not panic?"
[Message 60] Chloe: "Lower your voice."
[Message 61] Liam: "Sorry."
[Message 62] Chloe: "We need to think."

[Message 65] Liam: "Where did you hear this?"
[Message 66] Chloe: "A reliable source."
[Message 67] Liam: "Who?"
[Message 68] Chloe: "I can't say."
[Message 69] Liam: "Of course."
[Message 70] Chloe: "Trust me on this."

[Message 72] Chloe: "Not really."
[Message 73] Liam: "Great."
[Message 74] Chloe: "It could be worse."
[Message 75] Liam: "How?"
[Message 76] Chloe: "They could know about..."
[Message 77] Liam: "Don't."
[Message 78] Chloe: "Sorry."
[Message 79] Liam: "We have to leave."
[Message 80] Chloe: "Where would we go?"
[Message 81] Liam: "Doesn't matter, anywhere."
[Message 82] Chloe: "Running won't solve anything."
[Message 83] Liam: "What will?"
[Message 84] Chloe: "I don't know yet."
[Message 85] Liam: "Fantastic."
[Message 86] Chloe: "We need information."
[Message 87] Liam: "About?"
[Message 88] Chloe: "Who compromised them and why."
[Message 89] Liam: "That's a tall order."
[Message 90] Chloe: "We don't have a choice."
[Message 91] Liam: "True."
[Message 92] Chloe: "Okay. New plan."
[Message 93] Liam: "What is it?"
[Message 94] Chloe: "Meet me tomorrow."
[Message 95] Liam: "Where?"
[Message 96] Chloe: "The usual place."
[Message 97] Liam: "Okay."
[Message 98] Chloe: "Be careful."
[Message 99] Liam: "You too."
[Message 100] Chloe: "I always am."
[Message 101] Liam: "Right."
[Message 102] Chloe: "One more drink?"

[Message 104] Chloe: "Alright."
[Message 105] Liam: "See you tomorrow."
[Message 106] Chloe: "Tomorrow."

[Message 109] Liam: "Good."

[Message 1] Alex: "Morning! Just got to Customs, ugh. Early flight."
[Message 2] Jamie: "Morning! At least you made it! I'm still debating getting out of bed."
[Message 3] Alex: "Anything exciting to look forward to today?"
[Message 4] Jamie: "Work, work, and more work. Gotta give some feedback on a new marketing campaign. You?"
[Message 5] Alex: "Just paperwork at Customs, then hopefully a good book in the evening."
[Message 6] Jamie: "Ooh, what are you reading?"
[Message 7] Alex: "Thinking of starting 'The House in the Cerulean Sea' heard good things."
[Message 8] Jamie: "Oh, I've heard of that! It's supposed to be really heartwarming."
[Message 9] Alex: "That's what I need after dealing with customs forms, haha."
[Message 10] Jamie: "Totally get it. Speaking of which, any interesting travel plans on the horizon?"
[Message 11] Alex: "Not yet, but I'm dreaming of hiking in Patagonia."
[Message 12] Jamie: "Whoa, that's ambitious! I'm more of a stay-cation kind of person."
[Message 13] Alex: "Each to their own! What kind of books are you into?"
[Message 14] Jamie: "I'm a sucker for fantasy. Anything with dragons, I'm there."
[Message 15] Alex: "Nice! Have you read 'Eragon'?"
[Message 16] Jamie: "Classic! Read it years ago. Loved it. Have you read 'The Priory of the Orange Tree'?"
[Message 17] Alex: "Nope, never heard of it. What's it about?"
[Message 18] Jamie: "It's a standalone epic fantasy. Really well-written with cool world-building. Lots of dragons, obviously."
[Message 19] Alex: "I'll add it to my list! Always looking for new recommendations."
[Message 20] Jamie: "Definitely do! Okay, gotta run, got a meeting. Talk later?"
[Message 21] Alex: "Sounds good! Good luck with the feedback!"
[Message 22] Jamie: "Thanks! Wish me luck. Later!"
[Message 23] Alex: "You got this! 👍"
[Message 24] Alex: "Alright, finally through! That was a surprisingly smooth process."
[Message 25] Alex: "Now to find some coffee."
[Message 26] Alex: "Anyone else awake and wanting to chat about books?"
[Message 27] Sam: "Just woke up! Coffee is brewing. Books? Always."
[Message 28] Alex: "Haha, perfect timing. Any recommendations for someone looking for something heartwarming?"
[Message 29] Sam: "Definitely 'A Psalm for the Wild-Built' by Becky Chambers. Short, sweet, and just…nice."
[Message 30] Alex: "Ooh, that sounds interesting. What's it about?"
[Message 31] Sam: "It's about a monk who decides to leave their monastery and see if there's still life outside of it. Encounters a robot in the wilderness."
[Message 32] Alex: "A robot? Okay, I'm intrigued."
[Message 33] Sam: "Trust me, it's lovely. Very calming."
[Message 34] Alex: "Adding it to the list! My TBR pile is getting out of control."
[Message 35] Sam: "Story of my life! So, you're at the Customs office? Heading out of town?"
[Message 36] Alex: "Nope, just picking something up. A package from overseas."
[Message 37] Sam: "Ah, mystery package! Hopefully, it's something good."
[Message 38] Alex: "Fingers crossed! Probably just some books, knowing me."
[Message 39] Sam: "Haha, sounds about right. Any good bookshops in Colorado Springs?"
[Message 40] Alex: "There are a couple of decent ones. Poor Richard's is a classic."
[Message 41] Sam: "I'll have to check it out sometime. Always looking for new places to browse."
[Message 42] Alex: "Definitely worth a visit! They also have a cool cafe."
[Message 43] Sam: "Even better! Coffee and books, a perfect combination."
[Message 44] Alex: "Exactly! What are you reading right now?"
[Message 45] Sam: "I'm currently slogging through 'Infinite Jest'. It's…a lot."
[Message 46] Alex: "Oh wow, that's a commitment! I've heard it's dense."
[Message 47] Sam: "Dense is an understatement. But I'm determined to finish it."
[Message 48] Alex: "I admire your dedication! I usually give up on books if they don't grab me pretty quickly."
[Message 49] Sam: "I used to be like that, but I'm trying to be more patient. Sometimes the payoff is worth it."
[Message 50] Alex: "That's a good point. Maybe I should try that approach too."
[Message 51] Alex: "So, 'The House in the Cerulean Sea' or 'A Psalm for the Wild-Built'? Decisions, decisions…"
[Message 52] Sam: "'Psalm' is shorter, so maybe start with that? It's a good palate cleanser."
[Message 53] Alex: "Good call. Palate cleanser it is!"
[Message 54] Sam: "Let me know what you think!"
[Message 55] Alex: "Will do! Thanks for the recommendation!"
[Message 56] Sam: "Anytime!"
[Message 57] Jamie: "Okay, feedback session done! It went…okay. Could have been worse."
[Message 58] Alex: "Glad to hear it wasn't a disaster! What kind of feedback did you give?"
[Message 59] Jamie: "Mostly just tweaking the marketing copy and suggesting some different visuals. Nothing major."
[Message 60] Alex: "Sounds manageable. Sometimes those things can be a real headache."
[Message 61] Jamie: "Tell me about it! So, did you pick up your package?"
[Message 62] Alex: "Yep! And you were right, it's mostly books."
[Message 63] Jamie: "Haha, I knew it! Anything interesting?"
[Message 64] Alex: "A few classics I've been meaning to read, and a couple of new releases."
[Message 65] Jamie: "Nice! What classics?"
[Message 66] Alex: "'Pride and Prejudice' and 'To Kill a Mockingbird'. Finally getting around to them."
[Message 67] Jamie: "Oh, you're in for a treat! 'To Kill a Mockingbird' is amazing."
[Message 68] Alex: "That's what everyone says! I'm excited to finally read it."

[Message 1] Liam: "Did you ever make it to the Galapagos?"
[Message 2] Sarah: "Not yet. Still on the list. You?"
[Message 3] Liam: "Flew right over it, practically."
[Message 4] Sarah: "Busy?"
[Message 5] Liam: "Something like that."
[Message 6] Sarah: "This place is... cheerful."
[Message 7] Liam: "Fake plants help."
[Message 8] Sarah: "They really don't."
[Message 9] Liam: "Remember that trip to Zion?"
[Message 10] Sarah: "Vaguely."
[Message 11] Liam: "We almost didn't make it back."
[Message 12] Sarah: "Almost?"
[Message 13] Liam: "Flash flood. Scary stuff."
[Message 14] Sarah: "Right. Water."
[Message 15] Liam: "Keeps you on your toes."
[Message 16] Sarah: "Keeps you wet."
[Message 17] Liam: "Speaking of which, how's... everything?"
[Message 18] Sarah: "Stable, I guess."
[Message 19] Liam: "Just... stable?"
[Message 20] Sarah: "What else is there?"
[Message 21] Liam: "I don't know. Options?"
[Message 22] Sarah: "Options are overrated."
[Message 23] Liam: "Maybe. Maybe not."
[Message 24] Sarah: "Did you check again?"
[Message 25] Liam: "Checked what?"
[Message 26] Sarah: "You know..."
[Message 27] Liam: "Around. A bit."
[Message 28] Sarah: "And?"
[Message 29] Liam: "Nothing."
[Message 30] Sarah: "That's... not ideal."
[Message 31] Liam: "No. It isn't."
[Message 32] Sarah: "This whole thing..."
[Message 33] Liam: "Is what it is."
[Message 34] Sarah: "Easy for you to say."
[Message 35] Liam: "I'm not saying it's easy."
[Message 36] Sarah: "Then what are you saying?"
[Message 37] Liam: "Just... facts."
[Message 38] Sarah: "Facts don't help."
[Message 39] Liam: "What would help?"
[Message 40] Sarah: "Knowing where it is."
[Message 41] Liam: "Right. That."
[Message 42] Sarah: "Is it possible..."
[Message 43] Liam: "Anything's possible."
[Message 44] Sarah: "But likely?"
[Message 45] Liam: "Less so."
[Message 46] Sarah: "Great."
[Message 47] Liam: "Look, I'm doing what I can."
[Message 48] Sarah: "Are you?"
[Message 49] Liam: "Yes! Of course."
[Message 50] Sarah: "Feels a little... hands-off."
[Message 51] Liam: "I can't exactly..."
[Message 52] Sarah: "Exactly what?"
[Message 53] Liam: "Be everywhere at once."
[Message 54] Sarah: "Someone should be."
[Message 55] Liam: "Agreed."
[Message 56] Sarah: "This trip was supposed to be different."
[Message 57] Liam: "It is different."
[Message 58] Sarah: "Not in a good way."
[Message 59] Liam: "Perspective."
[Message 60] Sarah: "Whose?"
[Message 61] Liam: "Anyone's but yours, apparently."
[Message 62] Sarah: "Funny."
[Message 63] Liam: "Lighten up."
[Message 64] Sarah: "I'm trying."
[Message 65] Liam: "Think of the beach."
[Message 66] Sarah: "Which one?"
[Message 67] Liam: "Any beach."
[Message 68] Sarah: "Empty beaches exist?"
[Message 69] Liam: "Okay, mountain then."
[Message 70] Sarah: "Too many memories."
[Message 71] Liam: "Okay, uh... desert?"
[Message 72] Sarah: "Hot and dry."
[Message 73] Liam: "Fine, this waiting room."
[Message 74] Sarah: "Perfect."
[Message 75] Liam: "Sarcasm noted."
[Message 76] Sarah: "What about them?"
[Message 77] Liam: "Who?"
[Message 78] Sarah: "You know. The people."
[Message 79] Liam: "What about them?"
[Message 80] Sarah: "Their involvement."
[Message 81] Liam: "Minimal. Hopefully."
[Message 82] Sarah: "Hopefully?"
[Message 83] Liam: "As far as I know."
[Message 84] Sarah: "And if not?"
[Message 85] Liam: "Then we deal with it."
[Message 86] Sarah: "Deal with it how?"
[Message 87] Liam: "Carefully."
[Message 88] Sarah: "That's reassuring."
[Message 89] Liam: "It's honest."
[Message 90] Sarah: "Honesty is overrated."
[Message 91] Liam: "Now who's being difficult?"
[Message 92] Sarah: "Just saying."
[Message 93] Liam: "I thought you wanted answers."
[Message 94] Sarah: "I want *the* answer."
[Message 95] Liam: "Which is...?"
[Message 96] Sarah: "Where it is!"
[Message 97] Liam: "Right. Still looking."
[Message 98] Sarah: "Maybe it's gone."
[Message 99] Liam: "Let's not jump to conclusions."
[Message 100] Sarah: "But what if?"
[Message 101] Liam: "Then we figure something else out."
[Message 102] Sarah: "Like what?"
[Message 103] Liam: "I don't know yet!"
[Message 104] Sarah: "Fantastic."
[Message 105] Liam: "Don't lose hope."
[Message 106] Sarah: "Hard not to."
[Message 107] Liam: "Think of the future."
[Message 108] Sarah: "What future?"
[Message 109] Liam: "A bright one."
[Message 110] Sarah: "Based on what?"
[Message 111] Liam: "Faith?"
[Message 112] Sarah: "That's your plan?"
[Message 113] Liam: "It's a start."
[Message 114] Sarah: "A weak one."
[Message 115] Liam: "Maybe."
[Message 116] Sarah: "This whole situation..."
[Message 117] Liam: "Is temporary."
[Message 118] Sarah: "Is it?"
[Message 119] Liam: "Has to be."
[Message 120] Sarah: "Why?"
[Message 121] Liam: "Because I said so."
[Message 122] Sarah: "That's not very convincing."
[Message 123] Liam: "It's all I've got."
[Message 124] Sarah: "I guess."
[Message 125] Liam: "We'll find it."
[Message 126] Sarah: "Promise?"
[Message 127] Liam: "I... I hope so."
[Message 128] Sarah: "Hoping isn't enough."
[Message 129] Liam: "I know."
[Message 130] Sarah: "Then do something."
[Message 131] Liam: "I am doing something!"
[Message 132] Sarah: "Doesn't feel like it."
[Message 133] Liam: "Just trust me."
[Message 134] Sarah: "Trust is earned."
[Message 135] Liam: "I'm trying to earn it."
[Message 136] Sarah: "Try harder."
[Message 137] Liam: "Okay."
[Message 138] Sarah: "Did you ask him?"
[Message 139] Liam: "Who?"
[Message 140] Sarah: "You know who."
[Message 141] Liam: "Not yet."
[Message 142] Sarah: "Why not?"
[Message 143] Liam: "Timing isn't right."
[Message 144] Sarah: "When will it be?"
[Message 145] Liam: "Soon, I hope."
[Message 146] Sarah: "He needs to know."
[Message 147] Liam: "I know, I know."
[Message 148] Sarah: "Before it's too late."
[Message 149] Liam: "It's not too late."
[Message 150] Sarah: "Don't be so sure."
[Message 151] Liam: "I'm not."

[Message 1] Chloe: Hey guys, anyone seen my blue sweater?

[Message 2] Maya: No, sorry Chloe. Hey Liam, you still up for that movie tomorrow?

[Message 3] Liam: Yeah, definitely Maya! What time?

[Message 4] Chloe: Did something happen at University last night? I heard sirens.

[Message 6] Maya: Just rumors, probably. You know how University is.

[Message 1] Quinn: "Morning, Liam! Just admiring this shiny red SUV. Thinking of downsizing. How are you today?"

[Message 1] Kai: Yo, did you guys hear about what happened to Judge Thompson?

[Message 2] Liam: No way! What happened?

[Message 3] Kai: They found him at the bottom of the Tunnel last night.

[Message 4] Maya: OMG! seriously? That's awful!

[Message 5] Omar: Tunnel? Seriously? Was it an accident?

[Message 6] Kai: Cops are calling it suspicious. Someone pushed him, apparently. Late Evening.

[Message 7] Liam: Pushed? From the top? Who would do that? Judge Thompson was a legend.

[Message 8] Maya: He wasn't always liked. He was a pretty cynical guy, you know?

[Message 9] Omar: True. He made some enemies during his career. Remember the Miller case?

[Message 10] Kai: Guys, let's not speculate. Someone lost their life.

[Message 11] Liam: Right, sorry. Still, crazy stuff. Hope they catch who did it.

[Message 12] Maya: Me too. I was at the Tunnel yesterday afternoon, taking photos. Scary to think it happened there.

[Message 13] Omar: I saw River near the Tunnel yesterday Evening. Around 11 PM.

[Message 14] Kai: River? What were they doing there so late?

[Message 15] Omar: Don't know. Just saw them walking away. Seemed like they were rushing.

[Message 16] Liam: River? The religious extremist River? What would they want with Judge Thompson?

[Message 17] Maya: Maybe nothing. It's a public place.

[Message 18] Kai: I don't know, River has always been intense. Remember that time they wanted to silence that journalist?

[Message 19] Omar: Yeah, River is always talking about justice and divine retribution. I heard them say, Judge Thompson was obstructing the truth.

[Message 20] Liam: What? Did you hear them threaten the judge, or anything?

[Message 21] Omar: No, nothing like that. Just venting, I guess. But River did want to get rid of him, in his own way.

[Message 22] Maya: Guys, this is serious. We should tell the police what we know. Even if it's just a little bit.

[Message 23] Kai: Yeah, good idea. I'm going to call them now.

[Message 24] Liam: Me too. I'll tell them about seeing Omar getting Pushing from a height supplies earlier that day.

[Message 25] Omar: What? I didn't buy anything like that! I was getting groceries! You know I hate Tunnel!

[Message 26] Maya: Okay, guys, calm down. Let's not turn on each other.

[Message 27] Kai: Yeah, let's just focus on helping the police find who did this. Poor Judge Thompson... I was aware of his flaws but he didn't deserve that.

[Message 28] Liam: Did anyone hear about Judge's plan to expose corruption in the city? It's been silenced with him.

[Message 29] Omar: Maybe... or maybe it's just a coincidence, like you said.

[Message 30] River: Guys, this is terrible. I can't believe Judge Thompson is gone. I know some people will say I intended to harm him, but that's ridiculous. I'm cooperating fully with the police. Hope they find justice, and the culprit goes away for a long time for this.

[Message 1] Liam: Hey Maya, you okay? Heard about what happened down at Cemetery.

[Message 22] Maya: Right. She was cynical, always saying the world was against her.

[Message 23] Liam: Yeah, Dana always seemed stressed. I asked her to drive faster, she looked at me and said I should stop asking her to do that, she will do at her own pace.

[Message 24] Sarah: I remember seeing her argue with someone near the coffee shop downtown last week.

[Message 25] Maya: Who was she arguing with, Sarah?

[Message 26] Sarah: Didn't get a good look, just saw two people yelling.

[Message 27] Liam: Crap, wish you'd gotten more info.

[Message 28] Maya: Maybe it's nothing. People argue all the time. I was buying Arson by setting a fire last week at the store, I hope I am not under investigation now.

[Message 29] Liam: Arson by setting a fire?! Why did you buy that?

[Message 30] Sarah: Maya, that is suspicious! Why?

[Message 31] Maya: Relax, guys. It was for a bonfire at my friend's place next month.

[Message 32] Liam: Oh. Okay. Still, maybe don’t mention that to the police.

[Message 33] Sarah: Good advice, Liam.

[Message 34] Maya: Yeah, probably smart. Thanks.

[Message 35] Liam: Anyway, back to the case… anything else stand out to anyone?

[Message 36] Sarah: I saw someone leave the building at Dusk, but I couldn't tell who it was. It was too dark.

[Message 37] Maya: Dusk is the worst time. Not quite day, not quite night.

[Message 38] Liam: That sucks, Sarah. It could've been helpful.

[Message 39] Sarah: I know! I feel terrible.

[Message 40] Maya: Dont beat yourself up. It’s not your fault. I know this is weird, but has anyone been contacted by the police yet?

[Message 41] Liam: Nope, not me.

[Message 42] Sarah: Me neither.

[Message 43] Maya: Okay, just checking. I’m going to try and get some sleep. This whole thing is giving me a headache.

[Message 44] Liam: Goodnight, Maya. Sleep well.

[Message 45] Sarah: Goodnight guys.

[Message 46] Liam: (Next day) Hey Sarah, Maya, coffee still on for tomorrow?

[Message 47] Sarah: Yeah, I'm in. Need to get out of the house.

[Message 48] Maya: I'm still good for coffee.

[Message 49] Liam: Cool. This case is going to haunt me for a while. What were those two people doing in a cemetery at Dusk anyway?

[Message 50] Sarah: Good question.

[Message 51] Maya: Maybe they were meeting someone? Or visiting a grave?

[Message 52] Liam: Visiting a grave at Dusk? Seems a bit morbid.

[Message 53] Sarah: Maybe it was something illicit? You know, like a secret rendezvous.

[Message 54] Maya: Maybe. Or maybe it was something completely innocent and they were just in the wrong place at the wrong time.

[Message 55] Liam: If he hadn't fired her, none of this would have happened. The manager should have hired someone else.

[Message 56] Sarah: What do you mean, Liam?

[Message 57] Liam: Nothing. Just thinking out loud. I knew the manager had fired Dana from a client some weeks ago.

[Message 58] Maya: Oh, that's right! I forgot about that. Dana was furious when it happened.

[Message 59] Sarah: Wow, I didn't know that. That could be a motive for someone, right?

[Message 60] Liam: I don't know. Seems like a stretch.

[Message 61] Maya: Maybe Dana purposefully wanted to hurt the manager for revenge?

[Message 62] Sarah: That's dark, Maya.

[Message 63] Liam: Yeah, but it's possible. People do crazy things when they're angry.

[Message 64] Maya: True. Hope they don't get the death penalty for this.

[Message 65] Sarah: Absolutely. That's too cruel.

[Message 66] Liam: I think it’s only fair if they are punished severely.

[Message 67] Sarah: Well, Arson by setting a fire is a serious crime, so they're going away for a long time for this.

[Message 68] Maya: Definitely. Anyway, I gotta run. Talk to you guys tomorrow at coffee?

[Message 69] Liam: Yep, see you then.

[Message 70] Sarah: Bye guys.

[Message 71] (Next day, at coffee) Liam: So, anything new happen overnight?

[Message 72] Maya: Nope. Just a terrible nightmare about Cemetery.

[Message 73] Sarah: Same here. I kept seeing flames. It was awful.

[Message 74] Liam: I dreamt about Dana. She was driving me somewhere, but I couldn't see where.

[Message 75] Maya: Spooky.

[Message 76] Sarah: Very.

[Message 77] Liam: I feel like we're missing something important. Something we’re overlooking.

[Message 78] Maya: I agree. But what?

[Message 79] Sarah: Maybe we should try to piece together everything we know. All the little details.

[Message 80] Liam: Good idea. Okay, so Dana was fired, she argued with someone, and someone left the building at Dusk.

[Message 81] Maya: And I bought Arson by setting a fire for a bonfire.

[Message 82] Sarah: Maya, are you sure you didn't see anyone suspicious when you bought it?

[Message 83] Maya: No, I didn't. It was crowded.

[Message 84] Liam: The police have been asking around. Did you get a call?

[Message 85] Sarah: They called this morning. Asked me about what I saw at Dusk.

[Message 86] Maya: Seriously? They haven't called me yet.

[Message 87] Liam: Maybe they're just working their way through the list.

[Message 88] Sarah: Or maybe they already know something.

[Message 89] Maya: That's a little unnerving.

[Message 90] Liam: Let's just try to stay calm and cooperate. The truth will come out eventually. He was talking about hurting her right before he went over there, that's all I am going to say.

[Message 1] Alex: Hey everyone, just waiting for the train. Anyone else running late today?

[Message 1] <Liam>: "Gate's still showing on time, right?"
[Message 2] <Maya>: "Yep. Flight's still scheduled. Relax."
[Message 3] <Liam>: "Just...checking."
[Message 4] <Maya>: "Big meeting?"
[Message 5] <Liam>: "Something like that."
[Message 6] <Maya>: "Important?"
[Message 7] <Liam>: "Could be."
[Message 8] <Maya>: "Well, good luck."
[Message 9] <Liam>: "Thanks. You too."
[Message 10] <Maya>: "Me? Just going home."
[Message 11] <Liam>: "Right."
[Message 12] <Liam>: "Did you see anything unusual?"
[Message 13] <Maya>: "Unusual? Like what?"
[Message 14] <Liam>: "I don't know... anything."
[Message 15] <Maya>: "Just people waiting for flights. You okay, Liam?"
[Message 16] <Liam>: "Fine. Just… a little on edge."
[Message 17] <Maya>: "Coffee?"
[Message 18] <Liam>: "Maybe later."
[Message 19] <Maya>: "Okay."
[Message 20] <Liam>: "Boarding time is soon."
[Message 21] <Maya>: "Yeah. Almost there."
[Message 22] <Liam>: "Think they'll actually call it?"
[Message 23] <Maya>: "Why wouldn't they?"
[Message 24] <Liam>: "Just... wondering."
[Message 25] <Maya>: "You're really stressing. What's going on?"
[Message 26] <Liam>: "Nothing. Seriously."
[Message 27] <Maya>: "Okay..."
[Message 28] <Liam>: "Did they mention anything to you?"
[Message 29] <Maya>: "Who? Mention what?"
[Message 30] <Liam>: "Never mind."
[Message 31] <Maya>: "Liam, you're acting weird."
[Message 32] <Liam>: "Just tired."
[Message 33] <Maya>: "Sure."
[Message 34] <Liam>: "Anything look different to you?"
[Message 35] <Maya>: "The terminal? No. Why?"
[Message 36] <Liam>: "Just a feeling."
[Message 37] <Maya>: "Maybe you need a vacation after this."
[Message 38] <Liam>: "Maybe."
[Message 39] <Maya>: "Gate change?"
[Message 40] <Liam>: "Where?"
[Message 41] <Maya>: "Says it right there. Different gate."
[Message 42] <Liam>: "That's new."
[Message 43] <Maya>: "Yeah. Happens."
[Message 44] <Liam>: "Supposed to be like this?"
[Message 45] <Maya>: "What do you mean?"
[Message 46] <Liam>: "This...change of plans."
[Message 47] <Maya>: "I wouldn't know."
[Message 48] <Liam>: "Right."
[Message 49] <Maya>: "New gate's closer to the coffee place."
[Message 50] <Liam>: "Good for you."
[Message 51] <Maya>: "Just saying."
[Message 52] <Liam>: "Did you pack everything I asked?"
[Message 53] <Maya>: "Yes, Liam. I always do."
[Message 54] <Liam>: "The documents...?"
[Message 55] <Maya>: "In the carry-on. Like always."
[Message 56] <Liam>: "Good. Just making sure."
[Message 57] <Maya>: "You sound like you don't trust me."
[Message 58] <Liam>: "It's not that."
[Message 59] <Maya>: "Then what is it?"
[Message 60] <Liam>: "Just a lot riding on this trip."
[Message 61] <Maya>: "For both of us."
[Message 62] <Liam>: "Yeah."
[Message 63] <Maya>: "Let's just get through security again."
[Message 64] <Liam>: "Again?"
[Message 65] <Maya>: "New gate, new security checkpoint."
[Message 66] <Liam>: "Right."
[Message 67] <Maya>: "Come on."
[Message 68] <Liam>: "Wait."
[Message 69] <Maya>: "What now?"
[Message 70] <Liam>: "Just... a sec."
[Message 71] <Maya>: "We're going to miss the flight acting like this."
[Message 72] <Liam>: "They won't leave without us."
[Message 73] <Maya>: "Why are you so sure?"
[Message 74] <Liam>: "Just trust me."
[Message 75] <Maya>: "I thought that's what I was doing."
[Message 76] <Liam>: "New gate. Okay."
[Message 77] <Maya>: "Let's go."
[Message 78] <Liam>: "You go ahead. I'll catch up."
[Message 79] <Maya>: "Seriously, Liam?"
[Message 80] <Liam>: "Just need a minute."
[Message 81] <Maya>: "Fine. But I'm not waiting long."
[Message 82] <Liam>: "Okay."
[Message 83] <Maya>: "See you at the gate."
[Message 84] <Liam>: "Yeah."
[Message 85] <Maya>: "(Walks away)"
[Message 86] <Liam>: "(Looks around nervously)"
[Message 87] <Liam>: "Everything okay?"
[Message 88] <Liam>: "(Muttering to himself) Should be..."
[Message 89] <Liam>: "Just have to..."
[Message 90] <Liam>: "(Pulls out phone)"
[Message 91] <Liam>: "No signal."
[Message 92] <Liam>: "Damn it."
[Message 93] <Liam>: "Gotta move. Now."
[Message 94] <Liam>: "(Starts walking quickly)"
[Message 95] <Liam>: "Did she see anything?"
[Message 96] <Liam>: "Probably not."
[Message 97] <Liam>: "Just...stick to the plan."
[Message 98] <Liam>: "(Continues walking)"
[Message 99] <Liam>: "New gate. New start."
[Message 100] <Liam>: "Hope I can make it."
[Message 101] <Liam>: "They changed everything."
[Message 102] <Liam>: "Didn't they?"
[Message 103] <Liam>: "(Whispers) Almost there."
[Message 104] <Liam>: "(Checks watch nervously)"
[Message 105] <Liam>: "Time is running short."
[Message 106] <Liam>: "(Sighs heavily)"

[Message 1] Ben: "Did you hear about what happened at the Pharmacy?"
[Message 2] Cara: "Yeah, it's all over the news. Brutal. You know anyone who worked there?"
[Message 3] Ben: "Not really. Just scary."
[Message 4] David: "I heard it was 9.  Bartender. Poor girl, so young."
[Message 5] Cara: "I know! Awful. Any idea what happened?"
[Message 6] David: "Rumor is poisoning."
[Message 7] Ben: "Poison? That's insane. What kind of sicko does that?"
[Message 8] Cara: "Someone who had a reason, I guess. Did she have any enemies?"
[Message 9] David: "Heard she was pretty cynical. Might have rubbed some people the wrong way."
[Message 10] Ben: "Still doesn't justify murder."
[Message 11] Cara: "True. Did you see Leo around yesterday, David? I couldn't get a hold of him."
[Message 12] David: "Leo? Nah, haven't seen him in days. Why?"
[Message 13] Cara: "No reason, just curious. He was supposed to help me with something."
[Message 14] Ben: "I saw Leo at the hardware store buying something. Around 10pm. Don’t remember what."
[Message 15] David: "Hardware store? Weird. Maybe he's finally fixing that leaky faucet."
[Message 16] Cara: "Haha, maybe. Speaking of, gotta run, that's what I'm doing right now."
[Message 17] Ben: "Catch you later."
[Message 18] David: "Yeah, bye."
[Message 19] David: "Ben, you still there?"
[Message 20] Ben: "Yup, what's up?"
[Message 21] David: "Something about this whole thing is bothering me. Remember how Leo was always complaining about 9.  Bartender getting preferential treatment at work?"
[Message 22] Ben: "Yeah, vaguely. He seemed pretty annoyed by it."
[Message 23] David: "Annoyed is an understatement. He said she was ruining his chances. He always hated her. I thought it was just talk."
[Message 24] Ben: "Woah, David. Are you saying you think Leo had something to do with this?"
[Message 25] David: "I'm not saying anything definitively. But he definitely *intended* for something bad to happen to her. Just saying, keep an open mind. He was there, not me."
[Message 26] Ben: "That's a serious accusation, man. You should tell the police if you think that."
[Message 27] David: "I don't have any proof, just a gut feeling. Plus, I don't want to get involved."
[Message 28] Ben: "Fair enough. Just... be careful what you say to others. Could get messy."
[Message 29] David: "You too. Gotta go, dog's barking."
[Message 30] Cara: "Hey guys, sorry I disappeared. Plumbing emergency. Fun times."

[Message 1] CHLOE: Hey, you hear about what happened at the Truck Stop? So crazy!

[Message 2] BEN: Yeah, wild. Two people dead. What a mess.

[Message 3] CHLOE: I know! Poor souls. You know anyone who works there?

[Message 4] BEN: Nah, not really. Heard rumors, though. Bad place, some say.

[Message 5] CHLOE: Rumors? Like what?

[Message 6] BEN: Oh, you know, drugs, fights... shady stuff. Remember that guy, Darren? He used to go there all the time.

[Message 7] CHLOE: Darren? Vaguely. What's he got to do with it?

[Message 8] BEN: Nothing, probably. Just popped into my head. He’s always been a bit…off. Heard he’s into self-defense lately. Taking it pretty seriously.

[Message 9] CHLOE: Self-defense? Weird. Anyway, police will figure it out. You see that new movie yet?

[Message 10] BEN: No, is it any good?

[Message 11] CHLOE: Yeah! Total mind-bender. You should check it out.

[Message 12] BEN: Maybe. Too much on my mind these days. This whole situation is giving me the creeps.

[Message 13] CHLOE: Me too. Especially since I drive through there every morning.

[Message 14] BEN: Early Morning huh? Be careful, Chloe. Seriously.

[Message 15] CHLOE: I will. You too.

[Message 17] BEN: Hey Liam, yeah, maybe. What's up?

[Message 18] LIAM: Just…work stuff. Stressing me out. You know how it is.

[Message 19] BEN: I do. Coffee sounds good. How about 3 PM?

[Message 20] LIAM: Perfect. See you then.

[Message 21] ANNA: Hey Chloe, did you hear about Mark and Sarah?

[Message 22] CHLOE: Yeah, it’s horrible.

[Message 23] ANNA: I can't believe someone would do that. Especially to Sarah, she was such an optimistic person.

[Message 24] CHLOE: I know, right? It's terrifying.

[Message 25] ANNA: I heard Mark, the security guard, was kind of a jerk, though.

[Message 26] CHLOE: Really? How so?

[Message 27] ANNA: Just…cynical, always complaining. Apparently, Darren hated him.

[Message 28] CHLOE: Darren, really? You think he could be involved?

[Message 29] ANNA: I don't know, just saying. People snap, you know?

[Message 30] CHLOE: True. Hope they catch whoever did it.

[Message 31] ANNA: Me too. Hey, you still up for dinner Friday?

[Message 32] CHLOE: Definitely! Need a distraction.

[Message 33] BEN: Liam just left. That was…intense.

[Message 34] CHLOE: Intense how?

[Message 35] BEN: He's really struggling. Said his meds aren't working. Keeps saying the world is a simulation and he needs to "fix it."

[Message 36] CHLOE: Whoa. That's… concerning.

[Message 37] BEN: He was asking weird questions about the Truck Stop too. Said he was there early morning the other day.

[Message 38] CHLOE: Doing what?

[Message 39] BEN: He didn’t say. Just kept rambling. Said he saw the security guard, Mark, arguing with someone.

[Message 40] CHLOE: This is getting weirder and weirder. You think he could be involved?

[Message 41] BEN: I hope not, but… I'm worried about him.

[Message 42] CHLOE: Maybe you should talk to someone about this, Ben. The police maybe?

[Message 43] BEN: I don't know... I don't want to get him in trouble if he's just having a bad episode. He was talking about getting rid of him right before he went over there, so I am scared.

[Message 44] CHLOE: Better safe than sorry, right?

[Message 45] BEN: Maybe you're right.

[Message 46] LIAM: Thanks for the coffee, Ben. I feel a bit better.

[Message 47] BEN: Anytime, Liam. You doing okay?

[Message 48] LIAM: Yeah, much better. Just needed to vent. Don't worry about what I said earlier.

[Message 49] BEN: Okay, man. Just looking out for you.

[Message 50] LIAM: Appreciate it. Gotta run.

[Message 51] CHLOE: So, did you say anything to the police?

[Message 52] BEN: Not yet. Still thinking about it. I'm going to see him again tomorrow, maybe I can get him to open up more.

[Message 53] CHLOE: Okay, but be careful, Ben.

[Message 64] CHLOE: That's what Ben said.

[Message 84] CHLOE: Guilty? Why?

[Message 85] BEN: I knew he was struggling. I should have done something sooner. I knew he hated Mark. If he hadn't fired her, none of this would have happened.

[Message 86] CHLOE: You can't blame yourself, Ben. This is not your fault.

[Message 88] CHLOE: I am. Just focus on helping the police now.

[Message 89] BEN: Okay. Thanks, Chloe.

[Message 90] CHLOE: Anytime, Ben.

[Message 91] ANNA: Any update on Ben and Liam?

[Message 93] ANNA: Wow. Just like that?

[Message 1] <Sarah>: "Did you hear about…"

[Message 4] <Emily>: "Things, huh?"
[Message 5] <David>: "Yeah, things are… complicated."
[Message 6] <Tom>: "Complicated like…?"
[Message 7] <Sarah>: "Like needing a new lock on the file cabinet."
[Message 8] <Emily>: "A new lock? Why?"

[Message 11] <Sarah>: "So, what now?"

[Message 15] <Sarah>: "Of the… situation."

[Message 32] <Emily>: "I just want to understand."

[Message 48] <Emily>: "Maybe we need answers."

[Message 60] <Emily>: "This whole thing is making me nervous."

[Message 1] David: "Anyone seen my keys? I swear I left them on the counter."

[Message 1] Liam: "Remember those summer tournaments? At the community center?"
[Message 2] Clara: "Vaguely. Why?"
[Message 3] Marcus: "Good times. Simpler times."
[Message 4] Liam: "Yeah. Simpler."
[Message 5] Clara: "What's with the nostalgia?"
[Message 6] Marcus: "Just thinking. You know."
[Message 7] Liam: "The package… it wasn’t there, right?"
[Message 8] Clara: "Package? What package?"
[Message 9] Marcus: "Relax, Clara. It's a metaphor."
[Message 10] Liam: "Is it?"
[Message 11] Marcus: "Has to be, right?"
[Message 12] Clara: "I still don't understand."
[Message 13] Liam: "The… souvenir. From that summer."
[Message 14] Marcus: "Oh, that souvenir. Right. What about it?"
[Message 15] Clara: "Is this some kind of inside joke?"
[Message 16] Liam: "It's not funny."
[Message 17] Marcus: "Humor is subjective, Liam."
[Message 18] Clara: "Can someone please explain?"
[Message 19] Liam: "Explain what? Just… forget it."
[Message 20] Marcus: "Maybe it's just misplaced?"
[Message 21] Liam: "Misplaced where? In… the ether?"
[Message 22] Clara: "Okay, you're scaring me now."
[Message 23] Marcus: "Scaring you? We're just reminiscing."
[Message 24] Liam: "Reminiscing about… what, exactly?"
[Message 25] Marcus: "Old times. Remember Mrs. Gable's cookies?"
[Message 26] Clara: "Mrs. Gable? Really, Marcus?"
[Message 27] Liam: "Focus, Marcus. This is important."
[Message 28] Marcus: "Important? Everything's relative."
[Message 29] Clara: "Something's going on. I can feel it."
[Message 30] Liam: "Don't worry about it, Clara."
[Message 31] Marcus: "Yeah, no need to fret."
[Message 32] Clara: "Easy for you two to say."
[Message 33] Liam: "Did you… check thoroughly?"
[Message 34] Marcus: "Check what thoroughly, Liam?"
[Message 35] Liam: "You know… the usual places."
[Message 36] Marcus: "Ah, the usual places. Yes, thoroughly."
[Message 37] Clara: "You're talking in circles."
[Message 38] Liam: "Someone must have… moved it."
[Message 39] Marcus: "Moved it? Perhaps. Or maybe…"
[Message 40] Clara: "Maybe what?"
[Message 41] Marcus: "Perhaps it was never there to begin with."
[Message 42] Liam: "Don't say that."
[Message 43] Clara: "This is getting ridiculous."
[Message 44] Liam: "We need to find it."
[Message 45] Marcus: "Need? Strong word."
[Message 46] Clara: "Find what, Liam?!"
[Message 47] Liam: "Just… the thing."
[Message 48] Marcus: "The thing. Of course. The thing."
[Message 49] Clara: "I'm leaving."
[Message 50] Liam: "Wait, Clara!"
[Message 51] Marcus: "Let her go, Liam."
[Message 52] Liam: "She knows too much."
[Message 53] Marcus: "Does she? Or do we just *think* she does?"
[Message 54] Liam: "I don't like this."
[Message 55] Marcus: "Neither do I. But what can we do?"
[Message 56] Liam: "The clock is ticking, Marcus."
[Message 57] Marcus: "Is it? Are you sure about the time?"
[Message 58] Liam: "The… the shadows are getting longer."
[Message 59] Marcus: "Shadows always lengthen at dusk."
[Message 60] Liam: "This isn't dusk."
[Message 61] Marcus: "Isn't it? Feels like it."
[Message 62] Liam: "We should… inform."
[Message 63] Marcus: "Inform who, Liam? About what?"
[Message 64] Liam: "You know… them."
[Message 65] Marcus: "Them? Are you sure that's wise?"
[Message 66] Liam: "What choice do we have?"
[Message 67] Marcus: "Perhaps… patience."
[Message 68] Liam: "Patience ran out a long time ago."
[Message 69] Marcus: "Did it? I hadn't noticed."
[Message 70] Liam: "Someone’s listening, can you hear them?"
[Message 71] Marcus: "Listening? Just the cicadas, I think."
[Message 72] Liam: "Not cicadas."
[Message 73] Marcus: "Then what?"
[Message 74] Liam: "Someone is watching."
[Message 75] Marcus: "Paranoia will destroy ya, Liam."
[Message 76] Liam: "Maybe it already has."
[Message 77] Marcus: "Don't be dramatic."
[Message 78] Clara: "I’m back. Still confused."
[Message 79] Liam: "Clara! You shouldn’t be here."
[Message 80] Marcus: "Welcome back, Clara. Grab a chair."
[Message 81] Clara: "What are you two hiding?"
[Message 82] Liam: "Nothing! Just… chess club stuff."
[Message 83] Marcus: "Yes, chess club strategy."
[Message 84] Clara: "Strategy about what 'package'?"
[Message 85] Liam: "Don't use that word."
[Message 86] Marcus: "Control yourself, Liam."
[Message 87] Clara: "Control what?"
[Message 88] Liam: "The… the impulse."
[Message 89] Marcus: "Indeed. The impulse to… exaggerate."
[Message 90] Clara: "I'm so lost."
[Message 91] Liam: "It’s better that way."
[Message 92] Marcus: "Ignorance is bliss, as they say."
[Message 93] Clara: "That's not fair."
[Message 94] Liam: "Life isn't fair."
[Message 95] Marcus: "A harsh truth, but true nonetheless."
[Message 96] Clara: "So, you're just going to leave me in the dark?"
[Message 97] Liam: "Pretty much."
[Message 98] Marcus: "We’re protecting you, Clara."
[Message 99] Clara: "Protecting me from what?"
[Message 100] Liam: "From… knowing."
[Message 101] Marcus: "From the consequences of knowing."
[Message 102] Clara: "Consequences?"
[Message 103] Liam: "Yes. Severe ones."
[Message 104] Marcus: "Let’s just say… it’s best forgotten."
[Message 105] Clara: "Forgotten? How can I forget something I don’t even know?"
[Message 106] Liam: "You will. Eventually."
[Message 107] Marcus: "Time heals all wounds, Clara."
[Message 108] Clara: "This doesn't feel like a wound. It feels like a threat."
[Message 109] Liam: "It's not a threat, Clara. I promise."
[Message 110] Marcus: "We wouldn't threaten you."
[Message 111] Clara: "Then what is it?"
[Message 112] Liam: "A… memory. A bad one."
[Message 113] Marcus: "A memory best left buried."
[Message 114] Clara: "Under what? Under lies?"
[Message 115] Liam: "Under… silence."
[Message 116] Marcus: "Indeed. Golden silence."
[Message 117] Clara: "I don't like this silence."
[Message 118] Liam: "You will get used to it."
[Message 119] Marcus: "Eventually. Everyone does."
[Message 120] Clara: "No. I won't."
[Message 121] Liam: "Don't push it, Clara. For your own good."
[Message 122] Marcus: "Liam's right. Some things are best left undisturbed."
[Message 123] Clara: "Like what you did?"
[Message 124] Liam: "Careful, Clara."
[Message 125] Marcus: "Temper, temper."
[Message 126] Clara: "I'm just asking questions."
[Message 127] Liam: "Some questions shouldn't be asked."
[Message 128] Marcus: "Especially out loud."
[Message 129] Clara: "Fine. I'm done."
[Message 130] Liam: "Good."
[Message 131] Marcus: "Wise choice."
[Message 132] Clara: "I'm watching you both."
[Message 133] Liam: "We know."

[Message 1] Alex: So, midnight at the lazy river...anyone else think this is slightly surreal?
[Message 2] Riley: Haha, yeah, but kinda cool, right? Especially with all the lights.
[Message 3] Sam: Definitely. It's a nice change of pace. Anyone having weird dreams lately?
[Message 4] Alex: Actually, yeah! I had this dream last night where I was giving a presentation to a room full of cats.
[Message 5] Riley: OMG, that's hilarious! What were you presenting about?
[Message 6] Alex: I have no idea! That's the weirdest part. Just...cat food? Maybe?
[Message 7] Sam: Classic dream logic. I had one where I was building a skyscraper out of pancakes.
[Message 8] Riley: You win. Pancake skyscraper is officially the best dream ever.
[Message 9] Alex: Agreed. My cat presentation pales in comparison.
[Message 10] Sam: Speaking of presentations, how's your job interview prep going, Riley?
[Message 11] Riley: It's going...okay. I'm mostly just trying to remember STAR method responses.
[Message 12] Alex: The STAR method always trips me up. I end up rambling.
[Message 13] Sam: Just practice! Write down some key points, not the whole story.
[Message 14] Riley: Good tip, Sam. Thanks! I'll try that.
[Message 15] Alex: So, back to dreams…any theories on why we dream what we dream?
[Message 16] Sam: I think it's our brain processing stuff from the day, mixed with random anxieties and desires.
[Message 17] Riley: Yeah, makes sense. A total mind dump.
[Message 18] Alex: That's a good way to put it. A nightly cerebral cleanse.
[Message 19] Sam: Exactly! Cleansing with pancake skyscrapers and cat food presentations.
[Message 20] Riley: Don’t forget the room full of cats. That detail is essential.
[Message 21] Alex: Fair enough. Cats are now officially part of the dream cleansing ritual.
[Message 22] Sam: Okay, random thought: anyone else ever try to control their dreams? Lucid dreaming?
[Message 23] Riley: I've tried! But I always get too excited and wake myself up.
[Message 24] Alex: I've read about it, but never actually attempted it. Seems tricky.
[Message 25] Sam: It is. It takes practice. I've only done it a few times successfully.
[Message 26] Riley: What’s it like?
[Message 27] Sam: It's pretty wild. You're aware you're dreaming, so you can theoretically do anything.
[Message 28] Alex: Like fly?
[Message 29] Sam: Like fly! Or teleport. Or have a tea party with historical figures. Whatever your heart desires.
[Message 30] Riley: Tea party with historical figures sounds amazing! I'm sold.
[Message 31] Alex: Okay, lucid dreaming is officially added to my to-do list.
[Message 32] Sam: There are some good apps and online resources if you're serious about it.
[Message 33] Riley: I'll check those out. Thanks, Sam!
[Message 34] Alex: Me too. Maybe we can all compare notes next week.
[Message 35] Sam: Sounds like a plan! So, what's everyone's dream job, if we're talking dreams?
[Message 36] Riley: Besides pancake skyscraper architect?
[Message 37] Alex: Heh.
[Message 38] Sam: Good one, Riley.
[Message 39] Riley: Honestly? Something that involves traveling and experiencing new cultures.
[Message 40] Alex: I've always wanted to be a full-time artist, just drawing all day.
[Message 41] Sam: That sounds peaceful. Mine would be something in technology, maybe developing new AI.
[Message 42] Riley: AI? That's ambitious!
[Message 43] Sam: It's the future! And it's fascinating.
[Message 44] Alex: I can see that. I'm still a little wary of AI taking over the world, though.
[Message 45] Sam: Haha, that's just in the movies. For now, anyway.
[Message 46] Riley: Famous last words.
[Message 47] Alex: Exactly!
[Message 48] Sam: Okay, okay, I promise to program safeguards. No robot uprising on my watch.
[Message 49] Riley: Deal!
[Message 50] Alex: I'll hold you to that.
[Message 51] Sam: You should. So, back to the real world…anyone else getting hungry?
[Message 52] Riley: Always. Midnight and lazy rivers make me ravenous.
[Message 53] Alex: Me too. I could go for some pizza.
[Message 54] Sam: Pizza sounds perfect. Anyone know if anything's still open this late?
[Message 55] Riley: I think there's a 24-hour place a few blocks from here.
[Message 56] Alex: Awesome! Post-lazy-river pizza run, then?
[Message 57] Sam: I'm in.
[Message 58] Riley: Count me in too!
[Message 59] Alex: Perfect. So, pizza dreams tonight, everyone.
[Message 60] Sam: You got it. Maybe I'll dream of building a pizza skyscraper.
[Message 61] Riley: With cat food toppings?
[Message 62] Alex: Oh, please no.

[Message 64] Riley: Sounds much better.
[Message 65] Alex: Agreed. Much, much better.
[Message 66] Sam: Speaking of mushrooms, anyone got any good new music recommendations?

[Message 68] Alex: I'll check them out. I mostly listen to classical music these days.
[Message 69] Sam: Nice! I'm more of an electronic music person myself.
[Message 70] Riley: Variety is the spice of life, right?
[Message 71] Alex: Absolutely.
[Message 72] Sam: Totally. Okay, pizza time soon?
[Message 73] Riley: I’m ready when you are. My stomach is rumbling.
[Message 74] Alex: Let's do it. Should we pack up our stuff?
[Message 75] Sam: Yeah, good idea. Let's gather everything up.
[Message 76] Riley: Alright, one last lazy river lap before we go?
[Message 77] Alex: One last lap!
[Message 78] Sam: Okay, one last lap. Pizza awaits!

[Message 1] Alex: Hey guys, anyone else super early for this flight?
[Message 2] Ben: You know it, Alex! I'm at gate C14, waiting for the coffee shop to open.
[Message 3] Carol: Me too. Gate C12. Figured I'd rather be early than stressed.
[Message 4] Alex: C16 here. Anyone know where the best coffee is around here? This airport is a maze.
[Message 5] Ben: Carol, you're closer. Any intel on coffee?
[Message 6] Carol: Honestly, the Starbucks near security is probably your best bet. But it's always packed.
[Message 7] Alex: Ugh, Starbucks. I was hoping for something… less Starbucks.
[Message 8] Ben: Agreed. But desperate times, desperate measures. Anyway, anyone got big family plans for the holidays?
[Message 9] Carol: Oh boy, here we go. A full house. My grandkids are coming in from California.
[Message 10] Alex: Nice! My family's all pretty local, so it's just a big dinner at my aunt's.
[Message 11] Ben: I'm heading to my parents' place in Columbus. All my siblings will be there. Chaos guaranteed.
[Message 12] Carol: Chaos is the spice of life, dear. At least, that's what I tell myself.
[Message 13] Alex: True. I love my family, but sometimes I need a vacation *from* my family.
[Message 14] Ben: Haha, preach. We all feel that.
[Message 15] Carol: Tell me about it. This year, I'm delegating the cooking. No more stressing over the turkey.
[Message 16] Alex: Smart move, Carol. What's everyone's favorite holiday tradition?
[Message 17] Ben: We always play board games after dinner. Gets pretty competitive.
[Message 18] Carol: My grandkids insist on decorating the tree, even though I think it's a disaster.
[Message 19] Alex: Haha, that's sweet. We have a white elephant gift exchange that always gets interesting.
[Message 20] Ben: White elephant? Sounds fun. What's the worst gift you ever got?
[Message 21] Alex: Oh man, a singing bass. Still haunts my dreams.
[Message 22] Carol: A singing bass? Oh, that's terrible. I received a crocheted toilet paper cozy once.
[Message 23] Ben: A crocheted toilet paper cozy? That’s… something. I got a book on ventriloquism.
[Message 24] Alex: Ventriloquism? Did you ever try it?
[Message 25] Ben: Briefly. I was terrible. The dummy and I had a falling out.
[Message 26] Carol: You're a funny one, Ben.
[Message 27] Alex: So, anyone else doing any traveling besides for the holidays?
[Message 28] Carol: I'm planning a trip to Italy next spring, if I can ever get my passport renewed.
[Message 29] Ben: Italy sounds amazing! I've always wanted to go.
[Message 30] Alex: Same! Italy is definitely on my bucket list. I'm thinking about visiting Iceland next year.
[Message 31] Carol: Iceland? That's quite a change of pace from Italy.
[Message 32] Alex: Yeah, I want to see the Northern Lights.
[Message 33] Ben: That would be incredible. I'm trying to save up for a down payment on a house. Travel is on hold for now.
[Message 34] Carol: Sensible. Always good to be practical.
[Message 35] Alex: True. Adulting is hard.
[Message 36] Ben: Tell me about it. Anyone else stressed about taxes?
[Message 37] Carol: Oh, don't even get me started.
[Message 38] Alex: I just try to ignore it until April. Bad strategy, I know.
[Message 39] Ben: Yeah, that's what I used to do. Now I have an accountant. Best money I ever spent.
[Message 40] Carol: I've considered that. Maybe this year I'll finally bite the bullet.
[Message 41] Alex: Speaking of biting the bullet, that coffee shop is finally open. Gotta go!
[Message 42] Ben: See ya! Grab me a black coffee if you're feeling generous.
[Message 43] Alex: Haha, no promises.
[Message 44] Carol: Have a good one, Alex.
[Message 45] Ben: So Carol, any tips for keeping the grandkids entertained?
[Message 46] Carol: Oh, I have a whole arsenal. Coloring books, board games, and lots and lots of snacks.
[Message 47] Ben: Good to know. My nieces and nephews have endless energy.
[Message 48] Carol: They do. It's a blessing and a curse.
[Message 49] Ben: Exactly.
[Message 50] Alex: (Texting from coffee shop line) This line is insane!
[Message 51] Ben: Told ya.
[Message 52] Carol: Patience, young grasshopper.
[Message 53] Alex: I saw a guy buy THREE of those giant muffins. THREE!
[Message 54] Ben: He's living his best life, Alex.
[Message 55] Carol: Let him enjoy his muffins.
[Message 56] Alex: Okay, okay. I'm trying to be less judgmental.
[Message 57] Ben: Baby steps.
[Message 58] Carol: That's all you can do.
[Message 59] Alex: Okay, coffee acquired. Heading back to the gate.
[Message 60] Ben: You're a lifesaver.
[Message 61] Carol: Enjoy!
[Message 62] Alex: Anyone else notice that weirdly dressed guy over there?
[Message 63] Ben: Nope, too busy contemplating the existential dread of holiday travel.
[Message 64] Carol: I try not to notice anyone. Keeps my blood pressure down.
[Message 65] Alex: Fair enough. He's wearing a full suit of armor. Seriously.
[Message 66] Ben: A suit of armor? Maybe he's going to a Renaissance fair.
[Message 67] Carol: Or maybe he's just eccentric. Let him be.
[Message 68] Alex: True. Live and let live.
[Message 69] Ben: Exactly. Besides, who are we to judge? I’m wearing sweatpants and a hoodie.

[Message 71] Alex: You're both right. I'm just bored.
[Message 72] Ben: Download a game on your phone.
[Message 73] Carol: Read a book.

[Message 75] Ben: No problem. Just trying to help you avoid commenting on strangers in suits of armor.

[Message 77] Carol: So, Ben, what kind of board games do you play with your family?

[Message 85] Carol: I like it.

[Message 87] Ben: Atta boy! Or girl! Or… person!

[Message 89] Alex: I'll try my best.
[Message 90] Ben: So, Carol, how many grandkids do you have?
[Message 91] Carol: Four. Two boys and two girls. They keep me young, or at least, they think they do.
[Message 92] Ben: That's a good amount! My parents are always bugging me to give them grandkids.

[Message 94] Alex: True. Huge.
[Message 95] Ben: I know, I know. I'm not ready yet.
[Message 96] Carol: You'll know when the time is right.
[Message 97] Alex: Speaking of knowing when the time is right, the gate agent just arrived.

[Message 99] Carol: About time.
[Message 100] Alex: Boarding will probably start soon.
