[Message 102] Carol: You too, Ben. Have a safe flight.
[Message 103] Alex: Yeah, safe travels!
[Message 104] Ben: You as well!
[Message 105] Carol: Thanks. I'm going to grab a newspaper and find a seat closer to the gate.
[Message 106] Alex: Smart move. See ya!
[Message 107] Ben: Catch ya later!
[Message 108] Alex: (A few minutes later) They just announced pre-boarding.
[Message 109] Ben: Figures. I'm always in the last group.
[Message 110] Carol: (Texting from her seat) Good luck, everyone.
[Message 111] Alex: Thanks! Wish me luck surviving the flight.
[Message 112] Ben: You got this! Just think of all the fun you'll have at the holidays.
[Message 113] Carol: Exactly. Focus on the good times.
[Message 114] Alex: Trying, trying.
[Message 115] Ben: Anyone have a window seat? Those are the best.
[Message 116] Alex: I managed to snag one!
[Message 117] Carol: Lucky you. I always end up in the middle.
[Message 118] Ben: The bane of my existence.
[Message 119] Alex: Okay, boarding now. TTYL!
[Message 120] Ben: Have a good flight!

Here's a 25-message exchange designed to meet your specifications:

[Message 1] Sarah: "Hey, have you heard about what happened at Synagogue?"
[Message 2] Ben: "Yeah, crazy, right? Some cop named Officer Miller, I think. Terrible news."
[Message 3] Sarah: "I know, I saw Anya near there Late Afternoon yesterday. Thought that was odd, since she works late at the bakery"
[Message 4] Ben: "Anya? Really? She seemed upset the other day when Miller was there. He said he wanted to get rid of him during the argument"
[Message 5] Sarah: "Small world, I guess. What's up with you? You sound weird."
[Message 6] Ben: "Just stressed. Work stuff. Trying to get this project done. Did you see Daniel yesterday? He mentioned that he went to the synagogue before to help set up for an event."
[Message 7] Sarah: "Daniel? No, haven't seen him in ages. Why?"
[Message 8] Ben: "No reason. Just making conversation. They're going away for a long time for this, I just know it."
[Message 9] Sarah: "Well, whoever did it, I hope they catch them. You going to the game tonight?"
[Message 10] Ben: "Nah, too much going on. You?"
[Message 11] Sarah: "Maybe. Depends. Anya told me she was buying a weird knife set at the store. Said it was for a cooking class, but seems strange, right?"
[Message 12] Ben: "Could be anything. Don't jump to conclusions. Hope they don't get the death penalty."
[Message 13] Sarah: "True. Anyway, I gotta run. Talk later."
[Message 14] Ben: "Later. Oh, and Sarah, if Daniel calls, tell him I'm not interested in whatever he's selling."
[Message 15] Sarah: "Will do. He's always trying to sell something. Hey, someone told me that Anya was shouting at Officer Miller right before he went over there."
[Message 16] Ben: "Wow, things are really heating up for Anya."
[Message 17] Sarah: "Heard some dude with a stutter saw her leave at Late Afternoon."
[Message 18] Ben: "Whoa. Maybe she shouldn't have fired Anya."
[Message 19] Sarah: "She knew he was going to find out anyway."
[Message 20] Sarah: "Maybe that's just a rumor. People talk."
[Message 21] Ben: "People do talk. I thought I saw Daniel looking up how to make Impalement with a sharp object online. But I wasn't sure."
[Message 22] Sarah: "Okay, that's... worrying. Maybe you should tell the police about Daniel. What if he was trying to get rid of him?"
[Message 23] Ben: "I don't know... I don't want to get involved. He always hated Officer Miller."
[Message 24] Sarah: "I get it, but it's serious. This could all be avoided if someone called 911 right away."
[Message 25] Ben: "Alright, alright. I'll think about it. You're right, this is messing with my head."

[Message 1] Kai: "Hey everyone, did you hear about what happened at Town Hall? So awful!"
[Message 2] Riley: "Yeah, the news is all over it. About Alex, right? So sad."
[Message 3] Jordan: "Heard it was Arson by setting a fire. Crazy. Anyone know anything?"
[Message 4] Quinn: "Just rumors, Jordan. Best not to spread them."
[Message 5] Sam: "I saw Kai leaving the building around Dusk yesterday... just saying."
[Message 6] Kai: "Sam, what's that supposed to mean? I had a meeting that ran late. It's not Mens Rea."
[Message 7] Riley: "Easy, Kai. Sam didn't mean anything by it, probably."
[Message 8] Jordan: "Wasn't Alex an activist for something kinda controversial? Maybe someone didn't like what he was doing. Actus Reus?"
[Message 9] Quinn: "Jordan, you're jumping to conclusions. That's not helping."
[Message 10] Sam: "I just hope they catch whoever did it. Alex was a good person."
[Message 11] Kai: "Me too. He deserved better. This whole thing is disturbing."
[Message 12] Riley: "Anyone know what the memorial service will be like?"
[Message 13] Jordan: "No idea. Probaby will be posted soon."
[Message 14] Quinn: "Let's try and stay positive, guys. Focus on remembering the good times with Alex."
[Message 15] Sam: "Remember that time Alex tried to bake a cake and set off the smoke alarm? Good times."
[Message 16] Kai: "Haha, yeah! I remember that! He always did have a way with kitchen disasters."
[Message 17] Riley: "Speaking of disasters, has anyone seen my phone charger? I can't find it anywhere."
[Message 18] Jordan: "Nope, haven't seen it. Check under the couch?"
[Message 19] Quinn: "Maybe you left it at Town Hall yesterday?"
[Message 20] Riley: "Ugh, maybe. I'll check when they reopen. This is Concurrence, i guess."
[Message 21] Sam: "I'm still thinking about what Sam said. Why dusk specifically?"
[Message 22] Kai: "I told you, i was leaving a meeting. Why are you fixating on me?"
[Message 23] Riley: "Guys, let's not start this. Kai has been through enough already. Let’s not make it worse."
[Message 24] Jordan: "Whatever. Just seems weird."
[Message 25] Quinn: "So, any plans for the weekend? Trying to distract myself from all this."
[Message 26] Sam: "Maybe a movie night? We could all use some cheering up."
[Message 27] Kai: "I'm in. Anything but true crime, though."
[Message 28] Riley: "Sounds good. I'll bring the popcorn."
[Message 29] Jordan: "I'm still trying to wrap my head around why anyone would do that to Alex. He never hurt anyone."
[Message 30] Quinn: "People do crazy things, Jordan. We might never understand. It's Causation."
[Message 31] Sam: "Maybe it was someone he knew. Someone who was jealous of him."
[Message 32] Kai: "Jealous of what? Alex didn't have much."
[Message 33] Riley: "He had a lot of friends and a big heart, Kai. That's something to be jealous of."
[Message 34] Jordan: "True. Still, makes you wonder who benefitted from this."
[Message 35] Quinn: "Let's leave that to the police, Jordan. We're not detectives."
[Message 36] Sam: "I heard someone saw a hooded figure running from the building around the time of the fire."
[Message 37] Kai: "Where did you hear that, Sam? That's just a rumor."
[Message 38] Riley: "Sam, don't spread gossip. It's not helpful."
[Message 39] Jordan: "I heard it too. Apparently, the hoodie was bright blue."
[Message 40] Quinn: "Great, now we're all amateur sleuths. This Attendant/Extenuating Circumstances is ridiculous!"
[Message 41] Sam: "Just trying to help. Maybe that detail will help the cops."
[Message 42] Kai: "I haven't seen Sam since the fire."
[Message 43] Riley: "That's not true, Kai. You saw him yesterday."
[Message 44] Jordan: "Whatever."
[Message 45] Quinn: "Ok guys thats enough."
[Message 46] Sam: "I was at home playing videogames, so i’m innocent."
[Message 47] Kai: "Yeah, but were you aware the fire started?"
[Message 48] Riley: "He's got you there Sam."
[Message 49] Jordan: "I overheard Dana and Quinn arguing fiercely, it was about Alex, maybe its about the Attempt."
[Message 50] Quinn: "Jordan, dont say that, you weren't even there."
[Message 51] Sam: "What was the argument about?"
[Message 52] Kai: "I dont know what to believe anymore."
[Message 53] Riley: "I have a feeling that this will be bad."
[Message 54] Jordan: "The cops will probably catch them for Punishment."
[Message 55] Quinn: "Why are you all assuming someone here did it?"
[Message 56] Sam: "Because the air is thick with suspicion, maybe its the Mens Rea."
[Message 57] Kai: "I think we should all just try to support each other."
[Message 58] Riley: "Good idea, Kai. We all need it."
[Message 59] Jordan: "Easy for you to say, Riley. You aren't being questioned."
[Message 60] Quinn: "Enough, Jordan. Let's just be there for Alex's family."
[Message 61] Sam: "I agree with Quinn."
[Message 62] Kai: "Me too. I'm going to go to the candlelight vigil tomorrow."
[Message 63] Riley: "I'll be there. We should all go together."
[Message 64] Jordan: "Maybe."
[Message 65] Quinn: "Okay, let's plan on it. See you all tomorrow. And seriously, no more accusations."

[Message 1] Liam: "This Merlot is...bold."
[Message 2] Chloe: "Yeah, it's...something."
[Message 3] Liam: "So, you got the memo about the...situation?"
[Message 4] Chloe: "Heard whispers."
[Message 5] Liam: "Whispers, huh?"
[Message 6] Chloe: "What's new on your canvas?"
[Message 7] Liam: "Just some...abstract anxieties."
[Message 8] Chloe: "Relatable."
[Message 9] Liam: "You painting happy trees?"
[Message 10] Chloe: "Trees need pruning sometimes."
[Message 11] Liam: "True. Speaking of...things being cut."
[Message 12] Chloe: "Big canvas. Lots of space to fill."
[Message 13] Liam: "Filling it with what, though?"
[Message 14] Chloe: "Potential."
[Message 15] Liam: "Potential for...?"
[Message 16] Chloe: "Improvement."
[Message 17] Liam: "Right. Improvement."
[Message 18] Chloe: "Like this cheese plate. Needs more brie."
[Message 19] Liam: "Diverting nicely. So, 'compromised'. What does that even mean these days?"
[Message 20] Chloe: "It's a word."
[Message 21] Liam: "A loaded one."
[Message 22] Chloe: "Depends who's loading."
[Message 23] Liam: "Touché."
[Message 24] Chloe: "More wine?"

[Message 26] Chloe: "It's a pour."

[Message 28] Chloe: "My artistic heart into this canvas."
[Message 29] Liam: "Right. Artistic heart."
[Message 30] Chloe: "Don't judge my process."
[Message 31] Liam: "Wouldn't dream of it. Just...curious."
[Message 32] Chloe: "Curiosity..."
[Message 33] Liam: "...killed the cat. I know, I know."
[Message 34] Chloe: "Precisely. Cat naps are essential."
[Message 35] Liam: "Essential for avoiding...what?"
[Message 36] Chloe: "Excessive inquiry."
[Message 37] Liam: "Fair enough."
[Message 38] Chloe: "This paint is a terrible consistency."
[Message 39] Liam: "Like...the narrative?"
[Message 40] Chloe: "Maybe. Depends on the brush strokes."
[Message 41] Liam: "Who's holding the brush?"
[Message 42] Chloe: "That's the million-dollar question."
[Message 43] Liam: "More like a multi-million dollar question, I'd wager."
[Message 44] Chloe: "Details, details."
[Message 45] Liam: "Details matter. Especially when..."
[Message 46] Chloe: "Especially when there's glitter involved."
[Message 47] Liam: "Glitter can be messy."
[Message 48] Chloe: "Deceivingly so."
[Message 49] Liam: "Exactly. Like a false sense of..."
[Message 50] Chloe: "Security?"
[Message 51] Liam: "Maybe."
[Message 52] Chloe: "Or happiness. Look at this pink!"
[Message 53] Liam: "Distraction tactics are strong tonight."
[Message 54] Chloe: "Merely appreciating the spectrum."
[Message 55] Liam: "The spectrum of...what?"
[Message 56] Chloe: "Possibilities."
[Message 57] Liam: "Possibilities for getting away with..."
[Message 58] Chloe: "For creating beautiful art."
[Message 59] Liam: "Is that what we're calling it?"
[Message 60] Chloe: "What would *you* call it?"
[Message 61] Liam: "I'm still formulating my...assessment."
[Message 62] Chloe: "Take your time."
[Message 63] Liam: "I intend to."
[Message 64] Chloe: "This canvas needs another layer."
[Message 65] Liam: "Another layer of...?"
[Message 66] Chloe: "Protection."
[Message 67] Liam: "From what?"
[Message 68] Chloe: "The outside world."
[Message 69] Liam: "The 'outside world', huh?"
[Message 70] Chloe: "Full of art critics."

[Message 1] Daniel: Morning, Martha, Alex! Beautiful day in Huntington, isn't it? Heard anything interesting on the local news lately?

[Message 2] Martha: Morning, Daniel! Alex. Indeed, the sun is shining! Just read about that new community garden project on Beach Boulevard. Seems promising.

[Message 3] Alex: Morning you two. Community garden, huh? That’s cool. I was just thinking we need more green spaces.

[Message 4] Daniel: I agree, Alex. Anything that improves the community is a plus. Martha, are you volunteering there?

[Message 5] Martha: I'm considering it, Daniel. My tomatoes are bursting, I could donate some starts.

[Message 6] Alex: I've been meaning to get more involved in local stuff. Besides the garden, anything else going on?

[Message 7] Daniel: Heard they're finally repaving Main Street. About time! My car will thank them.

[Message 8] Martha: Oh, yes! The potholes are terrible. It’s going to be a mess with traffic though, right?

[Message 9] Alex: Traffic is already a mess. Hopefully, they'll do it at night. Anyone seen the sunset lately? It's been spectacular.

[Message 10] Daniel: I did, Alex! Snapped a few photos. I’ll show you later. Regarding the Main Street paving, they said it'll be mostly overnight.

[Message 11] Martha: That’s good news, Daniel. Less disruption.

[Message 12] Alex: Speaking of photos, Daniel, how's that photography class going?

[Message 13] Daniel: It's going well, Alex! Learning a lot about composition.

[Message 14] Martha: You always take such lovely photos, Daniel. Are you exhibiting anywhere soon?

[Message 15] Daniel: Not yet, Martha, but I'm thinking about entering a local competition.

[Message 16] Alex: You should, Daniel! You'd definitely win. What kind of camera are you using these days?

[Message 17] Daniel: Still my trusty Nikon, Alex. It gets the job done.

[Message 18] Martha: Back to the local news, I saw they're planning another outdoor concert series at Pier Plaza.

[Message 19] Alex: Oh, cool! What kind of music?

[Message 20] Martha: I think it's a mix, Alex. Some classic rock, some country, some blues.

[Message 21] Daniel: Sounds fun! I might check that out.

[Message 22] Alex: Me too. Good way to spend an evening. So, Martha, you're still busy with the sales rep job?

[Message 23] Martha: Yes, Alex, busier than ever! Lots of travel lately.

[Message 24] Daniel: Travel can be exhausting, Martha.

[Message 25] Martha: It is, Daniel, but I enjoy seeing new places.

[Message 26] Alex: I can imagine. Daniel, did you hear about the presentation to the city council about the noise complaints?

[Message 27] Daniel: I did, Alex. Seems like a tough situation. Balancing residents' peace and business needs.

[Message 28] Martha: A tricky balance indeed. I wonder what they decided.

[Message 29] Alex: Haven't heard the results yet. Maybe it'll be in the next news cycle. I have to present my report next week.

[Message 30] Daniel: Good luck with that, Alex!

[Message 31] Martha: Yes, good luck! You'll do great.

[Message 32] Alex: Thanks, you guys. I'm a little nervous.

[Message 33] Daniel: Just be confident, Alex. You know your stuff.

[Message 34] Martha: And speak clearly and slowly.

[Message 35] Alex: I'll try. It's about the new traffic light synchronization system.

[Message 36] Daniel: That sounds fascinating, Alex. Could really help with the traffic flow.

[Message 37] Martha: Absolutely. Will they actually implement it, do you think?

[Message 38] Alex: That's what the presentation is for - to convince them it's worth the investment.

[Message 39] Daniel: Well, I'm sure you'll do a great job presenting it.

[Message 40] Martha: Fingers crossed! It would make a huge difference.

[Message 41] Alex: Yeah, I hope so. I'm hungry. You guys want to grab some lunch after this?

[Message 42] Daniel: Sounds good to me, Alex.

[Message 43] Martha: I'm in! Where should we go?

[Message 44] Alex: How about that new cafe on 5th Street? I heard they have great sandwiches.

[Message 45] Daniel: I've heard good things about that place too. Let's do it.

[Message 46] Martha: Perfect! I'm craving a good sandwich.

[Message 47] Alex: Me too. So, back to local news, anything about the surf competition coming up?

[Message 48] Daniel: Oh yeah! That's next month, right? Should be a good one.

[Message 49] Martha: Yes! I love watching the surfers. They're so talented.

[Message 50] Alex: Definitely. The waves have been pretty good lately.

[Message 51] Daniel: I might try to get some shots of the surfers. Good photo opportunity.

[Message 52] Martha: You should, Daniel! They always make for stunning pictures.

[Message 53] Alex: I'll probably just watch. I'm not brave enough to get in the water.

[Message 54] Daniel: Haha, it can be intimidating!

[Message 55] Martha: Very true. Well, I've enjoyed this conversation.

[Message 56] Alex: Me too. Always good to catch up.

[Message 57] Daniel: Agreed. Let's head to that cafe then?

[Message 58] Martha: Sounds like a plan!

[Message 59] Alex: Lead the way, Daniel!

[Message 60] Daniel: Alright, let's go! My treat today.

[Message 1] Alex: "Hey! How's the shoe shopping going?"

[Message 23] Alex: "Sounds like a plan! You've earned it. Good luck with the shoe hunt!"
[Message 24] Jamie: "Thanks! I appreciate it. Talk soon!"
[Message 25] Alex: "Bye! Let me know if you find the perfect 'sensible but cute' shoe!"

[Message 1] Alex: Hey, did you hear about what happened at the gym?
[Message 2] Ben: Yeah, insane. Someone got killed.
[Message 3] Alex: I know, right? Predawn, no less. Scary.
[Message 4] Ben: Yeah, they're saying it was Selena.
[Message 5] Alex: Selena? No way. She wouldn't.
[Message 6] Ben: That’s what I thought too. But the cops were questioning her a while.
[Message 7] Alex: About what?
[Message 8] Ben: I don't know exactly. But people are talking.
[Message 9] Alex: I saw Kai there yesterday. Maybe they saw something?
[Message 10] Ben: Kai? What were they doing there so early?
[Message 11] Alex: Kai always works out at that time.
[Message 12] Ben: True. Heard anything from Jordan?
[Message 13] Alex: Nope. You?
[Message 14] Ben: Nothing. Kind of weird.
[Message 15] Alex: Maybe they’re just freaked out. Everyone is.
[Message 16] Ben: I guess so. Should we try to contact them?
[Message 17] Alex: Maybe later. Let’s give them some space.
[Message 18] Ben: Okay. What about getting lunch?
[Message 19] Alex: Sure, where at?
[Message 20] Ben: How about that new place downtown?

[Message 22] Ben: Perfect. See you then.
[Message 23] Alex: Later.
[Message 24] Ben: BTW I saw Jordan buying an ice pick the other day. Odd, right?
[Message 25] Alex: Seriously? That is kinda weird. Where?
[Message 26] Ben: That hardware store on 6th. I thought nothing of it, but now…
[Message 27] Alex: Okay, now I'm concerned. Selena would never hurt somebody. But the ice pick is too crazy.
[Message 28] Ben: My thoughts exactly. Let’s not jump to conclusions though.
[Message 29] Alex: Right, right.
[Message 30] Kai: Hey guys, what's going on? You all good?
[Message 31] Ben: Just talking about the gym murder. Crazy, right?
[Message 32] Kai: Yeah, super messed up. I saw the whole thing. I saw Jordan leave the building at Predawn.
[Message 33] Alex: What?! You actually saw them? Was it after the incident?
[Message 34] Kai: Yeah, it was right after. They looked shaken.
[Message 35] Ben: Did you call the cops? This changes everything.
[Message 36] Kai: I freaked out, man. I didn’t know what to do. Just saw them running.
[Message 37] Alex: You should’ve called. That might’ve helped her survive.
[Message 38] Ben: Agreed. Kai, you gotta tell the cops.
[Message 39] Kai: I know, I know. I'm going to. I swear.
[Message 40] Alex: Good. Because this is serious. They're going away for a long time for this.
[Message 41] Ben: Agreed. We will go with you.
[Message 42] Kai: Thanks, guys. I appreciate it.
[Message 43] Jordan: What's up? Why are you guys blowing up my phone?
[Message 44] Ben: We need to talk. Face to face.
[Message 45] Jordan: About what?
[Message 46] Alex: Don't play dumb, Jordan. About Selena.
[Message 47] Jordan: Look, I had nothing to do with that.
[Message 48] Ben: Kai saw you leaving the gym right after it happened.
[Message 49] Jordan: Kai is lying. I was home all night.
[Message 50] Alex: And Ben saw you buying an ice pick.
[Message 51] Jordan: It’s for my art project! Geez!
[Message 52] Ben: An "art project" that requires a Stabbing with an ice pick?
[Message 53] Jordan: Yes! Look, I'm not going to explain myself to you guys.
[Message 54] Alex: We’re just trying to understand, Jordan. 
[Message 55] Jordan: Understand what? That I’m being accused of something I didn’t do?
[Message 56] Ben: We just want the truth.
[Message 57] Jordan: I told you the truth!
[Message 58] Kai: Guys, can we all just calm down?
[Message 59] Alex: Easier said than done, Kai.
[Message 60] Ben: Yeah, someone’s dead.
[Message 61] Jordan: I know someone’s dead! And I feel terrible about it.
[Message 62] Alex: Did you know Selena well?
[Message 63] Jordan: Not really. We talked a few times at the gym.
[Message 64] Ben: What did you talk about?
[Message 65] Jordan: Just… gym stuff. Workouts, whatever.
[Message 66] Alex: Sounds like BS, Jordan.
[Message 67] Jordan: Look, believe what you want. I gotta go.
[Message 68] Ben: Don’t leave. We’re not done talking.
[Message 69] Jordan: Yes, we are. Bye.
[Message 70] Alex: Dammit.
[Message 71] Ben: They’re definitely hiding something.
[Message 72] Kai: Maybe we should call the cops.
[Message 73] Alex: Agreed. This is beyond us.
[Message 74] Ben: Let’s all go together.
[Message 75] Kai: Okay, meet at the police station in an hour?
[Message 76] Alex: Sounds good.
[Message 77] Ben: See you there.
[Message 78] Jordan: Fine. I'll talk to the cops too. But I swear, I didn't kill Selena.
[Message 79] Alex: Then why were you at the gym that early?
[Message 80] Jordan: I couldn't sleep. I went for a walk. Is that a crime?
[Message 81] Ben: A walk that leads you to the scene of a murder?
[Message 82] Jordan: It’s a coincidence!
[Message 83] Kai: You looked pretty panicked when you were leaving.
[Message 84] Jordan: Of course I was panicked! There were cops everywhere!
[Message 85] Alex: Did you see anyone else there?
[Message 86] Jordan: No! I just wanted to get away from the chaos.
[Message 87] Ben: What about around the activist?

[Message 89] Alex: Smart move.
[Message 90] Ben: See you at the station, then.
[Message 91] Kai: I still think we should have called when I first saw her leaving the scene.
[Message 92] Alex: I know, Kai. Don't beat yourself up.
[Message 93] Ben: What's done is done. Let's focus on getting justice for Selena.
[Message 94] Alex: Agreed.
[Message 95] Ben: I just can't believe this happened.
[Message 96] Alex: Me neither. Such a waste.
[Message 97] Kai: I was talking to Layla too, and she said that Layla hated Selena.
[Message 98] Alex: Layla? Why?
[Message 99] Kai: Because Selena was getting all the attention in the activist circles.
[Message 100] Ben: Jealousy? Seriously?
[Message 101] Alex: It's possible. People do crazy things.
[Message 102] Ben: I guess so. But an activist organization?
[Message 103] Kai: Yeah, but Layla is pretty intense. She’s always been a bit…off.
[Message 104] Alex: Off how?
[Message 105] Kai: Just… unpredictable. Has strong opinions, you know?
[Message 106] Ben: Alright, now we have two suspects.
[Message 107] Alex: More like two people we need to talk to the cops about.
[Message 108] Ben: Exactly.
[Message 109] Kai: Let's just focus on Selena. The police will figure it out.
[Message 110] Alex: True. But every piece of information helps.
[Message 111] Ben: Agreed.
[Message 112] Jordan: I just spoke to my lawyer. He said I don't have to talk to you guys anymore.
[Message 113] Alex: Good for you, Jordan.
[Message 114] Ben: It won’t save you if you’re guilty.
[Message 115] Jordan: I'm not guilty!
[Message 116] Kai: Guys, can we please stop arguing?
[Message 117] Alex: Fine. But I don't trust Jordan.
[Message 118] Ben: Me neither. But let's let the police do their job.
[Message 119] Kai: Agreed.
[Message 120] Alex: So, police station in half an hour?
[Message 121] Ben: Yep.
[Message 122] Kai: See you there.
[Message 123] Ben: I just remembered, Selena was about to expose Layla.
[Message 124] Alex: Expose her for what?
[Message 125] Ben: I don't know exactly, but it was something big. Selena intended to release it this week.
[Message 126] Alex: That's motive right there.
[Message 127] Kai: Well, that changes everything.
[Message 128] Alex: Let's tell the cops about this immediately.
[Message 129] Ben: Agreed. I think we are getting somewhere now.
[Message 130] Kai: Yes. Let's just hope they catch the person who did this.

[Message 1] Sarah: "Did you... see?"

[Message 4] Ben: "The… presentation?"
[Message 5] Sarah: "Something like that. A very… loud presentation."
[Message 6] Ben: "Loud is an understatement. Really shook things up."
[Message 7] Chloe: "What are you guys talking about? Did I miss something?"
[Message 8] Sarah: "Just, uh, some announcements. Important ones."
[Message 9] Ben: "Yeah. Very important."

[Message 11] Sarah: "Important for… the future."
[Message 12] Ben: "For progress."
[Message 13] Chloe: "Progress in what direction? Be specific."
[Message 14] Sarah: "Specifics… aren't really necessary right now."
[Message 15] Ben: "Details are still… being worked out."

[Message 17] Sarah: "By… the usual people."
[Message 18] Ben: "The team."
[Message 19] Chloe: "What team? The volunteer team? The organizing team?"
[Message 20] Sarah: "Just… the team. Don’t worry about it."
[Message 21] Ben: "Exactly. Relax, Chloe."
[Message 22] Chloe: "Relax? But you guys are acting so weird."
[Message 23] Sarah: "Just tired, I guess. Long day."
[Message 24] Ben: "Very long. And stressful."
[Message 25] Chloe: "Stressful why? What happened?"
[Message 26] Sarah: "Remember what happened at the last one? Nobody wants a repeat."
[Message 27] Ben: "Exactly. Prevention is key."
[Message 28] Chloe: "Prevention of what? Are you talking about the heckler?"
[Message 29] Sarah: "Something… more permanent than that."
[Message 30] Ben: "Let's just say… the message was received."
[Message 31] Chloe: "What message? By who? Received by who?"
[Message 32] Sarah: "Too many questions. Lower your voice."
[Message 33] Ben: "Seriously, Chloe. Tone it down."
[Message 34] Chloe: "But I don't understand!"
[Message 35] Sarah: "You don’t need to understand everything."
[Message 36] Ben: "Some things are better left… unsaid."
[Message 37] Chloe: "But if nobody says anything, how will things change?"
[Message 38] Sarah: "Things are changing. You just… can’t see it yet."
[Message 39] Ben: "Change happens in different ways."
[Message 40] Chloe: "That's so cryptic! What does that even mean?"
[Message 41] Sarah: "It means… trust the process."
[Message 42] Ben: "Have faith."
[Message 43] Chloe: "Faith in what? The process led to… what happened?"
[Message 44] Sarah: "Don’t say that so loud!"
[Message 45] Ben: "Seriously, Chloe. This isn't a game."
[Message 46] Chloe: "Then treat me like I'm part of the conversation!"
[Message 47] Sarah: "You are. Just… listen more than you speak."
[Message 48] Ben: "Observe. Absorb."
[Message 49] Chloe: "But I want to contribute! Not just be a bystander."
[Message 50] Sarah: "Contributing means… keeping things quiet right now."
[Message 51] Ben: "Maintaining order."
[Message 52] Chloe: "Order at what cost?"
[Message 53] Sarah: "The cost of… potential chaos."
[Message 54] Ben: "The greater good, Chloe."
[Message 55] Chloe: "The greater good? That's what they always say…"
[Message 56] Sarah: "It’s true. We’re doing what we have to."
[Message 57] Ben: "Necessary sacrifices."
[Message 58] Chloe: "Sacrifices? Who was sacrificed?"
[Message 59] Sarah: "Stop. Just… stop."
[Message 60] Ben: "Enough, Chloe. You’re pushing too hard."
[Message 61] Chloe: "But…"
[Message 62] Sarah: "No buts. Just… be quiet."
[Message 63] Ben: "Please, Chloe. For your own sake."
[Message 64] Chloe: "For my own sake?"
[Message 65] Sarah: "Just… trust us on this."
[Message 66] Ben: "We know what’s best."
[Message 67] Chloe: "That's what worries me the most."
[Message 68] Sarah: "Look, there are things you just don’t understand."
[Message 69] Ben: "Things you’re not meant to understand."
[Message 70] Chloe: "But I want to!"
[Message 71] Sarah: "Wanting isn’t always enough."
[Message 72] Ben: "Sometimes it’s… dangerous."

[Message 80] Sarah: "Understanding isn’t the point right now. Silence is."

[Message 1] Alex: Hey Jamie! You at Arcade yet?
[Message 2] Jamie: Yup! Just grabbed a coffee. You running late?
[Message 3] Alex: A little, sorry! The bus was packed. Be there in like 10.
[Message 4] Jamie: No worries! I'll save you a seat. So, ready for funny story time?
[Message 5] Alex: Born ready! I've got a doozy from this morning already.
[Message 6] Jamie: Ooh, spill! While I wait.
[Message 7] Alex: Okay, so picture this: Trying to mentor our new intern, Mark…
[Message 8] Jamie: Already sounds like a recipe for disaster. Bless your soul.
[Message 9] Alex: You have no idea. I was explaining Excel shortcuts…
[Message 10] Jamie: The bane of everyone’s existence.
[Message 11] Alex: Exactly! And he types “Ctrl + Alt + Delete” to copy something.
[Message 12] Jamie: *dies laughing* No way! Seriously?
[Message 13] Alex: Seriously! I almost choked on my water.
[Message 14] Jamie: Oh my god, that’s amazing. I feel for you, but also, hilarious.
[Message 15] Alex: Right? I had to walk away for a second.
[Message 16] Jamie: Reminds me of when I tried to teach my grandma how to use email.
[Message 17] Alex: Oh lord, I can only imagine.
[Message 18] Jamie: She thought the “@” symbol was a fancy “A”.
[Message 19] Alex: That's kind of adorable, actually.
[Message 20] Jamie: It was! But explaining it took like half an hour.
[Message 21] Alex: I’m here! Saw you. Coffee smells amazing.
[Message 22] Jamie: Finally! Okay, you have to tell that Excel story again, but with all the details.
[Message 23] Alex: Alright, alright. So, Mark, bless his heart…
[Message 24] Jamie: (Sipping coffee) Ready. Begin.
[Message 25] Alex: ...and then he says, with a perfectly straight face, “Ctrl + Alt + Delete to copy!”
[Message 26] Jamie: (Laughing again) I can't! He’s got potential. Bad potential.
[Message 27] Alex: He does! I think he'll be a good accountant eventually, but...we have a ways to go.
[Message 28] Jamie: My story involves a fishing trip gone wrong.
[Message 29] Alex: Ooh, I'm intrigued.
[Message 30] Jamie: So, I’m out on the lake last weekend…
[Message 31] Alex: Perfect day for it, weather was amazing.
[Message 32] Jamie: Exactly! And I finally get a bite. BIG one.
[Message 33] Alex: Oh, suspense!
[Message 34] Jamie: I'm reeling it in, thinking "dinner is served!"
[Message 35] Alex: And...?
[Message 36] Jamie: It was my own hat.
[Message 37] Alex: (Bursts out laughing) You're kidding!
[Message 38] Jamie: I wish I was! I'd lost it earlier and didn't realize it.
[Message 39] Alex: The universe has a sense of humor, apparently.
[Message 40] Jamie: A cruel one, yes. All that effort for a soggy hat.
[Message 41] Alex: Did anyone see you?
[Message 42] Jamie: Thankfully, no. Just the seagulls judging me.
[Message 43] Alex: Seagulls are always judging. It's their job.
[Message 44] Jamie: True. Hey, quick question – you remember that new baking gadget I was looking at?
[Message 45] Alex: The one with the automatic frosting dispenser? Vaguely.
[Message 46] Jamie: Yeah, think I'm gonna bite the bullet and order it.
[Message 47] Alex: Do it! You deserve a little baking luxury.
[Message 48] Jamie: You're right. Treat myself!
[Message 49] Alex: What are you planning on baking next?
[Message 50] Jamie: I was thinking maybe a lemon meringue pie.
[Message 51] Alex: Ooh, fancy. Can I get a slice?
[Message 52] Jamie: Of course! Anytime. What about you, any accounting stories?
[Message 53] Alex: Other than Mark and his Excel adventures? Nothing too exciting, thankfully.
[Message 54] Jamie: Sometimes boring is good.
[Message 55] Alex: Absolutely. Keeps the stress levels down. Remember that audit last year?
[Message 56] Jamie: Don't remind me! Still having nightmares.
[Message 57] Alex: Tell me about it. We earned our salaries that month.
[Message 58] Jamie: We really did. Okay, new topic. Vacation plans?
[Message 59] Alex: Still dreaming of that trip to Italy.
[Message 60] Jamie: Ooh, Italy! Where do you want to go?
[Message 61] Alex: Florence, Rome, maybe a little time in Tuscany.
[Message 62] Jamie: Sounds amazing. I'm thinking of just staying put and doing some local fishing.
[Message 63] Alex: A relaxing staycation is good too!
[Message 64] Jamie: Exactly. Less hassle. More fish.
[Message 65] Alex: Fair enough! Did you see that article about the Austin bat colony?
[Message 66] Jamie: The Congress Avenue Bridge ones? Yeah, they're pretty cool.
[Message 67] Alex: I still need to go see them sometime.
[Message 68] Jamie: Definitely worth it! Especially at sunset.
[Message 69] Alex: Adding it to the Austin bucket list.
[Message 70] Jamie: Good idea! Okay, back to funny stories… I have another one about my cat.
[Message 71] Alex: Lay it on me! I love cat stories.
[Message 72] Jamie: So, Mittens decided to…
[Message 73] Alex: Wait! I just remembered another Mark story!
[Message 74] Jamie: Oh no... what now?
[Message 75] Alex: He asked me if we could expense his therapy sessions for "Excel-related trauma

[Message 1] Alex: "Just leaving the Post Office. Huge line! You still planning to vote early?"

[Message 6] Jamie: "Exactly! Say, you catching any good fish lately?"
[Message 7] Alex: "Haven't had much time, unfortunately. Work's been crazy. These sales targets are killing me!"
[Message 8] Jamie: "I hear you. Closing deals can be stressful. Maybe a fishing trip is what you need to de-stress after the election!"
[Message 9] Alex: "Haha, I wish. Back to the bill, though – I'm a bit worried about the potential tax implications."
[Message 10] Jamie: "Yeah, that's a valid concern. Nobody wants their taxes to go up. Have you seen any reliable analyses?"
[Message 11] Alex: "A few, but they're all so partisan! Hard to know what's really going on."
[Message 12] Jamie: "Tell me about it. Everything's so polarized these days. Makes having a rational conversation difficult."
[Message 13] Alex: "Absolutely. Anyway, I should get going. Gotta finalize this proposal. Big potential client."
[Message 14] Jamie: "Good luck! Hope you land it."
[Message 15] Alex: "Thanks! What about you? Anything exciting happening in the real estate world?"
[Message 16] Jamie: "Showing a renovated Victorian downtown this weekend. Fingers crossed someone makes an offer!"
[Message 17] Alex: "Victorian, huh? Those are beautiful. Hope it goes well!"
[Message 18] Jamie: "Thanks! I'm also working on a deal to help a friend of a friend buy a place. Lots of paperwork involved as you can imagine."
[Message 19] Alex: "I can imagine! All those contracts. Best of luck with that too."
[Message 20] Jamie: "Thanks, Alex! Talk to you later, maybe after the election dust settles

[Message 1] Liam: Hey Maya, you hear about what happened at the gallery?
[Message 2] Maya: Yeah, crazy. Two people dead. Recognize anyone?
[Message 3] Liam: No, thank god. Just hope they catch whoever did it.
[Message 4] Chloe: Heard it on the news. Brutal. Anyone know the victims?
[Message 5] Maya: I think I saw the Bartender, Daniel, around a few times. Seemed like an okay guy.
[Message 6] Liam: Daniel? Yeah, I think I served him once or twice.
[Message 7] Chloe: The manager was a woman right? What was her name?
[Message 8] Maya: Security Guard was Anna, I think. Always had that cynical look, poor thing.
[Message 9] Liam: Yeah, Anna. Sad.
[Message 10] Chloe: Anyway, I'm swamped. Catch you later.
[Message 11] Liam: Later.
[Message 12] Maya: Later Chloe.
[Message 13] Liam: Maya, you going to the memorial service?
[Message 14] Maya: Probably. Shows respect, right? You?
[Message 15] Liam: Yeah, thinking about it.
[Message 16] Maya: Good. It's today at 2 pm right?
[Message 17] Liam: I think so. Heard a rumor that the guy who was fired last week was seen leaving the gallery late morning.
[Message 18] Maya: Oh really? That's suspicious. What was his name?
[Message 19] Liam: Greg, I think.
[Message 20] Maya: Greg... I don't recognize the name.
[Message 21] Chloe: Did someone say Greg? What about him?
[Message 22] Liam: Just heard he might be a suspect.
[Message 23] Chloe: Well, hopefully they find out what happened. It’s terrible for Anna.
[Message 24] Maya: Agreed.
[Message 25] Liam: So, service at 2? I can give you a ride.
[Message 26] Maya: Sure, sounds good. I’ll see you there.
[Message 27] Liam: Perfect.
[Message 28] Chloe: Need to get back to work. Talk later.
[Message 29] Liam: Later.
[Message 30] Maya: Bye.
[Message 31] Liam: This whole thing is just messed up.
[Message 32] Maya: Tell me about it. What did you hear about Anna?
[Message 33] Liam: Just that she was always on edge. Apparently, Greg was obsessed with her.
[Message 34] Maya: Wow, really? That changes things.
[Message 35] Liam: Yeah, seems like a solid motive. He intended to do something stupid, probably.
[Message 36] Maya: Hope they catch him fast.
[Message 37] Liam: Me too. Hey, you see that new exhibit downtown?
[Message 38] Maya: No, what’s it like?
[Message 39] Liam: Really cool, modern stuff. You should check it out sometime.
[Message 40] Maya: I might, thanks for the tip.
[Message 41] Liam: No problem.
[Message 42] Chloe: Anyone know what time the gallery opened that morning?
[Message 43] Liam: Not sure, Chloe. Probably around 9 or 10?
[Message 44] Maya: Maybe earlier for staff?
[Message 45] Chloe: True. Just curious.
[Message 46] Liam: So, you thinking of going to the service too, Chloe?
[Message 47] Chloe: Maybe. Depends on work.
[Message 48] Maya: Understandable.
[Message 49] Liam: Alright, gotta run. See you at 2, Maya.
[Message 50] Maya: See ya.
[Message 51] Chloe: Later.
[Message 52] Maya: Later.
[Message 53] Maya: (Later that evening) Hey Liam, something's bugging me.
[Message 54] Liam: What's up?
[Message 55] Maya: Chloe seemed really interested in the gallery's opening time.
[Message 56] Liam: Yeah, I noticed that too. Weird, right?
[Message 57] Maya: I don't know... just a feeling.
[Message 58] Liam: Maybe she knew Daniel or Anna?
[Message 59] Maya: Maybe. Or maybe she knows something we don't.

[Message 63] Maya: Never mind. Wrong Pushing from a height. Just a figure of speech.

[Message 65] Maya: Not yet. Just wanted to see what you thought.
[Message 66] Liam: Good call. Let's not jump to conclusions.

[Message 164] Maya: Red herring! A distraction, maybe even something purposefully

[Message 1] Liam: Morning, everyone. Beautiful day, huh?
[Message 2] Maya: Morning, Liam. Yeah, it is.
[Message 3] Chloe: Morning. A little too bright for me.
[Message 4] Noah: Morning. Anyone catch the service this morning?
[Message 5] Olivia: Morning. I did, Noah. Pretty standard.
[Message 6] Liam: Standard is good, right? Keeps things…stable.
[Message 7] Chloe: Define stable.
[Message 8] Maya: Liam, you seem chipper. Something happen?
[Message 9] Liam: Just feeling good! Did… did anything happen last night?

[Message 12] Liam: Right, right. Definitions. Important. So, no… revelations?

[Message 16] Chloe: Sometimes sharing is… oversharing.

[Message 18] Liam: Boundaries. Noted. Just curious if anyone else felt… different this morning.
[Message 19] Maya: Different how?
[Message 20] Liam: Just… lighter. Unburdened. Like a weight’s been lifted.

[Message 22] Chloe: Or lack thereof.
[Message 23] Liam: Lack? Interesting. Lack of what, exactly?
[Message 24] Chloe: Don't play coy, Liam.
[Message 25] Olivia: Guys, let’s keep it civil.
[Message 26] Liam: Civil is my middle name! (It's not).
[Message 27] Maya: Anyone want to go for a walk later?
[Message 28] Noah: I'm in. Fresh air might do some good.
[Message 29] Liam: I'd love to, but… I have some…reflecting to do.
[Message 30] Chloe: Reflecting on what, Liam?
[Message 31] Liam: Just… things. You know. Life. The universe. Everything.
[Message 32] Olivia: Deep thoughts.
[Message 33] Maya: Anyone see Dr. Evans this morning?
[Message 34] Noah: I did. Same old, same old.
[Message 35] Liam: Dr. Evans. A pillar of… consistency.
[Message 36] Chloe: Consistency can be a cage.
[Message 37] Liam: A gilded cage, perhaps? With… certain… privileges?
[Message 38] Olivia: Liam, what are you implying?
[Message 39] Liam: Implying? Me? Never. Just…observing.
[Message 40] Maya: Let’s just drop it, okay?
[Message 41] Noah: Agreed. This is getting… uncomfortable.
[Message 42] Liam: Uncomfortable? Why? Unless… someone has something to hide?
[Message 43] Chloe: Everyone has something to hide, Liam. That's called being human.
[Message 44] Olivia: Exactly. Personal boundaries, remember?
[Message 45] Liam: Right, boundaries. Of course. But what about… shared responsibility?
[Message 46] Maya: Responsibility for what?
[Message 47] Liam: For…keeping the peace. Maintaining…order.
[Message 48] Noah: Sounds like you're talking about the staff.
[Message 49] Liam: Am I? Maybe. Or maybe I'm talking about… ourselves.
[Message 50] Chloe: You're being cryptic, Liam.
[Message 51] Liam: Cryptic? I'm just… asking questions.
[Message 52] Olivia: Too many questions.
[Message 53] Maya: Yeah, dial it back a bit, Liam.
[Message 54] Liam: Duly noted. But if something…did…happen, hypothetically speaking…would anyone say anything?
[Message 55] Noah: Hypothetically, it depends on what "it" is.
[Message 56] Chloe: And who "it" involves.
[Message 57] Liam: Point taken. So… mum's the word?
[Message 58] Olivia: If there’s nothing to tell.
[Message 59] Maya: Precisely. Nothing to tell.
[Message 60] Liam: Not even… a little whisper? A tiny hint?
[Message 61] Chloe: Zip it, Liam.
[Message 62] Noah: Some things are best left…unsaid.
[Message 63] Liam: But… what if not saying them is… worse?
[Message 64] Olivia: Worse for whom?
[Message 65] Maya: Let's change the subject. Anyone read anything good lately?
[Message 66] Liam: A classic deflection. Well played, Maya.
[Message 67] Chloe: Just trying to keep the peace, Liam.
[Message 68] Liam: Peace at what cost?
[Message 69] Noah: Cost of sanity, maybe?
[Message 70] Olivia: Cost of staying here, possibly.
[Message 71] Maya: Exactly. So, books? Anyone?
[Message 72] Liam: I’ve been reading the… faces around me. Very… revealing.
[Message 73] Chloe: You're going to give yourself a headache, Liam.
[Message 74] Noah: Agreed. Relax a bit.
[Message 75] Olivia: Seriously. We're supposed to be de-stressing.
[Message 76] Maya: Maybe we should all just meditate for a bit.
[Message 77] Liam: Meditate on… what, exactly? Our collective… silence?
[Message 78] Chloe: Meditate on breathing, Liam. Just breathe.
[Message 79] Noah: Yeah, focus on the present.
[Message 80] Olivia: Forget about last night.
[Message 81] Maya: Move on.
[Message 82] Liam: Easier said than done, perhaps? Especially when… certain images… linger.
[Message 83] Chloe: Images are fleeting, Liam.
[Message 84] Noah: They fade.
[Message 85] Olivia: They lose their power.
[Message 86] Maya: Just let them go.
[Message 87] Liam: I'll try. But if anyone… remembers anything… feel free to… share. Or not. Whatever.
[Message 88] Chloe: We got it, Liam.
[Message 89] Noah: Loud and clear.
[Message 90] Olivia: Message received.
[Message 91] Maya: Okay, I'm going for that walk. Anyone coming?
[Message 92] Noah: I'm still in.
[Message 93] Chloe: I need some air.
[Message 94] Olivia: Me too. See you guys outside.
[Message 95] Liam: Enjoy your… stroll. May you find… clarity. Or not.
[Message 96] Maya: Thanks, Liam.
[Message 97] Noah: We will.
[Message 98] Chloe: Hopefully.
[Message 99] Olivia: Yeah, bye Liam.
[Message 100] Liam: Goodbye. Remember…the…uh… golden rule?
[Message 101] Maya: Yes, Liam.
[Message 102] Noah: We remember.
[Message 103] Chloe: We always do.
[Message 104] Olivia: See ya.
[Message 105] Liam: Just wanted to… make sure. Safe travels!
[Message 106] Maya: Thanks.
[Message 107] Noah: Later.
[Message 108] Chloe: Later, Liam.
[Message 109] Olivia: Bye.
[Message 110] Liam: (To himself) Golden… indeed.

[Message 103] LIAM: "I'm back from camping. Didn't last the night."
[Message 104] CHLOE: "What happened? Too many bugs?"
[Message 105] LIAM: "Worse. I couldn't stop thinking about Judge Thompson. And then I saw something…"
[Message 106] CHLOE: "Saw what?"
[Message 107] LIAM: "Someone messing around near his cabin. It's out in the woods too, you know? I didn't get a good look, but…"
[Message 108] CHLOE: "Liam, are you saying you think someone was… planning something?"
[Message 109] LIAM: "I don't know what I'm saying, Chloe! I'm just… this whole thing is messed up."
[Message 110] CHLOE: "Okay, breathe. Did you call the police?"
[Message 111] LIAM: "No! I panicked and left. I didn't want to get involved."
[Message 112] CHLOE: "Liam, you need to tell them this! It could be important!"
[Message 113] LIAM: "I know, I know. But what if I'm wrong? What if it was nothing?"
[Message 114] CHLOE: "It's better to be safe than sorry. Please, Liam."
[Message 115] LIAM: "Okay, fine. I'll call them. But I'm scared, Chloe."
[Message 116] CHLOE: "I know you are. But you're doing the right thing. I'm proud of you. Let me know what they say."
[Message 117] LIAM: "Okay. Thanks, Chloe."
[Message 118] FINN: "Hey, Chloe, you hear about Liam?"
[Message 119] CHLOE: "Yeah, he just told me. What did you hear?"
[Message 120] FINN: "That he's telling the cops some crazy story about seeing someone near Judge Thompson's cabin."
[Message 121] CHLOE: "It's not crazy, Finn! He was genuinely scared!"
[Message 122] FINN: "Maybe. Or maybe he's trying to throw suspicion off himself. He always hated Judge Thompson"
[Message 123] CHLOE: "What? Why would he hate Judge Thompson?"
[Message 124] FINN: "I don't know. Just a vibe I got. Plus, he was always sucking up to him. Seems sus"
[Message 125] CHLOE: "Finn, that's ridiculous. Liam is just… upset. And scared."
[Message 126] FINN: "Whatever you say. I still think it's weird. Anyway, I'm going out for a bit. Need to clear my head."
[Message 127] CHLOE: "Be careful, Finn. And maybe don't spread rumors about Liam, okay?"
[Message 128] FINN: "Fine, fine. See ya."
[Message 129] LIAM: "Chloe, the police just left."
[Message 130] CHLOE: "What did they say? Did they believe you?"
[Message 131] LIAM: "They said they'd look into it. But they seemed… skeptical."
[Message 132] CHLOE: "That's all they said? Did they ask you anything else?"
[Message 133] LIAM: "Yeah, they asked me about my relationship with Judge Thompson. And about my alibi for the day of the murders."
[Message 134] CHLOE: "Alibi? Liam, are you a suspect?"
[Message 135] LIAM: "I don't know, Chloe! I hope not! I was at the gym all day! I failed to call 911 after seeing the man, making it worse."
[Message 136] CHLOE: "Okay, okay, calm down. Just tell them the truth. They'll figure it out."
[Message 137] LIAM: "I hope so. I really do. I can't believe this is happening. I wonder if they are going away for a long time because of this."
[Message 138] CHLOE: "Just stay calm, Liam. I'm here for you. You know that, right?"
[Message 139] LIAM: "Yeah. Thanks, Chloe. I appreciate it."
[Message 140] CHLOE: "Of course. Hey, did you hear from Finn?"
[Message 141] LIAM: "No. Why?"
[Message 142] CHLOE: "Just wondering. He seemed a little… off. After you told me about the cabin."
[Message 143] LIAM: "Off how?"
[Message 144] CHLOE: "I don't know… like he was trying to convince me you were guilty."
[Message 145] LIAM: "Finn? Really? That's… weird."
[Message 146] CHLOE: "Yeah. Just be careful, Liam. I don't trust him right now."
[Message 147] LIAM: "I'll keep that in mind. Thanks, Chloe. You're a good friend."
[Message 148] CHLOE: "Anytime, Liam."
[Message 149] FINN: "Hey Chloe, long time no talk"
[Message 150] CHLOE: "Finn, what do you want?"
[Message 151] FINN: "Just checking in. Heard Liam is getting heat from the cops."
[Message 152] CHLOE: "Yeah, because he did the right thing! Unlike some people..."
[Message 153] FINN: "Woah, hostile. Just saying, karma's a b**ch."
[Message 154] CHLOE: "Get out of my messages Finn"
[Message 155] FINN: "Whatever, Chloe."

[Message 1] Alex: Morning, team! Gorgeous sunrise on this hike. Ready for some laughs?
[Message 2] Jamie: You know it, Alex! Good morning everyone. Hikes and humor, best way to start the day.

[Message 9] Jamie: Okay, okay! It was at a charity event for kids. I was "supervising" the bouncy castle...
[Message 10] Jamie: ...and a huge gust of wind came and almost blew it away with me IN it! Kids were pointing and laughing.
[Message 11] Alex: Oh my god, Jamie! That's amazing (and slightly terrifying).

[Message 14] Jamie: Mostly okay, dignity slightly bruised.

[Message 16] Alex: ...and I accidentally let all the hamsters out of their cages.

[Message 18] Carol: A hamster stampede! I can just picture it.
[Message 19] Jamie: Did you manage to catch them all, Alex?
[Message 20] Alex: Eventually! Took about an hour and a lot of sunflower seeds.

[Message 22] Alex: Precisely, River. Precisely.
[Message 23] Carol: Okay, my turn. I was volunteering at a soup kitchen...
[Message 24] Carol: ...and I tripped and dropped a whole tray of mashed potatoes. Right in front of everyone.
[Message 25] Jamie: Oh no! That's the kind of thing that happens in movies.
[Message 26] Alex: Mashed potato carnage! Were people understanding?
[Message 27] River: Did you at least manage to salvage some of them?
[Message 28] Carol: They were very understanding, thankfully. And no, River, they were beyond saving.
[Message 29] Jamie: Food fights avoided, hopefully?
[Message 30] Carol: Thankfully, yes!
[Message 31] River: Alright, alright, my turn. This is from years ago...
[Message 32] River: I was volunteering at a tech workshop for seniors...
[Message 33] River: ...and I accidentally showed everyone how to use the wrong filter on Snapchat, resulting in some very interesting selfies.
[Message 34] Alex: Oh my god, River! Which filter?
[Message 35] Jamie: This is amazing. I need details!
[Message 36] Carol: Snapchat filters for seniors! This is the best.
[Message 37] River: Let's just say there were a lot of seniors sporting puppy ears and flower crowns.
[Message 38] Alex: I am absolutely dying.
[Message 39] Jamie: I wish I'd seen that!
[Message 40] Carol: Digital literacy with a touch of digital chaos.
[Message 41] Alex: Okay, these are all fantastic. But let’s lighten the mood – anyone seen a funny meme lately?
[Message 42] Jamie: Always! There's this one with a cat judging a salad…
[Message 43] Carol: Send it over, Jamie! I need a good laugh.
[Message 44] River: I’m always down for cat memes.
[Message 45] Jamie: (Sends a meme of a cat looking disgusted at a bowl of salad)
[Message 46] Alex: Perfection!
[Message 47] Carol: That cat speaks to my soul.
[Message 48] River: Majestic disapproval.
[Message 49] Alex: On a completely different note, anyone have any camping trips planned for this year?
[Message 50] Jamie: I'm hoping to get out to Shenandoah in the fall. The colors are amazing.
[Message 51] Carol: Shenandoah is beautiful! I haven't been in ages.
[Message 52] River: I've been tinkering with the idea of getting a new tent. My old one is starting to leak.
[Message 53] Alex: Definitely invest in a good one! Makes all the difference.
[Message 54] Jamie: What kind are you looking at, River?
[Message 55] River: Thinking about a lightweight backpacking tent. Something easy to carry.
[Message 56] Carol: Remember to check the weatherproofing!
[Message 57] Alex: Good point, Carol. Learn from my soggy experiences.
[Message 58] Jamie: Haha! Story time, Alex?
[Message 59] Alex: Another time, Jamie! Another time. Let’s get back to volunteering humor. Anyone ever had a wardrobe malfunction while volunteering?
[Message 60] Carol: Oh lord, I hope not!
[Message 61] River: Now you're making me nervous. I always overdress for everything.
[Message 62] Jamie: I once ripped my pants while moving boxes at a food bank. Had to tie a sweatshirt around my waist.
[Message 63] Alex: That's resourceful!
[Message 64] Carol: You're a survivor, Jamie!
[Message 65] River: Always good to have a backup sweatshirt. Lesson learned.
[Message 66] Alex: I’m now picturing a whole series of “volunteering fail” memes.

[Message 70] Alex: Someone get on that!
[Message 71] Jamie: You got it! I’ll create it later.
[Message 72] Carol: Excellent! Now, back to the trail… feeling that Virginia Beach breeze.
[Message 73] River: The ocean air is doing wonders.
[Message 74] Alex: Agreed. So refreshing.

[Message 76] Carol: Oh, what did you learn?

[Message 83] Jamie: I'm keeping up!
[Message 84] Carol: Steady and strong!

[Message 94] Alex: I aim to please.
[Message 95] Jamie: My turn! What do you call a lazy kangaroo?

[Message 1] Liam: "Anyone else catch the news about what happened at the Botanical Garden?"

[Message 6] Alex: "Photos? You like photography?"
[Message 7] Kai: "Sometimes. Mostly landscapes. Needed a new profile picture for my app. The Botanical Garden looked so pretty, but I'm not sure the cops believe it's for profile picture."
[Message 8] Liam: "You talked to the cops?"
[Message 9] Kai: "Yeah, standard procedure, I guess. Being nearby and all."
[Message 10] Alex: "Right. Did they ask about anyone specific?"
[Message 11] Kai: "Nah, just general questions about who I saw, if anything seemed off. I mentioned seeing someone arguing near the rose garden, but didn't recognize them."

[Message 14] Kai: "Agreed. Need caffeine. This whole thing is unsettling."
[Message 15] Liam: "Okay, but back to the argument. Did it sound heated?"
[Message 16] Kai: "Now that I think about it, yes, heated enough that I purposefully walked away. The guy's voice was familiar, but I can’t place it. It reminded me of Terry."
[Message 17] Alex: "Terry? What's Terry got to do with this?"
[Message 18] Liam: "Yeah, Alex is right. Terry barely knew Caleb."
[Message 19] Kai: "Maybe. Terry wasn’t a fan of Caleb's activist work. You know, all that protesting downtown. Called it a nuisance."
[Message 20] Alex: "Okay, that doesn't mean anything. Lots of people found the protests annoying."
[Message 21] Liam: "True. I mean, I secretly thought they blocked the traffic for way too long."
[Message 22] Kai: "The real problem is the death penalty. Do you think they'll push for it?"
[Message 23] Alex: "Hope not, but you never know with cases like this."
[Message 24] Liam: "Hey, anyone want to grab a pizza tonight? Need to get my mind off this."
[Message 25] Kai: "Pizza sounds good. I'm in. But I can only stay until 8:30. Got a thing."
[Message 26] Alex: "Count me out. Need to, um, catch up on some sleep."
[Message 27] Liam: "Alright, Alex. More for us, then! What time Kai?"
[Message 28] Kai: "How about 7?"
[Message 29] Liam: "Perfect. See you then. Alex, feel better!"
[Message 30] Alex: "Thanks, Liam. You guys have fun."
[Message 31] Liam: "So, Kai, back to the Botanical Garden, did you see anyone else suspicious?"
[Message 32] Kai: "Just an older lady feeding the birds. She looked harmless. But she mentioned needing Electrocution to deal with the rats in her garden."
[Message 33] Liam: "Hmm, odd coincidence. Electrocution again..."
[Message 34] Kai: "Yeah, tell me about it. I even saw her looking at the manager earlier that day, like she wanted to say something."
[Message 35] Liam: "The manager? You think she did it? Maybe she purposefully didn't do anything when she found him?"
[Message 36] Kai: "I'm not saying she did it, but it was definitely a weird vibe. And people say she hated him because he kept firing her relatives."
[Message 37] Liam: "Okay, that's a motive."
[Message 38] Alex: "Hey guys, sorry to interrupt. Just saw something online about the case. Apparently, the victim had a huge argument with someone named River the day before."
[Message 39] Kai: "River? I don't think I know River. Maybe River intended to hurt Caleb."
[Message 40] Liam: "River! River is obsessed with Kai. Maybe jealous of his photography. It can't be, right?"
[Message 41] Alex: "Obsessed? That's creepy. What's River like?"
[Message 42] Liam: "Kind of intense. Always showing up where Kai is. Always staring. It's weird."
[Message 43] Kai: "It's true, she is a little intense. I try to avoid her. It's hard to get rid of her."
[Message 44] Alex: "Maybe River did it out of jealousy, hoping to impress Kai? River always hated activist, if I recall."
[Message 45] Liam: "That would be messed up. Hope they find out the truth soon."
[Message 46] Kai: "Me too. I saw Terry leaving near the botanical garden at midnight. That's kind of weird too, right? Terry always knew I was there, at the Botanical Garden."
[Message 47] Alex: "Midnight? What was Terry doing there at midnight? Did he always hate Caleb?"
[Message 48] Liam: "Maybe he was looking for something? Seems sus."
[Message 49] Kai: "Yeah, seems suspicious. I should have called the cops."
[Message 50] Alex: "Did you see Terry near Caleb?"
[Message 51] Kai: "Nah, just Terry by the entrance. I assumed Terry was leaving, like me. He always hated activist."
[Message 52] Liam: "Maybe Terry came back later?"
[Message 53] Alex: "I need some fresh air. Going for a walk."
[Message 54] Kai: "Okay, Alex. Stay safe."
[Message 55] Liam: "Yeah, call if you need anything."
[Message 56] Liam: "Hey Kai, you still coming for pizza? Just confirming."
[Message 57] Kai: "Yep, see you soon."
[Message 58] Liam: "Cool. So, River… You think she’s capable of something like this? Maybe her shouting provoked Terry. "
[Message 59] Kai: "I don't know, Liam. People are capable of anything. But Terry was talking about hurting Caleb right before he went over there."
[Message 60] Liam: "Whoa, seriously? You heard him say that?"
[Message 61] Kai: "Yeah, kind of brushed it off as just angry venting. Now I feel terrible."
[Message 62] Liam: "I think you should tell the police that. It could be important. They’re going away for a long time for this."
[Message 63] Kai: "I will. After pizza. I'm hungry and nervous."
[Message 64] Alex: "Guys, I'm back. And I just remembered something. A couple weeks ago, I overheard Terry on the phone, talking about “getting rid of” someone. I thought he was talking about his landlord."
[Message 65] Liam: "Whoa, Alex! That's huge! Getting rid of someone... that sounds intentional."
[Message 66] Kai: "He was looking up how to make Electrocution online, I'm pretty sure. Maybe that's the someone he was talking about."
[Message 67] Alex: "Seriously? Getting rid of the activists. Guys, this is too much."
[Message 68] Liam: "Yeah, this is getting really intense. I'm starting to feel uneasy."
[Message 69] Kai: "Me too. I need to think about this. I'm not sure I can do pizza anymore."

[Message 71] Kai: "Sorry, Liam. I just need some space. I think I was aware of what was going on, but just didn't want to admit it."
[Message 72] Alex: "Maybe Terry's motivations aren't so obvious. Maybe it wasn't about the activism."
[Message 73] Liam: "What do you mean, Alex? You think it was personal?"
[Message 74] Alex: "I don't know. Just a feeling. Something's not adding up."
[Message 75] Kai: "I'm going to call the police."
[Message 76] Liam: "Good. Do it. I'll go with you."
[Message 77] Alex: "Wait, guys. I need to tell you something. Something I haven't mentioned before."
[Message 78] Kai: "What is it, Alex?"

[Message 82] Kai: "I knew it! River is crazy."
[Message 83] Liam: "We need to tell the police everything. All of it."
[Message 84] Alex: "Agreed. This needs to end. I tried to talk him out of it."
[Message 85] Kai: "Let's go together. Right now."

[Message 1] Agnes: Hey everyone, just got here to the car wash waiting area. Beautiful dusk tonight!

[Message 45] Agnes: Absolutely! Michelangelo's David is just awe-inspiring.

[Message 52] Alex: No problem! Always happy to share my obscure art knowledge.

[Message 1] Alex: "This waiting room is always so busy. Hope the wait isn't too long."
[Message 2] Jamie: "Tell me about it, Alex. I've been here almost an hour already."
[Message 3] River: "I brought a book. Helps pass the time."
[Message 4] Alex: "Good idea, River. I should have thought of that. What are you reading?"
[Message 5] River: "Just a biography of Ruth Bader Ginsburg. Interesting woman."
[Message 6] Jamie: "Speaking of strong women, I need some advice. I'm trying to negotiate a new rate with a client, and they're lowballing me."
[Message 7] Alex: "That's tough, Jamie. What kind of work do you do?"
[Message 8] Jamie: "I'm a nurse. Private care for elderly patients."
[Message 9] Alex: "Ah, a fellow caregiver! I'm a physical therapist. My advice? Know your worth. Highlight your experience and the value you bring."
[Message 10] River: "Exactly. Don't be afraid to walk away. There are other clients out there who will appreciate your skills."
[Message 11] Jamie: "That's what I needed to hear. It's easy to get caught up in the pressure of needing the work."
[Message 12] Alex: "Remember, your time and expertise are valuable. Have you researched what other nurses in your area are charging?"
[Message 13] Jamie: "I've done some digging online, but it's hard to find accurate numbers."
[Message 14] River: "Maybe network with other nurses. See if you can get some inside information. Professional organizations might have resources."
[Message 15] Jamie: "That's a great idea, River. I'll look into that. Thanks!"
[Message 16] Alex: "No problem! Sometimes, it just helps to vent and get a fresh perspective."
[Message 17] River: "Indeed. By the way, Alex, you mentioned being a physical therapist. Have you seen much improvement with the new wearable tech people are using for rehab?"
[Message 18] Alex: "Some, yes. It's not a magic bullet, but it can be a useful tool for tracking progress and motivating patients. Especially for younger folks."
[Message 19] Jamie: "Fascinating. Everything is becoming tech-driven, isn't it?"
[Message 20] Alex: "It is. Keeps us on our toes! But good old-fashioned hands-on therapy still has its place."
[Message 21] Jamie: "Absolutely. Empathy and human connection are irreplaceable."
[Message 22] River: "Heard! What about you, River? What line of work are you in?"
[Message 23] River: "I'm a mechanic. Not much tech involved there... mostly grease and elbow grease!"
[Message 24] Alex: "Haha! I bet you see some interesting vehicles."
[Message 25] River: "Oh, you wouldn't believe it. Everything from vintage cars to beat-up trucks. Keeps life interesting."
[Message 26] Jamie: "My car's been making a funny noise lately. Maybe I should bring it to you sometime, River?"
[Message 27] River: "Sure, Jamie. Stop by the shop anytime. We'll take a look."
[Message 28] Jamie: "Awesome, thanks! Back to the client thing, I think practicing my negotiation skills will help."
[Message 29] Alex: "Role-playing can be helpful. Practice with a friend or family member."
[Message 30] River: "That's a good idea. Or even just writing down your key points can make you feel more confident."
[Message 31] Jamie: "I will definitely try that. This whole waiting room talk helped a lot, thanks you two."
[Message 32] Alex: "Anytime, Jamie! We're all in this together."
[Message 33] River: "Yep! Hope you get that rate you deserve."
[Message 34] Alex: "Oh, they're calling my name. Good luck, Jamie, River! Nice chatting with you both."
[Message 35] Jamie: "You too, Alex! Hope your appointment goes well

[Message 1] CHLOE: Hey Liam, you okay? Heard about what happened at Town Hall.

[Message 2] LIAM: Yeah, Chloe, it’s messed up. I knew both Kai and Jordan. Especially Jordan, we worked together.

[Message 3] CHLOE: I can't believe that 9.  Bartender is gone. Poor Kai

[Message 4] LIAM: Right?

[Message 6] CHLOE: Amelia? Really? What was she doing?

[Message 7] LIAM: Ash, are you sure? Did you actually see her?

[Message 9] CHLOE: Arguing? About what? This is getting weirder. You know Amelia got fired from town hall?

[Message 11] ASH: Few weeks ago, apparently. Something about her performance. Jordan was the one who signed off on it, I think.

[Message 12] CHLOE: This is insane. Did she knew about Jordan?

[Message 13] LIAM: Probably. Everyone knew each other.

[Message 14] ASH: Anyone hear from Ben? He was always complaining about Kai being too loud during his shifts.

[Message 15] CHLOE: Ben? Nah. He's probably just holed up somewhere playing video games. He always hated 9.  Bartender though.

[Message 16] LIAM: Yeah, Ben's a bit of a loner. Wonder if the cops have talked to him.

[Message 17] ASH: They must have. Liam, you working today?

[Message 18] LIAM: No, thankfully. Took the day off. Needed it.

[Message 19] CHLOE: I'm going to need a drink later. You in?

[Message 22] CHLOE: Okay, good. I'm so shaken up from this.

[Message 23] LIAM: Me too. Thinking of Jordan’s family. This is messed up.

[Message 24] ASH: Okay, I’m heading to work. Catch you guys later.

[Message 26] LIAM: Later.

[Message 29] CHLOE: Yeah, it's suspicious. But Pushing from a height seems so… premeditated.

[Message 37] CHLOE: Remember how furious Ben was when Kai shorted him a drink?

[Message 38] LIAM: Vaguely. Everyone gets mad about short drinks. It's not a motive for murder.

[Message 39] CHLOE: True. Just trying to think of anything.

[Message 40] LIAM: Me too. This is going to be all over the news for weeks.

[Message 41] CHLOE: The media is going to eat this up.

[Message 42] LIAM: Definitely.

[Message 44] CHLOE: I can imagine.

[Message 45] LIAM: Yeah, it must be.

[Message 47] CHLOE: That’s everyone at Town Hall, then.

[Message 48] LIAM: Almost. This is insane.

[Message 50] CHLOE: Yeah, sounds good. I need a strong one. Or five.

[Message 51] LIAM: Make that six for me.

[Message 52] ASH: Haha, alright. See you both later.

[Message 53] CHLOE: Later.

[Message 54] LIAM: Later.

[Message 55] CHLOE: Liam, you think they’ll ever catch whoever did this?

[Message 56] LIAM: I hope so, Chloe. For Jordan and Kai's families. And for our peace of mind.

[Message 57] CHLOE: Me too. It's terrifying to think someone we know is capable of something like this.

[Message 58] LIAM: Exactly. It’s like something out of a movie.

[Message 59] CHLOE: A horror movie.

[Message 60] LIAM: Definitely.

[Message 61] ASH: Hey, you guys still on for tonight? Just checking.

[Message 63] LIAM: Still in.

[Message 71] CHLOE: I know, but… what if it was Jordan? Or Kai?

[Message 72] LIAM: Maybe. We're reaching, Chloe.

[Message 73] CHLOE: I know, I know. Just thinking out loud. This whole thing feels… off.

[Message 74] LIAM: Agreed.

[Message 76] CHLOE: No worries.

[Message 77] LIAM: Cool.

[Message 79] LIAM: I did notice that, yeah. What do you think it means?

[Message 80] CHLOE: I don't know. Maybe she knows more than she's letting on. Or maybe she's just uncomfortable talking about it.

[Message 83] LIAM: Me too. It's exhausting.

[Message 102] CHLOE: Just wondering if you remembered anything else. Any details.

[Message 105] CHLOE: Yeah, no pressure.

[Message 107] LIAM: Yeah. Stressful for everyone.

[Message 108] CHLOE: Definitely.

[Message 109] ASH: You guys think they’ll find the person who did this soon?

[Message 110] CHLOE: I hope so. The sooner, the better.

[Message 111] LIAM: Me too.

[Message 112] ASH: Well, I’m gonna head home. This beer is making me sleepy.

[Message 113] CHLOE: Alright. Get home safe.

[Message 114] LIAM: Yeah, be careful.

[Message 115] ASH: Will do. Later.

[Message 116] CHLOE: Later.

[Message 117] LIAM: Bye.

[Message 118] CHLOE: Liam, I am so convinced Ash is hiding something.

[Message 119] LIAM: I know. But what could it be?

[Message 120] CHLOE: Maybe… maybe she was there too. Maybe she saw more than she's letting on because she was involved somehow. She was talking about hurting her right before he went over there.

[Message 122] CHLOE: I know, but think about it! She changed the subject, she was vague about the argument, and she seemed really eager to leave tonight.

[Message 124] CHLOE: Maybe. But I don't trust her.

[Message 125] LIAM: Okay, what do we do?

[Message 126] CHLOE: I don't know. But I think we need to be careful around her.

[Message 127] LIAM: Agreed. Let's just keep our eyes open.

[Message 128] CHLOE: Okay. I'm going home too. This night has been too much.

[Message 129] LIAM: Me too. Get home safe.

[Message 130] CHLOE: You too.

[Message 131] LIAM: Night.

[Message 132] CHLOE: Night.

[Message 136] CHLOE: Okay, Liam, we need to go to the police.

[Message 137] LIAM: I think you're right.

[Message 138] CHLOE: First thing in the morning.

[Message 1] Sarah: "Did you see Mark earlier?"
[Message 2] David: "Yeah, by the refreshments. Why?"

[Message 4] David: "Off how?"
[Message 5] Sarah: "Just… distracted. He's becoming a liability."
[Message 6] David: "That's... strong. A liability?"
[Message 7] Sarah: "Things aren't as contained as they were."
[Message 8] David: "He knew the risks. We all did."
[Message 9] Sarah: "Knowing and handling are different things."
[Message 10] David: "True. Has anyone spoken to him?"
[Message 11] Sarah: "I think Susan tried. Didn't go well."
[Message 12] David: "Right. Susan. Well, maybe it's just stress. This quarter..."
[Message 13] Sarah: "It's more than the quarter, David."
[Message 14] David: "So, what do you suggest?"
[Message 15] Sarah: "I don't know, but something needs to happen. Before..."
[Message 16] David: "Before what?"
[Message 17] Sarah: "Before it all falls apart."
[Message 18] David: "Look, I'm sure he'll pull through. He always does."
[Message 19] Sarah: "I'm not so sure this time. He's... compromised."
[Message 20] David: "Compromised how? Details?"
[Message 21] Sarah: "I can't say. Just... be careful around him."

[Message 1] Alex: "Ugh, another night, another weird dream. This time I was negotiating a business deal... with talking squirrels."
[Message 2] Morgan: "Talking squirrels? Sounds like you need more sleep, Alex. I dreamt I was back in the classroom, grading papers that never ended."
[Message 3] Alex: "Haha, that sounds like *your* kind of nightmare, Morgan. At least squirrels are slightly more entertaining than student essays, no offense."
[Message 4] Morgan: "None taken. Essays are the bane of my existence. Did these squirrels at least offer you a good deal?"
[Message 5] Alex: "Honestly, I can't even remember the details. Just a lot of tiny voices and frantic gestures involving nuts. I woke up stressed!"
[Message 6] Morgan: "Stress dreams are the worst. I think it's the Denver altitude getting to us both."
[Message 7] Alex: "Could be. Or maybe it's the campfire smoke. Makes everything hazy."
[Message 8] Morgan: "True. Speaking of hazy, did you see that vintage Mustang parked down the road earlier? Gorgeous."
[Message 9] Alex: "Oh yeah! Cherry red, right? I meant to get a closer look. You know your cars."
[Message 10] Morgan: "It was a beauty. Probably worth more than my retirement fund."
[Message 11] Alex: "Retirement funds... Now *that's* a stressful topic."
[Message 12] Morgan: "Tell me about it. Anyway, back to your squirrel business deal. What were they selling, exactly?"
[Message 13] Alex: "I wish I knew! Maybe it was political commentary disguised as rodent capitalism. Who knows what my subconscious is up to."
[Message 14] Morgan: "Ha! Political commentary. Now *that* would be truly terrifying. Everything's so polarized these days."
[Message 15] Alex: "You're telling me. Even in my dreams, I can't escape it."
[Message 16] Morgan: "I try to avoid it. Just stick to classic cars and the occasional documentary about birds."
[Message 17] Alex: "Birds, huh? Peaceful. Maybe I should take up birdwatching."
[Message 18] Morgan: "It's surprisingly relaxing. Although, they can be surprisingly territorial little creatures."
[Message 19] Alex: "Sounds a bit like the trucking industry, now that I think about it."
[Message 20] Morgan: "Everything's competitive, I suppose. Even squirrels selling...whatever they were selling."
[Message 21] Alex: "Exactly! The dog-eat-dog (or squirrel-eat-nut) world."
[Message 22] Morgan: "So, are you planning on analyzing your dream further, or just chalking it up to campfire weirdness?"
[Message 23] Alex: "Probably just campfire weirdness. Unless I start seeing squirrels in pinstripe suits."
[Message 24] Morgan: "If that happens, I'm recommending a vacation. Preferably far, far away from Denver."
[Message 25] Alex: "Deal. Somewhere with no squirrels and no political debates."
[Message 26] Morgan: "And definitely no endless stacks of essays to grade."
[Message 27] Alex: "Agreed. So, what are you dreaming about tonight?"
[Message 28] Morgan: "Hopefully something involving winning the lottery and buying that Mustang."
[Message 29] Alex: "Now *that's* a dream worth having."
[Message 30] Morgan: "Indeed. Maybe I should start sleeping with a lottery ticket under my pillow."
[Message 31] Alex: "Wouldn't hurt to try. Speaking of pillows, mine's gone completely flat."
[Message 32] Morgan: "Mine's not much better. Camping pillows are never luxurious."
[Message 33] Alex: "Nope. Maybe we should invest in some inflatable ones for next time."
[Message 34] Morgan: "Good idea. I'll add it to the list. Along with a squirrel-proof business plan."
[Message 35] Alex: "Haha! Please do. I'd love to see that."
[Message 36] Morgan: "It'll be a bestseller, I'm sure. 'Negotiating with Squirrels: A Pessimist's Guide.'"
[Message 37] Alex: "I'd buy it! Especially if it includes tips for dealing with overly enthusiastic negotiators."
[Message 38] Morgan: "Those are the worst. Especially when they're armed with acorns."
[Message 39] Alex: "Acorns of mass destruction!"
[Message 40] Morgan: "Precisely. The future is terrifying."
[Message 41] Alex: "Optimistic, aren't we?"
[Message 42] Morgan: "Realistically pessimistic. There's a difference."
[Message 43] Alex: "Fair enough. I guess I'm more of a cautiously optimistic person myself."
[Message 44] Morgan: "Admirable. Someone has to be."
[Message 45] Alex: "So, you think my dream squirrels were just a reflection of my anxieties about business dealings?"
[Message 46] Morgan: "Probably. Or maybe you just need to eat fewer nuts before bed."
[Message 47] Alex: "Could be. I did have a handful of trail mix before hitting the sleeping bag."
[Message 48] Morgan: "There you go. Mystery solved."
[Message 49] Alex: "Simple as that, huh?"
[Message 50] Morgan: "Usually is. Most of our weird dreams are just our brains processing the day's events in a bizarre way."
[Message 51] Alex: "Makes sense. I had a crazy day on the road yesterday."
[Message 52] Morgan: "Long haul?"
[Message 53] Alex: "Yep. Denver to Colorado Springs and back. Traffic was a nightmare."
[Message 54] Morgan: "I can imagine. I try to avoid driving during peak hours."
[Message 55] Alex: "Smart move. Especially in a classic car like yours."
[Message 56] Morgan: "She's a delicate flower. Needs to be treated with respect."
[Message 57] Alex: "I understand. My truck's the same way. Gotta baby it to keep it running smoothly."
[Message 58] Morgan: "Exactly. So, less trail mix, more relaxation. That's my prescription for your squirrel problem."
[Message 59] Alex: "I'll try it. Although, relaxation isn't exactly my strong suit."
[Message 60] Morgan: "Practice makes perfect. Start with some deep breaths and a nice cup of chamomile tea."
[Message 61] Alex: "Chamomile tea... Sounds a little too peaceful for me."
[Message 62] Morgan: "Hey, you asked for help! I'm just offering solutions."
[Message 63] Alex: "Okay, okay. I'll try the tea. But if I start dreaming about talking chamomile flowers, I'm blaming you."
[Message 64] Morgan: "Deal. But if you start making millions selling chamomile flower merchandise, I get a cut."
[Message 65] Alex: "Haha! You're on. 50/50 split."
[Message 66] Morgan: "Generous. I like the way you do business."
[Message 67] Alex: "Only with friends. Squirrels get no deals."
[Message 68] Morgan: "Good policy. They'd probably just hoard all the profits anyway."
[Message 69] Alex: "True. They're notoriously bad with finances."
[Message 70] Morgan: "Absolutely. Spend it all on nuts and forget about retirement."
[Message 71] Alex: "Exactly! No long-term planning whatsoever."
[Message 72] Morgan: "A cautionary tale for us all."
[Message 73] Alex: "Indeed. Don't be like the squirrels."
[Message 74] Morgan: "Words to live by."
[Message 75] Alex: "So, ready for another potentially dream-filled night?"
[Message 76] Morgan: "As ready as I'll ever be. Hoping for that lottery win."
[Message 77] Alex: "Me too. Or at least a peaceful night's sleep."
[Message 78] Morgan: "That would be a victory in itself."
[Message 79] Alex: "Definitely. A victory over the squirrels, the traffic, and the flat pillows."
[Message 80] Morgan: "A trifecta of triumphs!"
[Message 81] Alex: "Here's hoping. Good night, Morgan."
[Message 82] Morgan: "Good night, Alex. Sweet dreams (or at least not *too* weird ones)."
[Message 83] Alex: "Thanks! You too."
[Message 84] Morgan: "I’m going to try some white noise tonight. See if that helps."
[Message 85] Alex: "Good idea! I should probably do that too."
[Message 86] Morgan: "There are some good apps for it."
[Message 87] Alex: "Thanks, I’ll look into that!"
[Message 88] Morgan: "Alright. Sleep well!"
[Message 89] Alex: "You too!"
[Message 90] Alex: "Hey, Morgan, you still up?"
[Message 91] Morgan: "Yeah, tossing and turning. White noise isn’t working."
[Message 92] Alex: "Same here! I keep thinking about those squirrels."
[Message 93] Morgan: "Ugh, they’re haunting us!"
[Message 94] Alex: "Maybe we should have set a squirrel trap."
[Message 95] Morgan: "Ha! Then we'd have squirrel-related guilt on top of weird dreams."
[Message 96] Alex: "Good point. I just want to sleep!"
[Message 97] Morgan: "Me too. Maybe a short walk?"
[Message 98] Alex: "That’s not a bad idea. Some fresh air might help."
[Message 99] Morgan: "Meet me by the campfire in 5?"
[Message 100] Alex: "Sounds like a plan."
[Message 101] Morgan: "Okay. See you there."
[Message 102] Alex: "Yep."
[Message 103] Alex: "The stars are pretty clear tonight."
[Message 104] Morgan: "They are. Helps to put things in perspective, doesn't it?"
[Message 105] Alex: "Definitely. Makes the squirrel-based anxiety seem a little less significant."
[Message 106] Morgan: "Exactly. We're tiny specks on a tiny planet. Squirrels are even tinier."
[Message 107] Alex: "True, they're just fluffy little specks with negotiating skills."
[Message 108] Morgan: "Don't underestimate their power. They control the nut market."
[Message 109] Alex: "A valid point. Global nut domination."
[Message 110] Morgan: "It's the next big threat. Forget AI, worry about squirrels."
[Message 111] Alex: "I'm adding that to my list of anxieties."
[Message 112] Morgan: "You're welcome. Anything to help."
[Message 113] Alex: "So, any better ideas for conquering insomnia?"
[Message 114] Morgan: "Counting sheep? Although, they might turn into squirrel-sheep hybrid creatures."
[Message 115] Alex: "Oh god, please no."
[Message 116] Morgan: "Okay, scratch that idea. How about focusing on pleasant memories?"
[Message 117] Alex: "Like what? Happy trucking stories?"
[Message 118] Morgan: "Whatever works! A beautiful sunset, a good cup of coffee, a friendly face."
[Message 119] Alex: "Okay, I'll try that. Good coffee... that's definitely a happy thought."
[Message 120] Morgan: "Me too. I can almost taste it."
